story:
Short Summary

Nashville country music artist CJ Garton and his oldest son Clinton are taking a “Ride For Real Country Music”.  
They will be traveling by horseback from the singers home in Nashville to his family ranch in Oklahoma. 

The month-long journey will focus on father-son time, being in tune with nature, and songwriting and reflecting. It’s a trip CJ has often thought about and now is the time. 

CJ and Clinton will start the trek in July on their horses Pancho and Lefty. They will make friends along the way, camp, and share some of the songs CJ writes daily on the trail or has written including his new single “The Gun”.

What We Need & What You Get

What We Need

We need your support to raise $25,000 that will help recoup our expenses for the trip, the time we've taken off, and to help fund the editing and film for the project and the upcoming album for the songs written and played on this trip.

 What You Get

All items below will be on a donation level from bronze, silver, gold, diamond, and platinum

Blooper Reel

Raw Footage

Signed  Copies of the new album and the documentary

A Copy of the Album a Few Days Early Before the Official release

A Chance to get some of the actual items used on the trip

Country Boy/City Boy Survival Kit

Merchandise, Merchandise, Merchandise

 

The Impact

We hope to create awareness for real country artists and shine a spotlight on them. To help promote each other and let fans see there is a movement for young artists doing traditional country.

To give Clinton (that's my son) an opportunity to see the world a different way, and experience the outdoors as well as the opportunity to further his aspirations of becoming a film creator through filming, directing, and editing the entire experience. 

But most importantly, spending time with each other, and building a stronger bond between father and son and creating and documenting an adventure that will last a lifetime, not only for ourselves but for generations to come.

To inspire others to chase their dreams and know that no dream is too big to accomplish.

Risks & Challenges

There's gonna be a lot of challenges on the way, from animals to terrain to weather. The dangers include:

Bears

Mountain Lions

Hogs

Lions

Tigers

Bears

heat 

snakes

coyotes 

skunks

rapids

wear on the backsides

insects

weather

people

rivers

thickets

briars

and more

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, Share, Share! No amount is too small! We are just grateful for your support. Power in numbers.

Our Facebook is https://www.facebook.com/CJGarton1/

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/cjgarton

Website: www.cjgarton.com

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/cjgartonofficial/

And that's all there is to it. Thanks for all your support!

story:
What is The Main Grimsby 

The Main Grimsby is an IGTV show created by two Grimsby, Ontario residents that features local small businesses and restaurants:

  • Adam and Ricki are the creators and hosts of the IGTV show. Adam has backgrounds in film production and writing and has lived in Grimsby and surrounding areas for most of his life. Ricki is a born-and-raised resident of Grimsby and is a mother of two young girls. She studied Theatre Production, English and Education and spent many years working with youth in the area. Adam and Ricki have known each other since childhood and work together to combine their passions for the betterment of their community. 
  • This campaign is meaningful after the devastating effects of the Covid-19 pandemic on small businesses and the general economy. After struggling through the emotional and financial effects of a difficult separation, Ricki is passionate about giving back to the Grimsby community. 
  • The growing small town is full of beautiful stories and generosity and raising funds to produce The Main Grimsby will help stimulate the local economy by bringing current and relevant information to the residents and provide a strong platform of exposure to the businesses working hard to rebuild.

What it means to REP THE 40

"Rep the 40" is the hashtag used on every episode of The Main Grimsby on IGTV. Viewers are encouraged to post, share and tag their own experiences using the hashtag to grow awareness and build community support through social media:

  • By pre-ordering "Rep The 40" apparel, residents, business owners, families and staff teams can all show their community pride while supporting and shopping locally.

CORPORATE SPONSORSHIP

story:
What is Just A Slice?

Just A Slice is an impromptu web-series (8 episodes, 30-45 minutes), about a group of people getting together to do something they used to do as a kid, for fun. 

I think about my childhood a lot. From cartoon shows, to elementary school field trips, to pizza parties, to game nights, to Halloween, etc. 

I've always wanted to create a project that allowed me to not only venture back into my childhood, but venture into other people's childhood as well. 

I've never been so passionate about a project before. With recent events in the US, I felt a strong urge to make this web-series happen. I cannot do it without your generous support. 

There's this thought, in the world, that in order to accomplish one's calling, purpose or goals, they need to abandon the child-like qualities inside of them. Which is not true.

If anything, your child-like characteristics allow you to accomplish your calling, your purpose or your goals. 

"Imagine if all adults brought a child-like energy to their workplaces, their organizations, and the pursuit of their own goals? We would definitely see a sharp increase in productivity and innovation."

(Ayodeji Awosika, 2015). From his article: "7 Childlike Traits We Should Recapture To Live A Happier Life". 

This web-series will be dedicated to my Mom, who died after her 4-year battle with breast cancer in August 2019. 

 

Those that knew her knew how amazing she was. She was a positive light in so many people's lives. Including mine. When you were around her, you were the most important person in the room. Her death affected me greatly. If there's anything I can do, it's doing the best dedication I can for her. Which I cannot do without your support. 

 

People Involved

Christian Ely

Cinematographer

Christian Ely is a talented freelance cinematographer who's been in the business for 5 years. He's worked with Fit Society AZ, 1 Way Apparel, Skyline Dental, and more. He's worked on several wedding films as well. His mission is to inspire people through impactful stories. He believes everyone has a story and he strives to ensure he can help people shape their story and share it with the world.

 

Daniel Joseph White

Composer

Daniel Joseph White is a freelance composer and orchestrator who resides in the Inland Northwest with his wife, Alison. His passion is in composing rich, eloquent and moving music for any project type. He composed the music in my documentary: Just A Podcast. 

 

Michael Burnett

Writer/ Director 

Michael Burnett was born and raised in Brooklyn, New York. After seeing: The Avengers, Michael decided to pursue his passion for filmmaking. He's in the works of getting a Bachelors of Arts in Digital Film at GCU. His most recent project was the documentary called: Just a Podcast. In it, he discusses its significance and how it helped him recover after the loss of his Mom.

 

What's the Funding For?

$8000 is the minimum needed to make the web-series happen. Below is how the $8000 will be used:

5% will go to Indiegogo (Platform fee, all crowdfunding campaigns have them)

11% will go to Audio Equipment

25% will go to the Animated Intro (Intros are an important element to any project, it's what gets the viewers interest and helps set the tone, feeling and themes that will be present in the project)

59% will go to Crew Pay

 

We want Season 1 to be the best that it can be. Though $8,000 is what we need to make Season 1 happen, more funds can allow us to do much more. Below are a few stretch goals that will help us make Season 1 great:

REACH $9,200 - Original Music for the web-series (I believe, if used in moderation, music can add tremendous depth to a project. It can sometimes wash over so much stuff and become unnecessary cues for moments in a project. I am always careful about the amount of music used in a project of mine because more often than not, music isn't needed to move a scene, clip or segment along.  And I wouldn't want hard work put into something that the dialogue is doing well with. I do believe that with this particular project, music can be of use in certain parts.)

REACH $9,983 - Bonus Episode with a special intro as a thank you to everyone who contributed/helped make this project possible! 

REACH $11,549 - Another bonus episode that includes bloopers, behind the scenes snippets and so much more!

REACH $14,549 - A release of a shelved project in a digital art format!

REACH $17, 349 - A special animated project as a sincere thank you to those that helped contribute this!

 

Risks and Challenges

The web-series is currently in pre-production. Production will begin in September. Depending on the information that the CDC puts out, it may/may not affect our ability to begin production in September. If things change, we will begin production in January of next year. Though I would definitely love to start in September, the safety and well-being of others is important. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing the campaign helps tremendously. It's ultimately how others can see it and gets the word out. This truly helps. Even if you cannot contribute, please spread the word to others you know.

story:
Addiction causes people to lose their ability to resist a craving, despite negative physical, personal, or social consequences. People seek out Sex and/or alcohol, because it makes them feel good or lessens feelings of stress and sadness, and temporarily eliminates their confusion.

Reclaimed Freedom

SAil miTT productions, in association with the 321 on FIRE! Collective,  is pleased to have an opportunity to bring this story of Reclaimed Freedom to life on Screen. After multiple awards throughout a 3 year theatre run and workshop events, we believe its time to take the Reclaimed Freedom Series to the next Level. In order to Achieve this, we need your help in raising the money to ensure top quality material to those networks interested.

Any and all contributions (even $1) will help us in bring this powerful message to the screen. Unlike other shows out there, Reclaimed Freedom tells the story of addiction (both alcohol and sex) thru the eyes of those hurt by it, and in real-time.  This is reality, it is not sugar coated.  With a heavy and dark tone, it presents the reality of how addiction ruins lives and how everyone is affected by it - both the addict and those that know the addic.

What We Need & What You Get

Making a pilot and sizzle is not cheap, we need your help, so the story can get out and show others!

Our remaining goal is $4,200.

$1,500 for our remaining bill at Invisionate Studios in Burbank.

$1,700 for cast and crew.  We want to be able to pay all actors for their time. This also includes a Film Editor, DP and more.  

$1,000 for promotions, and festival entries.   Even with a possible pending network pickup, we plan to take the Pilot episode as a short film and enter it in film festivals across the country in 2017. This also includes any royalties and permits needed.

Impacting the Future and Others

Your contribution of even $1 will make a BIG impact. Reclaimed Freedom is based on true events from 2008-2014 in Los Angeles. Presented in real-time, real life.  The story defines addiction - both sexual and alcoholic - through the eyes of an addict, not the eyes of what we portray as an addict, or the minimalism that Hollywood portrays an addict as. There is no "oh that must be life" - it is life.  Watch as Scott hurts others and himself. watch as an addict deals with hurting himself and others.  

Each season will be an anthology highlighting the struggles, short comings, and rise of Scott.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is telling the story in real-time, and not through Hollywood magic.  What you see throughout the story is what happens to addicts.    The story isn't designed to be of self promotion, self-hate.  It's design to provide insight and a deep understanding.  You will be invested in these characters and their journeys, and back stories.  If we do not meet goal, we risk Not being able to pay the hard-working actors, and right now we have the best. We also risk missing our pitch with three major networks.  Currently, we have a team of over 30 hard at work prepping for what many feel could be the next big thing on TV.  After winning multiple awards for the realism, and love portrayed through the characters, this is just the next step.  All cast and crew feel deeply about this story, and hope that you will contribute to help make this  a reality.  The next step in the Reclaimed Freedom series.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford at the moment to help us? No problem, we appreciate you taking the time to consider! Please help us in other ways:

Get the word out about the campaign to anyone that you think can help.  Remember, even a simple $1 will inch us closer to goal.

Come to our Table Read of the pilot and Pitch on Monday, February 6th at Redline Bar and Lounge in downtown Los Angeles,

Get Involved. We need cast and crew to help produce the pilot. Don't want to work on the crew? Then get involved locally - help sponsor an addict. An addict needs your help near you.

 

CHECK OUT PREVIOUS CAMPAIGN VIDEOS!

Stanton Longoria & Tim Younger: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JroVMQCK2g8

Ben Lewin & Sonai Grace: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UVsIJoT4ll0

THE CAST THANKS YOU

Each of us thanks you from the bottom of our hearts. 

Reclaimed Freedom was conceived and written by Kenne-James. Thanks Again for your support!

story:
A strong woman in the military is not a story you hear often. Ask yourself, how many TV series or movies focused around the military or war have you seen with the leading role being a female? Chances are you can count how many you’ve seen them on one hand.

The truth is that there are hundreds of untold stories of amazing women who have accomplished just as much as any man in the military, and that’s why we want your help backing this TV series project based on the fascinating life of Colonel Jill Morgenthaler. As you can imagine, there is a lot that goes into getting a project like this sold and produced to a network. We have a great team of writers on board and the money gained will help us start the screenwriting process for G.I. Jill and getting the script sold to a studio. Help us tell the story of one woman’s difficult struggles and heroic triumphs to accomplish many firsts for a woman in the military.

What is G.I. Jill About?

Inspired by the real stories of Colonel (Ret.) Jill Morgenthaler’s time in the Army, we are creating a 6-part miniseries that highlights one woman's journey through being one of the first women enlisted in the Army. Each episode will focus on a part of her journey, including:

  • Surviving boot camp when the men didn't want her there
  • Being forced into a beauty contest
  • Saving an American engineer from being kidnapped by the USSR
  • Coming face-to-face with Saddam Hussein during his war crimes trial

All stories are based on real events and bring to light many issues that women in the military still encounter today. Colonel Morgenthaler is considered a hero and exceptional leader by her fellow service men and women. The obstacles she overcame are what promises to be a compelling story of strength, courage, and perseverance. - This is a true underdog story that proves one woman can stand and be a voice for not just thousands of women who serve in our military, but to anyone who has a dream and will fight like hell to prove everyone wrong.

Your Duty

We are asking you to help fund our project and help us raise $25,000 for the initial screenwriting of this exclusive 6-part TV miniseries. As a backer, you will receive a set of unique perks based on how much you decide to generously donate. Please see the perks section for more details on what you will receive.

We truly feel that this is a story that needs to be told and heard, especially during these fragile times that prove gender equality is still an important issue. Help us show the world that a strong leader doesn't have to be one size fits all.

One Final Note

My name is Jill Morgenthaler and this is a project based on my journey, my many ups and downs, my fight for respect, and my fight for my life - I am very excited to make this TV miniseries and am confident all of you will enjoy the final product. Thank you for your help.

We truly feel that this is a story that needs to be told and heard, especially during these fragile times that prove gender equality is still an important issue. Help us show the world that a strong leader doesn't have to be one size fits all.
One Final Note
My name is Jill Morgenthaler and this is a project based on my journey, my many ups and downs, my fight for respect, and my fight for my life - I am very excited to make this TV miniseries and am confident all of you will enjoy the final product. Thank you for your help.

story:
We are No Studio In Particular, and since mid-2014 we’ve been working with talented independent voice actors around the world to make Zoolaplex, a workplace audio-dramedy series about a group of young people working behind the counter at a local multiplex, and their various friends and enemies. However, now we want more. We want to take Zoolaplex out of your RSS feed and throw it at the screen like a digital Jackson Pollock painting. How? Three words: 'Hostile Work Environment', our very own animated pilot episode! We don’t have any deals set up and we barely have a nice word to say about ourselves, but we have an Indiegogo campaign, and we know what we want to do.

Not convinced yet? Bear with us.

Here’s the deal: we make jokes about movies, modern life, first world problems and cultural stereotypes, while highlighting social issues and seeking to inspire people with fresh perspectives and real, relatable characters with their own unique opinions and different experiences. There’s dirty jokes, internet memes, pop culture references and parodies, and a whole lot of F-bombs being thrown around. The Zoolaplex world is a little different—the minimum wage is $13, street gangs play in underground fighting rings to pay for college tuition, and you can whack a guy with a baseball bat for attacking your coworker. All in all, it sucks about as much as the real world does.

In the first 12 episodes of our critically-acclaimed audio-drama alone [SPOILER ALERT] a racist ass-cactus gets his nose caved in, the multiplex is swarmed with a mob of hipsters (who aren’t so bad after all), and a sexual predator gets decked by a con artist with a beer bottle. Our second season has taken it up a notch with themes of mental illness, body positivity, and the power of a family that loves each other, even if they’re not related. All of these themes and events tie into the core message of our show. It's a message that has become very important to remember in recent months:

We don’t have to like each other, but we can at least respect each other.

We love what we’ve made so far, but we’re not satisfied. With the current state of the political world and the recent outbreak of closed-mindedness that’s swept the world, we believe our message needs to be heard now more than ever, and we can’t do that from the Podcasts app on your iPhone. We’ve never had the resources to have our show animated, and that’s where YOU come in. If you help us reach our target of $16,000, we’ll use it to make something beautiful.

We want to make an all-new, fully-animated series pilot, with new music, an innovative animation style, and redesigned characters, something that’ll start the ball rolling for us to make our dream of sharing Zoolaplex with the world a reality. Our plan is simple: with the money raised with this campaign, we will create 'Hostile Work Environment', our pilot episode, and we will take it to Hollywood, to the studios themselves, anywhere we can get our foot in the door. At that point, we hope to have the show picked up so we can spread our message across our divided world.

Okay, so this the part where you expect us to tell you what we plan to do with the extra money we get past the goal, right? WRONG! Our project has no set focus on any stretch goals. All we can do is promise that every dollar we receive above our target of $16,000 will be used to make the show better in some way. Maybe we’ll spruce up the credits sequence. Maybe we’ll make a full trailer showcasing what might happen in the first complete season. Maybe we’ll hire Patton Oswalt to pop up and say ‘penis’ at random intervals—he seems like he’d be down to do it. He’s a chill guy. But no matter what we decide to do with our extra budget, we’ll make sure it’s put to good use to make 'Hostile Work Environment' as amazing as we can.

Instead of focusing on stretch goals, we’re going to do something else to stretch our success: backer challenges. We want 'Hostile Work Environment' to spread like wildfire, and not for more money, but in the hopes that it’ll attract the attention of people at the big production studios and networks that might be interested in talking to us about making Zoolaplex into an original series. Let’s face it; the people have to want this for us to get anywhere, and this is how we’ll prove they do. Below is a set of 12 challenges that backers can take on social media to help spread this project around. If our backers and supporters complete 9 challenges out of all 12, we’ll unlock a special bonus event and add a new set of challenges for something even better! Some of the challenges are easy and some are a little more out there, but if you’re crazy enough to get a Zoolaplex tattoo, that says a lot about what kind of stuff you want on TV!

Ready? Here we go!

Q: What happens if we don't reach our goal?

A: The thing about IndieGoGo is, even if we don't reach our goal of $16,000 then we'll still receive the money we've raised over this campaign, no matter how far away from our goal it was. Should we not manage to achieve our goal, then one of two things will happen. If we didn't get far at all, we vow to use that money to further the production of the audio drama, better promote the show for another year or two, and then return stronger, wiser, and with a bigger fanbase. But if we were just shy of the mark, over, say, 70%, then we will actively continue to raise money from external investors and bank interest, until we have enough to finance the pilot anyway. And we'll be keeping everyone who backed us in the first place in the know the whole time! Not a single cent of this money will be wasted under any circumstances!

 

Q: And if you do reach the goal? What happens then?

A: We get to work! As soon as the writing is finalised, we'll send it over to be storyboarded and get the voice actors on it to set up an animatic, and then when that's set we send it off to the animators to be animated. When it's all put together, we add sound effects, make sure it's all 100% perfect, and then add music to bring it all together. And then, well, 'Hostile Work Environment' is done! Next comes the bigger challenge: getting the networks on the phone... But that's an entirely different adventure!

 

Q: Why $16,000? That's higher than a lot of campaigns for animated pilots!

A: That's very true, but most animation campaigns are run by people who are talented animators themselves, and unfortunately Reece Bridger is not an animator, nor is he that talented. Where his skill set ends, other people will pick up the slack, and that requires money. For professional quality animation, music and voice acting, considerable industry-level funding is required.

 

Q: So who's involved in this? I don't want my money going to untrustworthy third parties!

A: Well, you're in luck! No one involved in this project is untrustworthy, nor are they really third parties! Everyone involved is incredibly enthusiastic to work on this, and we consider them friends of the studio itself! So, aside from our talented cast and Reece himself, we've enlisted the help of talented musician and composer Mark Little to produce the soundtrack; storyboard artist Leah Kleinbeck to lay the foundation for the visuals; and our art director Russ Adams of Escape Design FX, whose résumés includes 'Beetlejuice', 'Pirates of the Caribbean' 2 & 3, and 'Jim Henson's Creature Shop Challenge', who will ensure 'Hostile Work Environment' is completely TV-ready!

 

Q: Who did all the art for this IndieGoGo campaign?

A: I'm glad you asked! All the art assets for this campaign were taken from old pieces or drawn specifically for this project, and those lovely artists are: Stefi Delly, Stephanie Jo Keuls, Cas Flores, Amy Summers, Leah Kleinbeck, and a hyena. Yes. A hyena. Long story.

 

Q: I'm a blogger/podcast host/writer for a news and culture website and I want to help spread the word about this project. Where can I find further information?

A: We're glad to have you on board! All press are advised to check our consistently up-to-date press pack found here for basic information about the project, cast and characters, as well as links, contact information and images. The information in this press pack will be updated regularly as the campaign continues, so be sure to check back later! All other enquires for information/interviews should be sent to Reece Bridger at thezoolaplexshow@gmail.com!

Okay, we’ll be frank. The first risk is that we might not raise enough money with this campaign. There’s making sure the writing is good (challenge), the animation and music and acting and sound design all go according to plan (challenge), and that the final product is good enough to do justice to everyone’s faith and trust in this project (HUGE challenge). But the biggest risk is that after everything is done, the money is gone, and the episode is finished… nothing happens. Maybe we don’t catch anyone’s attention at the networks (risk) or maybe we don’t get an agent to represent us professionally (risk). Maybe, for all our efforts and everyone’s trust and support, we don’t get to the end zone to make that big touchdown. (See? We do sports references, too!) But y’know what? That won’t be the last of us. If for all our clamours and all that hard work we’re met with silence, then we’ll keep on trying on our own. We’ll have a fully-animated pilot, and we’ll have the people who helped us make that possible. So really, this is all one big challenge for us, and if we don’t succeed it will only mean the start of a different one.

Now let's make a pilot!

story:
Short Summary

Altruism Pictures is a Yorkshire based Production & Distribution company that makes Films for the BIG Screen and the small screen, we make films by YOU for YOU.  The Altruism team would like to welcome you to be involved in our next project entitled " Devils Gold " a six part mini series adapted from the concept of the hugely popular Frankenstein prequel released earlier this year and was produced in partnership with Foot of the Barrel Theatre Company 

The mini series will include six episodes in it's first season at 4 minutes long apiece with the intentions of making this the must watch online mini series that you can watch on you break at work or during your bathroom time so you can always be in the loop as to what is currently  happening in "Devil's Gold"

We have a wonderful and welcoming team that grows by the day as we are a production company that truly believes in growing with our followers and learning from each other within the team.

We have a few options of support and we are truly grateful for any contribution you can make
To further strengthen and promote this amazing production. 

What We Need & What You Get

A project like this does not fund itself everyone wanting to be involved MUST contribute or the project will NOT be made. The target budget is £1000 Minimum which is a realistic amount and classed as a NO budget project.

We plan to make the mini series on almost nothing but by utilizing all of our collective skills and talents we can achieve something awesome that we can be proud of and will make a great addition to any future auditions or jobs that may come your way.

QUICK NOTE
It is cheaper to film 5 episodes back to back than 1 episode every few weeks.

Any amount of funding contribution is welcome and appreciated Minimum is £5. Main cast members don't feel obliged to pay the £50 perk buy-in you can donate any amount, but know that the series can NOT be make for less than £1000.

So please get others involved share on your Facebook page, twitter and ask people at your work or school, the gym and your buddies.

Other Ways You Can Help

For more Films & trailers visit: www.Altruismpictures.com

Please Don't forget to Like, Share & Subscribe for notifications on Newly uploaded Videos or to simply be more involved in future Productions with The Son of Raw or Altruism Pictures

Follow The Son of Raw:

www.vimeo.com/thesonofraw

www.facebook.com/thesonofraw

www.twitter.com/thesonofraw

www.linkedin.com/in/thesonofraw

www.instagram.com/thesonofraw

www.IMDB.me/simonrawson

Follow Altruism Pictures:

www.vimeo.com/altruismpictures

www.facebook.com/Altruismpictures

www.twitter.com/Altruismpicture

www.instagram.com/altruismpictures

story:
What’s Happening?

In early 2018, we’re launching a YouTube series called Contemplate Truth. The series will examine subjects such as evolution and the creation of the universe, all from a Christian perspective.

Our belief is that high schoolers and college students are the ones most in need of this resource. Their faith is tested on a daily basis as they face anti-God ideology almost everywhere they turn. Because so many students are on YouTube, we believe it’s the perfect medium for this series.

While there are resources out there addressing these questions, most of them are so densely packed with scientific jargon that the content goes over the head of anyone without a PhD. For most of us, that’s not helpful. So, we’re making these videos with our audience in mind. Not only will the information be easy to understand, but it’ll be presented in a fun and engaging way.

 

Our Plan

We’re creating 5 episodes for the first season of Contemplate Truth. Each episode will range from 3-7 minutes in length in order to have the broadest appeal.

While the topics of the five episodes have not been finalized yet, we know we’re going to be looking closely at both evolution and intelligent design. In future seasons, we’d like to address questions people ask in the YouTube comments. If you have a topic you’re curious about, please let us know by leaving a comment on this site.

We wait faithfully to see what God has in store for this series, but our plan is to continue making episodes and release them on a consistent basis if the initial season gathers interest.

 

The Host

John Zino is currently a Senior Engineering Manager at GE Hitachi Nuclear Energy in Wilmington, NC and has over thirty years of technical and management experience in government laboratories and private industry. He holds undergraduate and graduate degrees in nuclear engineering and physics from North Carolina State University and the Georgia Institute of Technology as well as a PhD in nuclear engineering from Georgia Tech. John is currently pursuing an MA in Science & Religion from Biola University and hopes to teach, lecture and publish works useful to Christians as they encounter a culture strongly influenced by scientific material naturalism.

John came to salvation in Christ on Easter Sunday in 1978 as a teenager while visiting Myrtle Beach, SC with his family. Although he struggled with his faith early in college while studying science and engineering, he eventually came to realize that the pursuit of science and belief in God are not mutually exclusive but complementary. John’s goal working with college and high school students is to help put into proper context an integrated understanding of science and faith for the next generation of young Christians.

 

What Is Needed

Our goal is to craft each episode to be as effective at communicating complex ideas as possible. That requires a lot of intentionality behind the scenes. From writing to computer animation, these things cost money to be done sufficiently. Additionally, there are resources such as hard drives and music licensing that need to be purchased to make things happen.

So, we invite you to contribute. Without your support, this series won’t be possible. But imagine the positive difference that can be made in the lives of so many people, both Christian and non-Christian, with this resource. Even you may have questions that we'll address in these videos. So let’s bring this series to life, together!

 

Other Support

There are two other ways you can help us with this series.

First, prayer. Pray that God puts this resource in front of people who need to see it, and pray that we address the questions that need to be addressed.

Second, sharing. We ask that you share this series on social media, tell your friends about it, do whatever you can to get it in front of more people.

Thank you for even considering joining us in this adventure. We’re looking forward to seeing what God does next! 

 

For more information visit: Contemplatetruth.com

Contemplate Truth is associated with:

Ratio Christi UNCW - ratiochristi.org/uncw

Carolinas Apologetics Alliance

story:
Established in 2015, founder Rox Wright noticed the mother of her quartet of cousins struggling with managing their beautiful curls. The girls are of Thai and Caribbean heritage, which sees them blessed with extremely varied hair textures that at times mainstream hair advice doesn't always cater to. Inspired to combine and share over a decade of childcare expertise and hair care knowledge with the world, Wright launched Yindi Curls in a bid to help both parents and children learn to love their locks with compact classes for the curly masses.

Yindi Curls masterclasses are designed to offer support and advice to parents/carers of particularly – although not exclusively black and mixed heritage children, who want to learn about the techniques, products, and tools needed to care for their child’s hair more effectively. 

 

 

 

Initially set up as a bimonthly-day masterclass based in London, Yindi Curls is quickly becoming a unique destination for parents and carers of curly kids. 

However, in response to feedback from our community, we've decided to create a subscription-based online course in conjunction with our Day Masterclasses, that parents and carers can access at any time from the comfort of their home or whilst on the go.

Here are some of the subjects we cover: 

and much more!

So simply put, we want to create an online workshop series that consists of...

What makes us different?

We are not a hairdressing school. Yindi Curls is a unique space and community for guardians to educate themselves on their child's hair care. 

 

 

Ashleigh Jadee & URG Films

Production

IG: @msashleighjadee

 London videographer Ashleigh has filmed and directed for numerous brands, music artists and fledgling businesses alike. These include Jasmine Thompson, Big Sean, French Montana, Rita Ora, Tinie Tempah, Tyga, Iggy Azalea, Mac Miller and more. This led to her filming performance music videos for online platforms such as Linkup TV & GRM Daily. Ashleigh has also produced content for brands and artist such as Beats by Dre, Luxoticca, Skepta, Stormzy, G Frsh, BET UK and more, but always felt most at home in the director's chair.

Founded in 2017, URG Films is dedicated to creating content that aims to inspire. From documentaries to music videos to films, they pride themselves on only creating content that educates, uplifts and promotes positivity. Whether in front of the camera or behind it, they work with a diverse range of talent, both well known and up and coming, from all walks of life.

 

 

Our initial funding target is £12,000. This will be broken down into the following categories:

  • Studio Hire: £1,560 will help us secure the studio space costs for the 7 days we plan on filming.  (£2,600 if we stretch our goal)
  • Videography/ Post Production: £5,400 (£9,000 if we stretch our goal) enables us to not only film all 16 episodes of the Yindi online course but include...

    Video Editing 

    Adding Visual Effects

    Sound Design, sound effects, ADR, foley, and music, culminating in a process known as sound re-recording or mixing with professional audio equipment.

    Color Grading

  • Donation Perks: £600 allows us to produce your perks to the highest quality and get them to you in the safest and fastest method possible. (£1,000 if we stretch our goal)
  • Promotion: £1,200 we know our community is great at spreading the word, but this will assist us in reaching those further afield.
  •  Set Design: £1,440 From props to equipment hire, this budget will allow us to create professional looking content. (£2,400 if we stretch our goal)
  • Cast & Crew: £1,800 enables us to cover travel, refreshments and most importantly insurance for those working with us day to day on set.

 

However, if we hit our stretch target of £20,000 we'll be able to create...

We’ve also collaborated with:

 

We have created some amazing perks and products for you to purchase and contribute to this campaign.

 

 

T-Shirt

 

 

http://kikiblahblah.com/yindi-curls

https://emmascurls.com/2017/05/01/growing-up-mixed-race-yindi-curls-masterclasses/

http://roamingwithrami.com/for-the-curly-girls/

 

 

 

What's included in the masterclass?

The masterclass consists of 4 Series, which includes 16  episodes of in-depth tutorials, interviews and animated sketches. 

How do I access the content after buying the Masterclass?

Once the payment process is completed and the Yindi Curls crowdfunding campaign has ended,  you will receive an email with personalised login details which can amend at any time. Access can be gained as of October 2018.

How long do I have access?

The content will never expire so you can log in and watch at any time, however, this access only applies to Indiegogo contributors only.

Is it a one-time payment or contract?

Indiegogo customers pay the one-off contribution fee which will allow them unlimited access. Those that choose to purchase Yindi Curls classes via the Yindi Curls website will need to pay monthly in order to consistently gain access to Masterclass material. 

Do you do refunds?

As Yindi Curls have opted for a flexible funding option, donations will not be refunded. If purchased directly from the Yindi Curls website, the Masterclass is a digital product, therefore, no refunds will be issued as you gain access instantly upon purchase.

Does the Masterclass come with Hair Products?

Unfortunately, the Masterclass does not come with hair products. You will need to use your own.

What are the risks?

Because we are already up and running, and hosting day workshops on a regular basis, there is minimal direct risk associated with our perks that consist of private sessions. We’ll send any vouchers and perks under the value of £50 as soon as the campaign finishes in mid-June.

For physical perks and online masterclass access, you’ll have to wait slightly longer as we are creating them as we go along. The official launch date should be at the end of the year but people who have purchased it via the campaign will receive them exclusively by October 2018! 

When will I receive my perks?

Once the campaign finishes in mid-June, we'll start shipping perks under the value of £50 first, so you should expect them between late July/August. For those that purchase merchandise based perks alongside masterclass access, your orders will be processed between August and September.

 

What about shipping?

Our shipping cost will vary based on country. We are based in the UK, so we will use Royal Mail to send in the UK at low cost. For shipping abroad, we’ll also use Royal Mail.

The cost of postage and packaging will be added to your original donation near the end of your transaction. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute and we totally get that, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Thank you for your support!

 

Yindi Curls Crowdfund Campaign Video: Director: Ashleigh Jadee/Music: Chicago- Joe Bagale

story:
Shakesha Williams created Curvy Girls Rock with the intention of giving women authentic representations in television. In contrast to the common narrative of women in film/television, which paints them to be passive, weak, and lacking in agency, the female leads of CGR are strong, independent, funny and ambitious. Shakesha believes that the characters of CGR are true reflections of the majority of women around the world, in both body image and individuality.   


The goal of the series is to reinvent the narrative of women, forcing society to view them respectfully, as well as allow plus size women to see themselves depicted in ways that make them proud of their being.

           

 

 

The Impact

The success of Curvy Girls Rock will:

  • Encourage Hollywood to diversify their casting methods for lead roles.
  • Allow future creatives to express ideas that go against convention.
  • Make it clear to the film and television industry that plus size women, who represent a large portion of the female population, can be intriguing, sexy, desirable, proud, and ambitious.

 

 

Jazzy is a successful fashion blogger and plus-size model. She is beautiful, vivacious, and confident. She’s a body-positive advocate who speaks out against fat shaming and for the inclusion of all body types in the discussion of beauty. Jazzy is content with her life; she is not searching for love. She is single and satisfied.

 

Jazzy is played by NAIMAH TERRY. Naimah is a NJ native. She attends Sheik Studios for acting, and is also under the wing of  Coach April Yvette Thompson. She has been a professional model for the last three years, appearing in events ranging from Modeling Campaigns for Ashley Stewart to Fit Modeling in China. Atop her success as a model, Naimah, who recently graduated from Rutgers University is also a motivational speaker representing local non-profit organizations.

 

Adrienne is a fashion designer. She's cute, quirky, and wears her heart on her sleeve. Adrienne is obsessed with online dating but cannot seem to find “the one.”

 

Adrienne is played by ZOE GOSLIN. Zoë attended the London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art. Since moving to New York, she has been very active in the film industry contributing to numerous theatrical productions and voiceover work. Zoe recently appeared in the picture Much Ado About Nothing, an Easy Leap Theatre Company production. Curvy Girls Rock is her first web series appearance, and she is thrilled to be a part of a project that champions inclusivity and sisterhood.

 

 

Zuri is a lover of art and culture, hence her profession as a museum owner. Zuri’s poise and demeanor screams “Black is Beautiful.” She is very confident. She is not interested in finding love; her only concern, is evolving with her museum.

 

Zuri is played by ELLISHA MARIE. Ellisha was born and raised in New York, although her parents hail from the Island of Trinidad and Tobago, making her a first generation American. She attended the American Musical and Dramatic Academy, a college and conservatory of the performing arts. At the academy, Elisha received training from elite instructors from all over the country. After graduating from AMDA, she gained professional experience in singing and stage work. Ellisha is very excited about making her TV/Film debut as “Zuri.” She is honored to be involved in a movement that inspires women to love/value their bodies, and embrace their true/authentic selves.  

 

 

Reagan is Jazzy's assistant. She is smart and creative. Since her recent divorce, she has not felt comfortable with herself. She has lost her way and wishes to start fresh. Reagan has put on some weight since her relationship ended, but she is looking to jump back into the dating world.

 

Reagan is played by ANDREA ILENE SHAPIRO. Andrea is a comedian, actor, writer and voiceover artist out of New York City. She has appeared on “Orange Is the New Black”, “Dr. Oz”, TLC’s “Suddenly Rich", and was also a finalist on NBC’s “Welcome to Sweden” sketch contest. She has also appeared in a bevy of independent films. As a comedian, Andrea was a finalist for the moveon.org sponsored stand-up contest, "Laughter Trumps Hate.”

Ivy is a singer and entertainer. She is a strong individual, but she is struggling with her independence dealing with an on-again, off-again relationship.

Ivy is played by TAMALA BALDWIN.  Tamala is a Julliard grad flutist, actress,TV host and singer. She also stars in Asunder, an Amazon series. She was recently seen in the new musical Fora, at the New York Musical Festival and is a college professor and producer of Soul Kisses TV. 


 

Shane is Jazzy’s love interest. He is a music festival programmer. When he re-enters Jazzy’s life, the question becomes - Will Jazzy and Shane rekindle their romance?

 

Shane is played by NATHAN M. RAMSEY. Nathan is an actor, singer and songwriter from the Bronx, New York. He served in the U.S. Air Force for eight years before returning to New York in pursuit of a dream far too long deferred.Nathan has appeared in Clifford Odets' "Waiting for Lefty" as well as Luis Rafael Sánchez's "The Passion of Antígona Perez.”

 

 

Bruce is a graphic designer. He is caring, kind and funny. He and Adrienne are best friends, but the question remains: Is friendship all that Bruce wants from Adrienne?

 

Bruce is played by NICK BOMBICINO. Nick is an actor and musician based in NYC. He was born in a small town in Vermont. Nick studied at Ithaca College, and then went off to the UK to get his Masters degree at the Birmingham School of Acting. He hung around in England for a while after finishing his degree, before moving to NYC.

 

 

Conroy is a photographer who is infatuated with Zuri. Will these two type A personalities ultimately find joy and comfort in one another?

 

Conroy is played by SJ HANNAH. SJ is thrilled to be a part of the cast of Curvy Girls Rock. Onstage, he has performed in regional productions such as "Blues for an Alabama Sky", "Train is Comin", and "Invisible Life, The Musical", based on the book by E. Lynn Harris. SJ also toured the country as Simba in "The Lion King.” Onscreen, SJ has appeared in "Mysteries at the Museum", as well as the award winning indie film, "Sneakers and Soul.”

 

 

Max is Reagan’s upstairs neighbor. He stirs up a sexual awakening in Reagan after her divorce.

 

Max is played by DANTE SHARPE. Dante was born and raised in West Palm Beach, Florida. He was a dual athlete playing football and track, but after suffering a major injury, his athletic goals took a backseat. He feels that being able to create a story that can distract, embody, or influence someone’s life in any way is what brings him the most joy. This is Dante’s first web series.  

 

WRITER AND CREATOR

Shakesha Williams is an award-winning writer and producer. Her short film My Story won Best Screenplay Short at the Widescreen Film Festival in 2017. She founded Harlem Fusion Studios in 2012 and has been working to bring challenging, entertaining and fresh content to the thematic landscape

Risks & Challenges

This is considered an ultra low budget project by industry standards. However, if the projected amount of money is raised, season one of Curvy Girls Rock will unfold exactly the way that it is envisioned.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a financial contribution at this time, you can still be of support. Help to spread the word by letting everyone you know about the Curvy Girls Rock Campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone!


Vasilios Filippakis and Anthony Filangeri  here. We are, respectively, a creator/actor and a writer, here in Toronto. You may recognize one of us from that Swiss Chalet commercial, loving that Chalet sauce (obviously Vasilios, always thirsty) and a handful of indie projects. You might have read some WWE Articles, written by our very own Mr. Filangeri. Yes…WWE is still big thing. Having been acting/writing in Toronto now for a few years we joined forces in the summer of ’16 to create the story, now called, "FAK YAASS"! We have teamed with Matthew McLaughlin, the owner of Bulldog Productions, who is on board to bring this to lyffffeeee; but we need you.


Our campaign will raise the funding necessary to create the remaining 8 episodes of our 10 episodic web series (yes, that means EP 1 and EP 2 are complete) created by us and starring Vasilios and many other talented actors. Today is the time where actors and creators create their own work and make it happen! We find it liberating -creating your own work instead of sitting around, glued to your phone, waiting for that email from your agent (if you even have an agent…that’s a whole other story) to tell you you have an audition blarg blarg blarg…we think you get the point. 


How will all these amazing contributions help us? By reaching our goal we will be able to share this hilarious story that is grounded in love with all of you. We promise you will laugh, cry, get mad, shit yourself (this could actually happen, not our fault…)…really you’ll get all the feels. The potential this series has is outstanding. We already have interest from a major network production company to adapt the web series into a 30 minute network comedy! (It’s honestly so crazy and we're super thrilled) This web series is step one! All of you contributing play a huge role in the birth of "FAK YAASS" and will be there to watch it grow (you all can be proud parents). We could not do this without you! As we like to say, FAK. YAASSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $25, 000. This budget was made so we can pay all of our cast, crew and post production team (editing, marketing, etc). This is the bare bones of what we need to make this project happen. Nobody is walking away from this and heading off to a all inclusive resort for vacation. We believe that if we all work as a team, give some time, you'll get a little $$$; it really helps! The budget includes locations, food, gear, props, makeup, transportation, and wardrobe, for a 6 day shoot PLUS marketing once we finish!


Our Perks
If you donate $100 or more, you are invited to our exclusive PRIDE KICKOFF PARTY on June 15th! This means you’ll be on a guest list, enjoy drinks and hors d'oeuvres, see some of Toronto's top performers and walk the red carpet with all the other amazing Canadian talent we have in attendance!


If you donate $500 you’ll get a coffee date with us, and some of the cast. YYAASSS. (as long as you live in the GTA)


If you donate $1000, we will bartend shirtless at your next event and you will get an executive producer credit.  Ummm, how cool is that!?


Check out the PERKS section after you read this and see all the ammmmazing perks offered.

 

If the goal isn't reached, what happens to the money?

We will make "FAK YAASS" no matter what! All the money we raise will be put to use. That is our promise. The more we get, the higher quality the production will be, which can only lead to bigger things; bigger is always better. Your money will make this series.  YOU WILL MAKE A WEB SERIES.

 

The Impact

This series is about love. We are bringing a story that is based on true events to life for our viewers. You will see the struggle it takes when you mix “modern” millennial views (being gay…yas queen) with old tradition values (gay=sick). We are hoping the impact of this series will initiate conversations and make us all learn from each other in a magnitude of ways. Our story is real, and relevant and will make you laugh, empathize and maybe see your world from a different perspective.

 

Why is THIS story so important for the world?

Our world is still filled with people who don’t accept each other. Like we said, this show is grounded in love. It has heart. It’s funny but really it is just exploring a day in the life of one gay boy searching for acceptance. If we can help shift one person's mind about how they view anyone in the LGBTQ community; our job is done. Let's help start the conversation and make coming out a little bit easier.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge right now is having people take time off to shoot.  We have a 6 day shoot planned and for all of us in the arts, who have another job that typically puts a roof over our heads, taking those days off could mean we don’t make rent. It’s hard to get everyone involved to put this as their top priority. Despite this set back, we all are in this for love and because we know the potential that lies within this series. This story is what has brought us all together as a team, and as a team we will push forward.


To solve these challenges, our team is honest and upfront with the needs for this series. We also hold respect and empathy at the forefront of our team values and this helps us prosper. With YOUR help, we will be able to give everyone a little bit of money, so that they can take time off their day job and commit fully to this project!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Other than money, how can you help? Help share the word! Give us some social media shout outs, likes and comment on our videos. Use the Indiegogo share tools to help! FAK YAASS.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello everyone!
Vasilios Filippakis and Anthony Filangeri  here. We are, respectively, a creator/actor and a writer, here in Toronto. You may recognize one of us from that Swiss Chalet commercial, loving that Chalet sauce (obviously Vasilios, always thirsty) and a handful of indie projects. You might have read some WWE Articles, written by our very own Mr. Filangeri. Yes…WWE is still big thing. Having been acting/writing in Toronto now for a few years we joined forces in the summer of ’16 to create the story, now called, "FAK YAASS"! We have teamed with Matthew McLaughlin, the owner of Bulldog Productions, who is on board to bring this to lyffffeeee; but we need you.
Our campaign will raise the funding necessary to create the remaining 8 episodes of our 10 episodic web series (yes, that means EP 1 and EP 2 are complete) created by us and starring Vasilios and many other talented actors. Today is the time where actors and creators create their own work and make it happen! We find it liberating -creating your own work instead of sitting around, glued to your phone, waiting for that email from your agent (if you even have an agent…that’s a whole other story) to tell you you have an audition blarg blarg blarg…we think you get the point. 
How will all these amazing contributions help us? By reaching our goal we will be able to share this hilarious story that is grounded in love with all of you. We promise you will laugh, cry, get mad, shit yourself (this could actually happen, not our fault…)…really you’ll get all the feels. The potential this series has is outstanding. We already have interest from a major network production company to adapt the web series into a 30 minute network comedy! (It’s honestly so crazy and we're super thrilled) This web series is step one! All of you contributing play a huge role in the birth of "FAK YAASS" and will be there to watch it grow (you all can be proud parents). We could not do this without you! As we like to say, FAK. YAASSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS.
 

What We Need & What You Get
We need $25, 000. This budget was made so we can pay all of our cast, crew and post production team (editing, marketing, etc). This is the bare bones of what we need to make this project happen. Nobody is walking away from this and heading off to a all inclusive resort for vacation. We believe that if we all work as a team, give some time, you'll get a little $$$; it really helps! The budget includes locations, food, gear, props, makeup, transportation, and wardrobe, for a 6 day shoot PLUS marketing once we finish!
Our PerksIf you donate $100 or more, you are invited to our exclusive PRIDE KICKOFF PARTY on June 15th! This means you’ll be on a guest list, enjoy drinks and hors d'oeuvres, see some of Toronto's top performers and walk the red carpet with all the other amazing Canadian talent we have in attendance!
If you donate $500 you’ll get a coffee date with us, and some of the cast. YYAASSS. (as long as you live in the GTA)
If you donate $1000, we will bartend shirtless at your next event and you will get an executive producer credit.  Ummm, how cool is that!?
Check out the PERKS section after you read this and see all the ammmmazing perks offered.
 

If the goal isn't reached, what happens to the money?
We will make "FAK YAASS" no matter what! All the money we raise will be put to use. That is our promise. The more we get, the higher quality the production will be, which can only lead to bigger things; bigger is always better. Your money will make this series.  YOU WILL MAKE A WEB SERIES.
 
The Impact
This series is about love. We are bringing a story that is based on true events to life for our viewers. You will see the struggle it takes when you mix “modern” millennial views (being gay…yas queen) with old tradition values (gay=sick). We are hoping the impact of this series will initiate conversations and make us all learn from each other in a magnitude of ways. Our story is real, and relevant and will make you laugh, empathize and maybe see your world from a different perspective.
 

Why is THIS story so important for the world?
Our world is still filled with people who don’t accept each other. Like we said, this show is grounded in love. It has heart. It’s funny but really it is just exploring a day in the life of one gay boy searching for acceptance. If we can help shift one person's mind about how they view anyone in the LGBTQ community; our job is done. Let's help start the conversation and make coming out a little bit easier.
 
Risks & Challenges
Our biggest challenge right now is having people take time off to shoot.  We have a 6 day shoot planned and for all of us in the arts, who have another job that typically puts a roof over our heads, taking those days off could mean we don’t make rent. It’s hard to get everyone involved to put this as their top priority. Despite this set back, we all are in this for love and because we know the potential that lies within this series. This story is what has brought us all together as a team, and as a team we will push forward.
To solve these challenges, our team is honest and upfront with the needs for this series. We also hold respect and empathy at the forefront of our team values and this helps us prosper. With YOUR help, we will be able to give everyone a little bit of money, so that they can take time off their day job and commit fully to this project!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Other than money, how can you help? Help share the word! Give us some social media shout outs, likes and comment on our videos. Use the Indiegogo share tools to help! FAK YAASS.

story:
We are Ramuel Galarza 

 and Sarah Robertson,

the creators of "Roommates Unwanted".

We have been working hard on this show with our amazing cast and crew for 2.5 years. Here is a brief snippet of our journey thus far:

January 2015 - Ramuel and Sarah joke about creating a web series.

Spring 2015 - We meet for many brainstorming sessions to begin writing the pilot and cast the ensemble.

June 2015 - Filming commences! On our first day of production, we shoot the basement scene at the end of the pilot.

September 2015 - Premiere the pilot episode and start our craziest three months of writing, filming, editing, and releasing episodes simultaneously.

February 2016 - First writers’ meeting for Season 2. We develop story arcs for each character and assign episodes to each writer. We add two new writers to the team!

March 2016 - Filming begins! Hot Brazilians and soaring cheese whiz make a hilarious start to our nine months of production.

Summer 2016 - Attend multiple film festivals and win the Audience Choice Award at the Miami Web Fest.

November 2016 - Wrap on production for Season 2. Post-production begins!

September 2017 - Release Season 2 (with your contributions)!

This is the first time, in our journey, that we are raising funds. Until now, everyone who worked on the show did so for free; volunteering countless hours of their time and talent to the show.  We are fundraising because the only way to finish the episodes is to pay editors, sound designers, colorists, and composers. Additionally, the only way to promote the show to its highest potential requires money for marketing. Because of the many out of pocket expenses we paid in order to film Season 2, we no longer have the resources to pay post-production staff or promote the show. 

 

That's a great question!  When we produced Season 1, it was a creative experiment. We wanted to see if we could create a sitcom web series with our friends and if it would build traction with a wide audience. We were successful in gaining acclaim from both fans and industry professionals. We also learned things to do differently for the following season.

For Season 2, we planned out the entire season and character arcs prior to filming. We expanded our writing team, production crew, cast members, and post-production staff. We branched out to film in many locations outside of the house, replaced the short episodes for fuller ones with complete storylines, and upgraded our production equipment to a more professional level. We exponentially increased the quality in every area of pre-production and production. Therefore, the level of post-production has to match.  

 

"Roommates Unwanted" has always been the group effort of many talented Atlanta artists. We believe this show has the potential to be a core piece of the Atlanta film and television community. One of our passions is to bring love and peace into this industry in greater measure through our genial work environment, clean comedic scripts, and relationships built with fellow artists. It is a privilege to provide an opportunity for growing stronger local connections and greater levels of experience as we come together to create. By joining our campaign, you will be part of the exciting movement of creative arts happening in our city and investing in our team's artistic dreams and careers.

 

$5,000 will finish post-production, which includes editing, sound design, color, music, etc.

Editing Budget Breakdown Per Episode:

$500 per day of editing x 2 days = $1000

+ $150 for sound design = $1150

+ $150 for color grading = $1300

+ $100 for music = $1400

$1400 x 3 episodes = $4200

+ $800 to complete sound and color on the episodes already edited = $5000

The remaining $3,000 will be used for marketing the show. This includes creating a premiere party, film festival submission fees, social media ads, business cards, flyers, and more!

When you give to our campaign, you will receive special perks in return! How cool is that? These range from social media shoutouts to exclusive premiere party invitations to producer credits. Check out all the details to the right! 

We are incredibly thankful to all our fans and supporters. Any amount of money you can give helps us reach our goal! We understand if you are unable to give financially at this time. However, you can help us reach our goal by sharing this site with your friends, family, and any one else you think will be interested. You can also support by liking us on Facebook, Instagram, and subscribing to our YouTube channel to help grow our audience and fund potential.

Once again, welcome to the team, and thank you!

We understand if you are unable to give financially at this time. You can also support by liking us on Facebook, Instagram, and subscribing to our YouTube channel to help grow our audience and fund potential.Once again, welcome to the team, and thank you!

story:
ChickenDuck is a character created by Dave Alvarez, animator for companies like Warner Bros, Disney, Nickelodeon and others. DAS Animation (Dave Alvarez Studios) is the animation house in charge of the project. (www.facebook.com/DaveAlvarezStudio)

 We have done a couple of animated ChickenDuck shorts over the net and created a fan page for the character (www.facebook.com/ChickenDuckShow)

 We want to make our next episode longer,(about 8 minutes long), and enhance the quality of the animation. The episode will be called "The Landscapexorcist". A comedy/action/slapstick short

This short will be used for Network pitching of the ChickenDuck Show. We want to prove that fully 2D animated shows can still be done and loved by today's audiences. 

We'd love you to be part of this. Help us bring back the magic of animation to TV!

The full 8 minute short production cost is $14,000. With this we can hire a couple more animators, a background artist, voice actors and a composer.

You as a backer will be involved with the production, have credit on it, and will receive updates and special behind the scenes of this event.

The ideal goal is to reach the entire $14,000. However, we. can still make a shorter version with less money and still cause an impact and sell the idea to the Networks.

 We will start working as soon as we reach the first $1,000 with storyboards and conceptual art.

This project is important because it will bring back the magic of animation and a home to new animators, actors and musicians for generations to come!

 As head director I've work with characters like Bugs Bunny, SpongeBob, Donald Duck and Mickey Mouse so ChickenDuck will be in good capable hands.

 As with every project, everything is a risk. Network pitching is not our only goal.If by any chance the show doesn't get sold, we still have the internet and an app idea on the works. so the project WILL BE DONE!

 

Feel free to share away our campaign! Let's make this a reality!

story:
HISTORIA (Translation below)

Hartos de  SER INVISIBLES,  de no ser tomados en cuenta, HARTOS DE QUE NOS ENTIERREN ANTES DE TIEMPO; es que decidimos crear A TODA VIDA.  El proyecto de televisión, (que necesita de tu apoyo) para visibilizar a los 60 y más: hombres y mujeres del Perú y del mundo  con una vida maravillosa y productiva para mostrar.

Eso será posible con tu apoyo y el apoyo del Estado.  En el Perú el  54.4% de los Adultos Mayores trabajan y el 26 % sostienen sus hogares. ¿Por qué entonces los ignoramos?  ¿Por qué no tienen un espacio en la televisión? Es hora de verlos y escucharlos. ES HORA DE HACERLOS VISIBLES.

Canal 7 IRTP, canal del Estado, nos ha dado una ventana para mostrar que a los 60 y más, el ser humano no es inservible. Por esa ventana podrán ver A TODA VIDA, un programa que recoge todo ese conocimiento y experiencias de vida, vital, para una sociedad más justa y equilibrada.

NO SE PUEDE RESPETAR, LO QUE NO SE VE.  

Este es el motivo de estar acá, en Crowdfundinng: recaudar 25 mil dólares para QUE NOS PUEDAN VER, necesitamos grabar los primeros  programas de “A TODA VIDA”

NO QUEREMOS PEDIRLES  TODO. Sólo necesitamos SU AYUDA para arrancar. Estamos seguros que después, A TODA VIDA caminará y volará con el auspicio de empresas e instituciones solidarias que piensen como nosotros: que ya es hora de que los sesentimás tengan un  espacio en la televisión peruana.

TU APOYO SERÁ AMPLIAMENTE RECOMPENSADO

Hemos diseñado una tabla de recompensas que les va a atraer. Recuperarán en publicidad y harán una acción filantrópica de esas que nos hacen sentir bien por largo tiempo.

Si no tienen dinero, IGUAL NOS PUEDEN AYUDAR. ¿CÓMO? ¡DIFUNDIENDO! Que todos sus contactos se enteren del programa, peruanos y no peruanos.  TODOS pueden ayudar.  

Tenemos de acuerdo al monto: saludos especiales, entradas para el teatro, pasajes y estadías por el Perú, cupones de almuerzo, etc. En la tabla de recompensas pueden verlo  con más claridad.

Lo recaudado será para cubrir los costos de producción. Los invitamos a recorrer toda nuestra campaña para que nos conozcan bien. ¿Ya les he contado que A TODA VIDA es una ruta de viaje en la que deseamos tanto que nos acompañen?

NUESTROS AVANCES, NUESTROS RIESGOS Y NUESTRA APUESTA

Uno de nuestros logros es haber conseguido la señal del Estado IRTP para salir al aire. Pero eso no es suficiente, necesitamos el apoyo de la gente y de las empresas para cubrir los costos de producción, realización y post producción del programa. Las empresas todavía NO VEN EL GRAN BENEFICIO ECONÓMICO QUE BRINDAN LOS SESENTIMÁS.

No es fácil el camino, pero no pensamos ceder, estamos convencidos que nuestro programa es NECESSARIO Y SERÁ UN ÉXITO. Puede que las empresas  aún no lo vean, pero ¿TÚ? Con ustedes, ¡SI contamos!

Los avances los puedes ver en  el tráiler que hemos colgado.

  • CONDUCCIÓN: Claudia Dammert
  • PRODUCCIÓN Y DIRECCIÓN GENERAL: Livia Gabriela Aliaga Ríos

"25 MIL DÓLARES PARA REVOLUCIONAR EL CONCEPTO DE VEJEZ".

HISTORY

 

Quite fed up with being INVISIBLE. Totally fed up with not being considered upon: FED UP OF BEING BURIED BEFORE BEING DEAD, we decided to create LIFE TO THE BRIM,  the TV program (which needs your help)  to make visible the marvelous, productive lives many men and women over 60 have.

This will be possible only with your help and that of the State. In Perú, 54.4% of senior citizens work and 26% support not only their families but the country´s economy. Why then, do we ignore them? Why don’t they have a TV program? It’s time to see and listen to them. IT IS TIME WE MAKE THEM VISIBLE!

Channel 7 IRTP, the state channel, has given us a window to show that people over 60 are not useless. Through that window you will be able to see LIFE TO THE BRIM, a program that gathers all that knowledge. All the experiences of lives full of vitality for a more just and equal society.

YOU CANNOT RESPECT WHAT YOU CANNOT SEE

This is why we are here in Crowdfunding: we need 25 thousand dollars to shoot the first four programs of LIFE TO THE BRIM so they CAN SEE US!

We are not asking you for all the budget needed. We only want you to help us launch the program. We are positively sure that LIFE TO THE BRIM will walk, run, fly with the sponsorship of businesses and institution that think it is about time to give the “Sixtiemores” their own space in Peruvian television.

YOUR SUPPORT WILL BE WIDELY REWARDED

We have designed a series of rewards you will like. You will not only recover your money with publicity but will also be doing a philanthropic action that will make you feel great for a long time.

If you cannot invest money, YOU CAN ALWAYS HELP US. HOW? SPREADING THE WORD! We need all your contacts to find out about this new program. Your friends abroad, Peruvians or not. EVERYONE CAN HELP!

According to the amount, you shall receive: greetings, theater tickets, plane tickets with food and lodging in Perú, restaurant vouchers, etc. In the reward chart you will be able to see the amounts and rewards more clearly.

What we collect, with your help, will cover production costs.  We invite you to travel across our campaign so you can meet us and know us well. Have I not told you  that LIFE TO THE BRIM is a trip we would like to share with you?

OUR PROGRESS, RISKS AND BET

This program has already been accepted to go on the air on Channel 7, the Peruvian state TV network but does not have money for production. That’s why we need the support of people and businesses. Businesses still DON’T SEE THE GREAT ECONOMIC BENEFITS “SIXTIEMORES” BRING. We are totally convinced our program is NECESSARY AND WILL BE A SUCCESS. Maybe businesses still don’t believe in us, but…Do YOU?? WE DO COUNT ON YOU!

In the attached trailer, you will be able to see all the advancements we have already made.

25 TH0USAND DOLLARS TO REVOLUTIONIZE THE CONCEPT ABOUT OLD AGE

Totally fed up with not being considered upon: FED UP OF BEING BURIED BEFORE BEING DEAD, we decided to create LIFE TO THE BRIM,  the TV program (which needs your help)  to make visible the marvelous, productive lives many men and women over 60 have.This will be possible only with your help and that of the State. In Perú, 54.4% of senior citizens work and 26% support not only their families but the country´s economy. Why then, do we ignore them? Why don’t they have a TV program? It’s time to see and listen to them. IT IS TIME WE MAKE THEM VISIBLE!Channel 7 IRTP, the state channel, has given us a window to show that people over 60 are not useless. Through that window you will be able to see LIFE TO THE BRIM, a program that gathers all that knowledge. All the experiences of lives full of vitality for a more just and equal society.YOU CANNOT RESPECT WHAT YOU CANNOT SEEThis is why we are here in Crowdfunding: we need 25 thousand dollars to shoot the first four programs of LIFE TO THE BRIM so they CAN SEE US!We are not asking you for all the budget needed. We only want you to help us launch the program. We are positively sure that LIFE TO THE BRIM will walk, run, fly with the sponsorship of businesses and institution that think it is about time to give the “Sixtiemores” their own space in Peruvian television.YOUR SUPPORT WILL BE WIDELY REWARDEDWe have designed a series of rewards you will like. You will not only recover your money with publicity but will also be doing a philanthropic action that will make you feel great for a long time.If you cannot invest money, YOU CAN ALWAYS HELP US. HOW? SPREADING THE WORD! We need all your contacts to find out about this new program. Your friends abroad, Peruvians or not. EVERYONE CAN HELP!According to the amount, you shall receive: greetings, theater tickets, plane tickets with food and lodging in Perú, restaurant vouchers, etc. In the reward chart you will be able to see the amounts and rewards more clearly.What we collect, with your help, will cover production costs.  We invite you to travel across our campaign so you can meet us and know us well. Have I not told you  that LIFE TO THE BRIM is a trip we would like to share with you?OUR PROGRESS, RISKS AND BETThis program has already been accepted to go on the air on Channel 7, the Peruvian state TV network but does not have money for production. That’s why we need the support of people and businesses. Businesses still DON’T SEE THE GREAT ECONOMIC BENEFITS “SIXTIEMORES” BRING. We are totally convinced our program is NECESSARY AND WILL BE A SUCCESS. Maybe businesses still don’t believe in us, but…Do YOU?? WE DO COUNT ON YOU!In the attached trailer, you will be able to see all the advancements we have already made.25 TH0USAND DOLLARS TO REVOLUTIONIZE THE CONCEPT ABOUT OLD AGE

story:
Dead Dog Returns is a quirky sci-fi webseries for teenagers inspired by programmes like Buffy, Stranger Things, Wolfblood and Scooby-Doo!

It centres around a group of disparate college students who must team up with a recently bereaved local bobby to work together and restore order to their world when dead pets return to their owners.

The team is comprised of young passionate filmmakers who are working alongside professional film and theatre companies, Trett Films and The Keeper's Daughter.

The story is one of community cohesion at its heart - so it seems fitting that we're making our own creative opportunities in the local area, and are creating a high quality webseries that the whole community can be involved in!

We're so excited to tell our quirky story and can't wait to get filming!

 

 

How You Can Help

We're looking to raise £2000 to help us get this pooch funded! This will cover:

Equipment Hire

Location Hire

Food and Travel Expenses

Web Festival Entries

VFX

Whatever funds we raise will go toward raising the production values of the series. We want whatever is on screen to look amazing! We're all volunteers on this project because we love the story and want to tell it to the best of our ability.

 

The Impact

The purpose of this project is to provide an artistic experience chiefly for local young people, but also for anyone in the local area who'd like to get behind or infront of the camera in some capacity.

Young people will gain industry experience from working alongside local filmmakers, who have worked professionally for years.

For some of the community company it's their first experience of filmmaking. Others make films regularly. We've never made a film together. It's about time. 

This project allows us to make five short episodes that link together in a wider story, giving everyone the chance to get involved in some aspect of the production. Dead Dog Returns links filmmakers, writers and actors throughout South Norfolk and North Suffolk and we hope  it will have a positive impact for years to come.

Writer/Producer Mark Finbow runs professional theatre company The Keeper's Daughter and has written successful short films that have screened all over the world.  Co-Producers Trett Films most recently won the audience award at Norwich Film Festival with their debut short Above The Fold. 

Our young production company have had a great deal of local success making their own films, acting in innovative theatre productions and bringing artistic events to the community - Robbie Sunderland, a maverick of our times, is one of the writers on Film Suffolk's latest venture, The Haunted Hotel Project.

 

Risks & Challenges

Dead Dog Returns is a quirky adventure story and has a bold vision. It's adventurous, with a large and diverse teenage cast, a number of chase sequences and some great visual effects. 

Production company The Keeper's Daughter has staged a series of artistic events with young people and Trett Films regularly teach visual effects classes for aspiring filmmakers.

We are currently working diligently on the pre-production for the upcoming shoot this May.

Other Ways You Can Help

As well as financial backing, we'd love it if you could spread the word as far and as wide as possible. :)

www.facebook.com/deaddogreturns
