story:
BEHIND THE SCENES: THE CASTING STRATEGY

We wanted to cast the show the way the Millennials see the world, and for the most part, that is without color lines. The younger generation shuns the racism mentality that their parents (possibly) and grandparents (likely) had to some degree. In fact, one might go as far as to say they’re defiant of it. Instead, the Millennial generation just sees people as people. The melting  pot is the status quo for them. So, when we were thinking through the casting for the show, we were very cognizant of capturing that.

 

HATTIE STEWART

MILLENNIALS CREATOR / PRODUCER / WRITER

For 20+ years, Hattie Stewart has been the driving force behind countless successful $10 million+ projects. And, after being inspired by the incomparable Suzanne dePasse, it is a skill set she now applies to the TV / film projects in which she is involved as a Producer / Writer.

Her primary areas of expertise include assembling crew, scheduling, coordinating and budgeting. In addition to overseeing the production and scripting of Millennials, Stewart also has another TV series and film short projects in development  as well as partnering with Terayle Hill on a feature film titled Fatima. Stewart is the co-founder and COO of Fourth Quarter Media Group

 

CURTIS BROWN

MILLENNIALS CREATOR / PRODUCER / WRITER

Curtis Brown is a bona fide entertainment industry veteran. His professional career began with him working on the "creative" side of the music business as a songwriter and performer for 17 years but he also has 11 years of experience on the "business" side with management. Currently, however, Brown is focusing his efforts on the TV / Film side of the entertainment industry,recently partnering with Hattie Stewart to form multimedia production firm Fourth Quarter Media Group. Staying true to one of his innate talents, Brown spends much of his time working as a writer and / or producer for a variety of scripted TV, documentary, feature and short film projects. As a result, he has a full slate of projects. His short list of includes two feature film projects--a drama called The Beautiful Ones and a comedy called Changed Man--as well as a documentary style biopic called 15 Minutes and documentary about homelessness called Previous Address.

What We Need & What You Get

 

All funds will go towards production cost and crew compensation, so every dime counts for this project.

  • Cinematography Fees
  • Crew 
  • Locations
  • Editing
  • Scoring
  • Wardrobe
  • Craft Services

The Impact

This series will dive into the major impact that Millennials are making on the world as well as revealing some of lives real challenges that are encountered along the way

Risks & Challenges

As independent filmmakers, we have the challenges  that you would ordinarily associate with independent filming. Time and money.

With your donations, we will have secured a budget that will allow us to completely execute this project.

With time of the essence, we will undoubtedly be faced with unforeseen obstacles once we enter into the principal photography phase. We are all experienced filmmakers and we know how to overcome problems and issues. The production will not be slowed down by these obstacles.

Other Ways You Can Help

We completely understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!!

SHARE!! SHARE!! SHARE!!

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.

story:
My name is Erik Van Beuzekom and I am the author/adapter/producer. I staged this play Don Juan at our theatre in 2011. I realized that it needed more space to breathe so this is the venue for that bigger platform.

The $8,000 is the initial seed money to start a company, create a winning pitch package to woo and court investors on the benefits of a web series of the poem of Don Juan. The money will go towards lawyer fees, graphic design and printing and gifts and perks for investors. The investor phase will begin after the company is set up. Our goal for fundraising will be $600,000 to $1 million per episode.

I am part of a bigger team on this project and let me introduce them to you,

Alex Hillkurtz, Director. Alex Hillkurtz is a noted storyboard artist The Intern, Argo, Vanilla Sky, Almost Famous. He has been nominated three times for Excellence in Production Design by the Art Directors Guild of America. He is currently living in Paris and executing watercolors on the streets of Paris. He is a member of the Directors Guild of America. 

Kirk Scott, Producer. Kirk is known for his work on Nightmare before Christmas (1993) Coraline (2009). He is a talented Camera technician, Stage Manager, Set Supervisor and Organizer extraordinaire. He has worked in the film industry for 25 years. He is happily married with his wife Monica and lives in Shadow Hills, Ca. 

Clara Bianca, Cinematographer. She has a degree at the Universidad del Cine in Buenos Aires, Argentina, in cinematography, focusing on Lighting and Camera. While in College she also had attended various workshops, seminars and courses in specialized photography, digital video and documentary film-making in several institutions like Punto Cine, Cinema Gotika, Global Cinematography Institute (GCI), RED Digital Cinema, between others.  Her licentiate thesis was recentrly published as a book called "Dirección de Fotografía y Efectos Visuales". It is about the role of the cinematographer in motion pictures that combine live and virtual shots. 

With this team in place and a great script and concept and with the support and encouragement of people like you I am sure we sill succeed. I have produced over 40 plays in 10 years at our theatre in Washington state and am confident in handling a verse based creative story. I also have skilled filmmaking professionals on the team to make this happen.

This initial money is just for the formation of the company and its promotion for bigger investors and partners.  We need a first rate pitch package and cost breakdown to court big name investors.

This is the beginning of a realization of a dream. It's a also a counter to the dearth of superhero stories that are prevalent today. We want to offer an alternative.

We are a great risk because we aim to build this from the ground up. Creating a community of people that wish to see offerings just like this. This campaign and your contribution will allow us to have that opportunity.

Find us on instagram at byron's don juan.

story:
Whats it about?

Day One is a 10 part fantasy horror series that is set in two distinct time-zones, modern day and 10 years later, it revolves around Carolin Casey, an 11 year old girl from a NORMAL family in manchester.  On Day One Carolins world collapses around her as a mysterious affliction destroys the world as she knows it, losing her brother, sister, mother and father in the process.  We follow Carolin as she tries to survive in a post apocalyptic Manchester, always striving to find out what has happened to her family.  An elusive man always at periphery of vision, stalks her, and where he walks necromancy is never far behind

Whats it really about?

Family!  The lengths we would all go to make sure our family are safe and well, the mistakes parents sometimes make and how the decisions those parents make can have long lasting effects on their children for many years to come, all told from the perspective of a lonely 11 year old girl.

Where did it come from?

Day One was originally a short film script i wrote for my two children, after spending a little more time on it i realised the core idea had the potential to be a lot longer, from there it was adapted into a 6 part series of 10 minutes each, again I had idea after idea and just had to expand it.

I linked up and started collaborating with another writer David Edwards and bish bash bosh( 1 year later) we have 10 parts of 23minutes each, with a timeline that could enable us to write enough material to cover 3 series.

Some of our wonderful cast

Laura Ellen Wilson is an actress and black belt martial artist, from Lancashire. After graduating with a degree in Musical theatre, Laura enjoyed a 6-year career working overseas as a Choreographer/Dancer/Singer. At the start of 2017, Laura gave up travelling to pursue a life long passion in screen acting. She can be seen as the co-lead in extreme horror ‘Monster’, a book-to-screen adaptation to be released later this year and the lead in horror anthology ‘Surprise’, premiering this Halloween.

Lucy Turner now 11 years old has been acting since she was 7 starting her career in a nationwide commercial playing the lead daughter in the Ronald McDonald house charities commercial "Dads Voice", Since then Lucy has appeared in several Short films and has secured lead roles in Musical theatre shows Annie, The Lion King and more recently Honk where she is playing the role of ugly, we are over the moon to have lucy and look forward to what she will bring to the highly emotional character of Young Carolin.

Charlotte Turner's passion is for film and TV, aged only 9 years old, you can see Charlotte on commercials, TV and Feature films across the world.  Charlottes empathy is beyond any other little girl i have ever seen and cant wait to see how she uses it in her character.

 

Alex De Luca is an actor, who fell in love with the idea of being an actor when he was a young man, after watching Kenneth Branagh perform in Hamlet. In his efforts to become an actor, he studied drama in Doncaster and London, but on completion of these studies he still felt wanting, and so he went to 'The Actors Space' just outside Barcelona to hone his skills and continue learning his craft. He became very involved with the Jaques Lecoq method of acting while at the ‘Actors Space’, which is where actors are encouraged to investigate ways of performance that suit them best. This training is aimed at nurturing the creativity of the performer, as opposed to giving them a codified set of skills. This is accomplished by never telling the actors how to do what is supposedly “right”, and by encouraging the actors to keep trying new avenues of creative expression! Alex has been in many feature films and TV series which include; the ‘Cleansing’, ‘Whiteblade’, ‘Macbeth’, ‘Five Hells for a Thief’, ‘Independent Dreams’, ‘Wuthering Heights’, ‘Missing the Point’, ‘The Crown of Thorns’ and ‘Brain Barrage’. Alex is a very sought-after actor who is cast in the following films and TV series which are either in development or pre-production; ‘Pestilence Lane’, ‘King Lear’, ‘Memoria Draco’, and of course the very much anticipated series ‘Day One’.

Why make it?

Various levels of interest has been shown on the project over the past 12 months, and its crunch time, we either need to knuckle down and start making it, or put it in the drawer with the mothballs.  This project is familiar enough (zombie apocalypse) yet has a poignant message that will entertain and educate all parents that come to watch it. Think of it as the British walking dead's little cousin twice removed who was adopted, and you will be nowhere near, but I can guarantee you will want to know what happens next.

What makes you qualified to make it?

Someone asked me that question in a film making documentary, and my answer is still the same, my passion for film knows no bounds, if there's a way it can be made it will and I wont give up until every possible route has been explored.

I could tell you about the 4 feature films I've helped produce with varying budgets between £10k and £3million, but that's not what its about, its about getting the message out and providing the opportunities to fantastic and talented local cast and crew. This is one story that is begging to be told, so why not let us brits do it for a change, and with some style.

If I give you money where is it going to go?

The majority of the money will go on paying wages for cast and crew, plus feeding everyone throughout the 8-10 day shoot.  

Cast and Crew - £4650                                                                    SFX Makeup - £270                                   Crowdfunder costs - £1080                                                           Total - £6000

All other costs will be covered by the current producers or if we reach our targets via stretch goals

Cast and Crew - £4650                                                                  SFX Makeup - £270               Crowdfunder costs - £1080                                                         Post - £500                                                       Locations - £500                                                                             Supporting Artists - £1000                          Festivals - £500                                                                               Writers - £1000                                             Equipment/Props - £500                                                             Total - £10,000

Early Costume concepts

We want a gritty and real feeling, but it also has to be taken into account that, for ten years our characters have survived in a lawless and dangerous environment, bring on the weapons!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant help financially, please spread the word far and wide, use your social media and spread it with indiegogo's share tools!!

Alex is a very sought-after actor who is cast in the following films and TV series which are either in development or pre-production; ‘Pestilence Lane’, ‘King Lear’, ‘Memoria Draco’, and of course the very much anticipated series ‘Day One’.

Various levels of interest has been shown on the project over the past 12 months, and its crunch time, we either need to knuckle down and start making it, or put it in the drawer with the mothballs.  This project is familiar enough (zombie apocalypse) yet has a poignant message that will entertain and educate all parents that come to watch it. Think of it as the British walking dead's little cousin twice removed who was adopted, and you will be nowhere near, but I can guarantee you will want to know what happens next.
What makes you qualified to make it?
Someone asked me that question in a film making documentary, and my answer is still the same, my passion for film knows no bounds, if there's a way it can be made it will and I wont give up until every possible route has been explored.
I could tell you about the 4 feature films I've helped produce with varying budgets between £10k and £3million, but that's not what its about, its about getting the message out and providing the opportunities to fantastic and talented local cast and crew. This is one story that is begging to be told, so why not let us brits do it for a change, and with some style.
If I give you money where is it going to go?
The majority of the money will go on paying wages for cast and crew, plus feeding everyone throughout the 8-10 day shoot.  

Cast and Crew - £4650                                                                    SFX Makeup - £270                                   Crowdfunder costs - £1080                                                           Total - £6000
All other costs will be covered by the current producers or if we reach our targets via stretch goals

Cast and Crew - £4650                                                                  SFX Makeup - £270               Crowdfunder costs - £1080                                                         Post - £500                                                       Locations - £500                                                                             Supporting Artists - £1000                          Festivals - £500                                                                               Writers - £1000                                             Equipment/Props - £500                                                             Total - £10,000
Early Costume concepts
We want a gritty and real feeling, but it also has to be taken into account that, for ten years our characters have survived in a lawless and dangerous environment, bring on the weapons!
 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you cant help financially, please spread the word far and wide, use your social media and spread it with indiegogo's share tools!!

story:
Introduction

In 2014 I completed 'The Light', my first short film as writer, director and producer, about an emotionally fragile immigrant; a light that refuses to change; a solitary junction ... and a mysterious Urban Stranger, that all converge on a single, haunting and unforgettable night.

The Light can best be described as a drama with meta-physical overtones, exploring the themes of loneliness, migration, identity and, ultimately, choice - The choice to stay stuck at a crossroads (mental or otherwise), or the choice to leave it.

The Light Urban Chronicles series is a thrilling and dramaticly surprising continuation into that world and those themes! As well as the continual exploration of myself as a filmmaker. 

poster#1 for The Light 

A trailer for my short The Light

 

The Story

The Light: Urban Chronicles expands the myth of Urban Man, the all seeing stranger from 'The Light'; he intercepts the needy at junctures of heightened turmoil, deliciously prodding them - for good or bad - to see the light:

Episode one tells the story of Anne, a visiting carer trapped in an elevator with Urban stranger. A battle of wills reveals an astonishing revelation, culminating in the most terrifying decision of Anne's life.

Terence Anderson stars as the mysterious Urban stranger

 

What We Need & What You Get

Technology has thankfully rendered the expensive vocation of film-making accessible to pretty much all. Yet despite the micro scale, maintaining goodwill and professionalism is an absolute priority and I'm committed to rewarding my colleagues for their time, commitment and efforts. Your money will also aid toward a casting space, locations, traveling costs and food.

With that said, I understand it's not just what I get, but what your good selves will also receive! And in that spirit I've some goodies to entice and impress, including an end of film thank you credit, digital copy of my short The Light, and - for those with deep pockets and/or BIG love for the project - an associate producer credit!

All smiles: some cast and crew pose for a quick pic on set of The Light.

Night moves: one of many late night shoots from my debut short The Light

 

Production is already underway!

Pre production has already begun on episode one, with the script and story-boards complete and locations diligently found, as well as returnees Terence Anderson (whose credits include Captain Philips)  back as Urban Man and Andrew Sowerby returning as Editor.

Only the casting of Anne, a few supporting roles, some crew positions and YOUR backing are outstanding before shooting commences in April!

story-boards complete: page one of The light: Urban chronicles#1

 

story-boards made real: Anne on a park bench followed by actual location

 

story-boards made real: Anne walks through estate
 

 

story-boards complete: page two of The light: Urban chronicles#1

 

The Impact

I envision this (and future episodes) further exploiting themes that examine our mutual fears, our darkest most base desires, and our most unspeakable of sins; to produce stories which might be conclusive to some, open-ended and dilemma-filled to others, and yet leave us all to involuntarily reflect upon our own lives; our questionable choices. To perhaps help us better see .. the light.

I encourage people to join not just this campaign, but the entire journey!

 

Risks & Challenges

The flip side to the budget being so low is there are very few risks involved, other than the personal 'risk' of creating something truly fantastic and releasing it into the world. Which I consider a privilege.

What I can absolutely guarantee is to be wholly committed, passionate and professional; to bring what I truly believe to be a great idea to full fruition.

Night, camera, action: director and crew confer on The Light set

 

Sharing is Caring!

So please, at the very least, share this campaign (using the share-tools provided) with as many people as you possibly can; there’s always a chance they’ll feel the same as you. Remember: this is how revolutions start, people... with you!

 

More work from J Bunting Johnson

Still hungry for more? Then check out further samples of my work below, including the logo animation for my production company and episodes of Re watchables; a youtube show celebrating peoples favourite guilty re watched-movie pleasures!

And if that's STILL not enough, you can check out the links to my J Bunting Johnson website and The Light Facebook page below, where you'll find even MORE Re watchables episodes, additional pictures and info on the light Chronicles and short film, plus plenty more!

AJO FILMS logo: an animated logo for my fledgling production company

Re watchables: The Horse Whisperer
 

Rewatchables: Dirty Dancing

 
http://jbuntingjohnson.onfabrik.com

 

https://www.facebook.com/thelightshort/

 

Giving Thanks

To those who contributed to the quality of this campaign:

  • Andrew Sowerby (editor: video-pitch +The Light trail)
  • Sylwia Domaradzka (director profiles & set pics)
  • Prabal Purkayastha (posters co designer)
  • Chan Celestial (poster#1 co designer)
  • Lyndon White (AJO logo co designer/animator)
  • James Cannel (AJO logo sound designer)

Thanks guys!

story:
The Premise

Sam and his college friend group are sick of the way their middle school bullies impacted their personalities, so they set out on a road trip to face them one by one. Because taking down your bully 15 years after the fact will fix everything... right?

What is "The Anti-Bullying Defense League"?

"The Anti-Bullying Defense League" was created by writer/actor Andrew Cawley at the beginning of the pandemic, after a true story from a friend sparked the idea of adult friends helping each other face childhood bullies. With everything going on at the time, Andrew sought to tell a story that brought a sense of joy and companionship to its characters AND its audience. 

Three episodes will be shot in September of 2021, directed by Sally Marian Rubin, with Assistant Director Samantha Slaughter and cinematography by Rhett Thompson. The trio has worked together on a previous project, which is currently showing in festivals around the U.S. and in Europe. 

How Your Donation Will Help 

We’re looking to raise $10,000 to make this series totally kick-ass.

This is a not-for-profit production. This means all funding will go toward the production including, but not limited to: equipment, production design, craft services, payment for cast and crew, festival entry fees, and transportation (can’t shoot a road trip without the road!). 

If you want a little bonus from your donation (besides our eternal gratitude), you can also view our Perks to see how you can get anything from a special shout-out for your business to an Executive Producer credit. 

Meet Your Team

Andrew Cawley - Creator/ActorAndrew Cawley is an actor/writer/comedian in Chicago. Recent credits include an entry in the 2021 Sundance Film Festival and two features that are currently in the festival circuit. He loves his friends and family and laughter and wanted to put as much of the joy he gets from the people in his life on screen as possible, so that, hopefully, everybody can have a little more love and joy in their lives. When he's not writing or acting, he's probably getting his ass beat by middle schoolers in pickup basketball.

Sally Marian Rubin - Producer/Director

Sally Rubin graduated from Syracuse University in 2020 with degrees in Television, Radio & Film, and English & Creative Writing. Before graduating, Sally completed a production internship at Late Night With Seth Meyers that solidified her love for comedy. Her most recent short film, which she wrote, directed, and produced amidst the Covid-19 pandemic, is an official selection of multiple national and international film festivals. More than anything, she hopes you feel as much joy watching "The Anti-Bullying Defense League" as she feels making it. 

Sam Slaughter - First Assistant Director/First Assistant Camera Samantha E. Slaughter earned a B.F.A. in Film and a minor in Business from Syracuse University in 2021 and studied 35mm Film Production from FAMU, the fifth oldest film school in the world in 2020. Many of Samantha’s works fall under the experimental genre, where she enjoys experimenting with visual storytelling and music composition. With this series, she is excited to utilize the skills she has developed through these past pieces into the works of a narrative production. As if she needed to get any cooler, Samantha has also played the oboe for 13 years. 

Rhett Thompson - Cinematographer

Rhett Thompson is a Chicago-based cinematographer, writer, and director. He was worked on several award-winning feature and short films, including a short he recently shot with Sally and Sam that is currently playing in the national and international festival circuit. Rhett believes in the power of making good content with good people and goes above and beyond to create the best visuals for whatever story he’s telling. In the rare instance he’s not on set, Rhett can probably be found exploring the city for pizza and Vietnamese coffee.

Other Ways You Can Help

If a financial donation doesn’t work for you right now, no problem. We’re grateful for any and all help.

Helpful donations include, but are not limited to: equipment, food/drink for the set craft table, and assistance securing locations.

And pretty please help us spread the word! Share this link to anyone you know who may want to help fund, follow us and share our Instagram content, and stay up to date on all things happening with “The Anti-Bullying Defense League”. We know you’re going to love it. 

Love,

The Anti-Bullying Defense League (@antibullyingdefenseleague)

story:
What we are doing:

     We are setting out to make a Docuseries following the journey of aspiring singers who attempt to use a Karaoke competition as a stepping-stone to break into the Music Industry. I’ve always loved Karaoke, and I don't know about you but I was shocked to find out that you can do it competitively, and more blown away at the fact that; not only could you do it competitively, but those who choose to compete in the Karaoke World Championships have a real shot at achieving their dreams of becoming a professional entertainer.

Why we are making this:

      Representation, Opportunity, and a Safe Space where people can be exactly who they want to be without feeling judged — That's why I’m making this. Those things mean a lot to me and I feel like this League provides that for everyone involved. I want to help shine a light - if I can - on a world that not only caught my attention but a world that I began to really care about while spending time with a few of the people involved.

Why we need your help:

     With your help, we will have the ability to tell the stories of those involved in the best way possible, and in order to do that, we’ll need to be able to hire an experienced crew, and have use of good equipment. Our funding goal for the first season(3 episodes) of the series is $108,500. After creating a comprehensive budgeting outline, $108,500 was the number we felt could help us cover Airfare, Lodging, Equipment Rentals, Crew Salary (On Location & Post Production), and Miscellaneous Production Costs (Marketing, Entertainment Lawyer, Supplies, Food, Gas)

Other ways you can help:​

     Spreading the word! I do understand we are in a Pandemic and that these are difficult times for everyone. So for those not able to donate please don't shy away, your shares/likes/retweets/posts could make just as much of a difference in helping us reach our goal, and it would be just as much appreciated. Thank you all!

When this will happen:

     Pre-Production is already underway! We have a tentative shoot schedule beginning in May of 2021.

story:
Synopsis

Sounds Good is a comedy series following an eclectic cast of characters at a struggling retail music store. Our protagonist, Jake, is a musician so lost in life that he’s resorted to sleeping on his free-spirited Grandmother’s couch. Most days is a balancing act between his off the wall best friend Boomer, who lives like it’s 1985, and Jake’s secret love interest and career-driven boss, Charleigh. Nothing comes easy at Sounds Good and maybe for that reason nothing gets done. But something has to change…right?

What’s Different?

Sounds Good is a strange world, period, and it’s characters find homes there for a reason. But despite all the silliness and at times the surreal nature of Sounds Good, there is a lot of heart. These are people shaped by their circumstances whether it’s poverty, homelessness, or a lack of direction in life, and no matter how lightly they handle their situations, some harsh realities cannot be denied.

Behind the Story

Unless you’ve worked in retail before, you’d probably be surprised at how many outlandish stories come from dead-end jobs. One night, while celebrating a friend’s birthday, our stories began to flow and Sounds Good -thank the birthday boy for the name- was born. Like many ideas that are forged in a party setting, nobody expected much of anything to come out of it. Yet, it was an idea none of us could let go of and one we were all weirdly qualified to handle.

Jonathan

Jonathan is a theatre/film actor and singer/songwriter with training from UCB (NYC) and film credits including work with Lenovo and Audi. He will play Jake and is the executive producer.

Chelsea

Theater major with credits including HBO, Travel Channel, Food Lion. She will play Charleigh and is the director of the show.

Jesse

Jesse is a guitarist, songwriter, and performer who has been featured in Guitar Player Magazine as a rising guitarist to watch out for. He will play Boomer and is the lead composer for the show.

Christa

Christa is an audio engineer with past clients including VW Volkswagen, PBS, and National Geographic. She is the lead sound engineer.

Zach

Zach is a writer with a degree in Literature and Creative Writing from UNC Asheville. He will play Ski and is the head writer of Sounds Good.

We have already written the entire eight-episode season, now we just need your help to bring our vision to your screen.

Budget Breakdown

COVID has obviously not been kind to anyone, least of all artists. That’s why we’re making sure every dollar donated is spent as efficiently and appropriately as possible. Below, you’ll find a breakdown of our $7,000 budget.

Clearly, most of our money is dedicated to our location. To bring as much authenticity as possible to the production we’ve secured an actual store front where the bulk of the show will be shot. Rounding out the remainder of our location costs is set design and travel, because getting a team of cast and crew from point A to point B and back again is a production in itself.

Another twenty-five percent of the budget (Equipment and Wardrobe) ensures that the audio and visual quality of Sounds Good is unmatched by other web series. Aside from equipment, wardrobe and make-up go a long way in helping the visuals of the show truly pop.

Of course, not all costs can be calculated. Surprises always come up in production, so we’ve built our contingency budget into our $7,000 goal. In addition, for cast and crew safety we’re investing in proper sanitation and PPE for both on and off location to help prevent the spread of Coronavirus.

Perk Tiers

We understand that it’s not easy to donate to a production you’re not involved in, especially in the current state of our economy. That’s why we want to show our appreciation for every person we can with some donation perks.

Every donation gets you a Sounds Good sticker.

  • $10 – Koozie
  • $25 – Sounds Good Shirt
  • $50 – Special Invitation to our Watch Party.
  • $75 – Special thanks mention in the Credits of the show.
  • $100 – Boomer will give you a personalized thank you in a Boozin’ with Boomer video.
  • $250 – Walk-on role
  • $500 – Associate Producer credit. You will be IMBD official for life.
  • $1000 – Executive Producer Credit.

Can’t Donate?

You can still show your support by following our socials to stay up to date with behind the scenes content, release dates, merch, and more.

Timeline

With the script already written, we are expecting to begin filming in December with full episodes set to release in early 2021.

Yet, it was an idea none of us could let go of and one we were all weirdly qualified to handle.

Jonathan

Jonathan is a theatre/film actor and singer/songwriter with training from UCB (NYC) and film credits including work with Lenovo and Audi. He will play Jake and is the executive producer.
Chelsea

Theater major with credits including HBO, Travel Channel, Food Lion. She will play Charleigh and is the director of the show.
Jesse

Jesse is a guitarist, songwriter, and performer who has been featured in Guitar Player Magazine as a rising guitarist to watch out for. He will play Boomer and is the lead composer for the show.
Christa

Christa is an audio engineer with past clients including VW Volkswagen, PBS, and National Geographic. She is the lead sound engineer.
Zach

Zach is a writer with a degree in Literature and Creative Writing from UNC Asheville. He will play Ski and is the head writer of Sounds Good.
We have already written the entire eight-episode season, now we just need your help to bring our vision to your screen.
Budget Breakdown
COVID has obviously not been kind to anyone, least of all artists. That’s why we’re making sure every dollar donated is spent as efficiently and appropriately as possible. Below, you’ll find a breakdown of our $7,000 budget.

Clearly, most of our money is dedicated to our location. To bring as much authenticity as possible to the production we’ve secured an actual store front where the bulk of the show will be shot. Rounding out the remainder of our location costs is set design and travel, because getting a team of cast and crew from point A to point B and back again is a production in itself.
Another twenty-five percent of the budget (Equipment and Wardrobe) ensures that the audio and visual quality of Sounds Good is unmatched by other web series. Aside from equipment, wardrobe and make-up go a long way in helping the visuals of the show truly pop.
Of course, not all costs can be calculated. Surprises always come up in production, so we’ve built our contingency budget into our $7,000 goal. In addition, for cast and crew safety we’re investing in proper sanitation and PPE for both on and off location to help prevent the spread of Coronavirus.
Perk Tiers
We understand that it’s not easy to donate to a production you’re not involved in, especially in the current state of our economy. That’s why we want to show our appreciation for every person we can with some donation perks.
Every donation gets you a Sounds Good sticker.

$10 – Koozie
$25 – Sounds Good Shirt
$50 – Special Invitation to our Watch Party.
$75 – Special thanks mention in the Credits of the show.
$100 – Boomer will give you a personalized thank you in a Boozin’ with Boomer video.
$250 – Walk-on role
$500 – Associate Producer credit. You will be IMBD official for life.
$1000 – Executive Producer Credit.

Can’t Donate?
You can still show your support by following our socials to stay up to date with behind the scenes content, release dates, merch, and more.
Timeline
With the script already written, we are expecting to begin filming in December with full episodes set to release in early 2021.

story:
Short Summary

What is "Empowered: The Series"?:

  • A 10-episode web series focusing on a group of teenage superheroes as they further develop their powers, and are united in the efforts to rescue an endangered friend and fight a threat to their very existence. 
  • A superhero web series that seeks to turn the typical lack and/or poor representation of women in the genre on its head, and present female superheroes in a new fashion: normal, every day, strong women who happen to have superpowers; someone that girls can actually look up to. Although the characters have superpowers, we believe that they can show children, adolescents, and young adults--especially girls/young women--that they can feel empowered simply by who they are as a person. 

Crew: 

  • Jarrod Finn- Writer/Creator
  • Kris Wilcox- Director
  • Brian Hagy- Director of Photography
  • Linda Evans- Location Scout
  • Mandi Huffman- Brand Consultant
  • Johnny Nation- Practical Effects
  • Genna Roth- Production Assistant/Key Grip

 

Cast:

We are currently recasting a couple roles. 

  • Madelyn Childress as Evelyn "Evie" Tobolsky. Evie is a 16-year-old Broadway and theater fanatic who lives for the stage and for performing. She dreams to be a professional singer just like her grandmother from whom Evie gets her affinity for 40s big band music/standards. Evie is one of the most warm-hearted, kind, caring, jovial, and giving people you'll ever meet; her ability to make people feel welcome and appreciated is astounding. Superpowers: Sonic scream; siren song (can bend a person's will to hers by singing).
  • Keilah Wilson as Bryn Cooke. Bryn is 17, extremely socially and politically active (she is an aspiring journalist), and a military brat. After the loss of her mother Korinne, she and her father moved to Champaign to be closer to her grandmother. The loss, which shattered both their worlds, forged an even closer relationship with her father. She is one of Evie's best friends and is on the school newspaper staff with her. Superpower: Super intelligence; developing telekinesis. 
  • Jess Schlipf as Hayden Bennet. Hayden is 17, and has become a close confidant of Evie, and a good friend with the rest of the group. She's formed a bond with Tempest--Hayden was once the new kid just like Tempest--and has helped her adjust. On the surface, Hayden is friendly but after years of battling insecurities has developed defenses that can cause her personality to flip quickly. No super powers.
  • McKenzie Deremiah as Tempest Grace.  Tempest is a 15-year-old dance student who has a love for ballet. She has only been studying for about 6 months or so, but has oddly picked everything up rapidly. Tempest identifies as Queer, and currently has a crush on a junior named Bree. While socially awkward and not entirely skilled at making friends, when she is able to she is incredibly loyal to them. Such is the case as the group of girls (Evie, Bryn, and Hayden) have welcomed them into the group. For most of her youth Tempest has searched for friends to help her break out of her shell, and finally, she's found said friends. She and Hayden have formed a close bond as they both battle through insecurities. Superpower: We'll just call it "kinesthetics" for now. She has a sort of super agility, is able to pick up and replicate physical movements (sports, dance, etc) extremely quickly, and can foresee a person's movements/attacks several steps ahead.
  • Selima Samaha- TBA. 
  • Prince F. Robertson as Dr. Gregory "Greg" Cooke. Greg, 42 and Bryn's stern yet loving father, is a recently retired Colonel in the U.S. Army. After graduating from Westpoint, his exceptional intelligence helped him climb the military ranks quite rapidly until he reached Colonel by his mid-30s, in addition to obtaining a PhD while serving his country. As a military intelligence and Chemical, Biological, Radiological, and Nuclear (CBRN) officer, Greg conducted biological/scientific research on the regenerative capabilities in animals and their potential human applications. Said research was pushed along after the manifestation of his own regenerative powers—these powers explain why Greg appears to look much younger than he actually is. By the time of his retirement, he had reached the rank of colonel and certainly had a much longer and illustrious career ahead of him. However, his decision to retire and move back home to teach at the University of Illinois was spurred on by two factors: 1) his fear of the military discovering his powers and using them immorally/for military medicine and weapons (these fears weren't completely off base as military intelligence began suspecting something and 2) the death of his wife Korinne—she was killed as a superpowered individual attempted to stop a robbery. Very much in love with her, her death shook Greg to the core and left him guilt- ridden for not being there to use his powers to protect her. Seeking comfort and now raising his now 16-year-old daughter Bryn alone, he retired, moved back home to be near his parents in Champaign, and accepted a position as a professor at the university. To this day he has kept his powers completely secret.
  • James R. Ling as Alex Davenport.  Alex, 30, is a PhD candidate at the local university and works as a TA for Bryn Cooke's father Gregory. What Alex lacks in powers, he makes up for in intelligence and his ability to absorb new information quickly. Throughout his academic career, Alex has been obsessed with the regenerative nature of certain organisms. That obsession leads him to discover Gregory Cooke's research, which in turn became the catalyst for Alex's desire to work under Cooke.
  • Brooke Sellers as Bree. Bree, 16, is a warm, caring, bubbly person who sees the best in people. Her mother is of Filipino decent (her father white), and she is learning to appreciate the culture of her ancestors. She has fallen in love with graphic design, and does most of the design for the high school's newspaper. Also Tempest's crush, the two of them build a close relationship in which Bree becomes the yang to Tempest's yin. Bree helps Tempest come out of her shell, and become more comfortable with herself.

What We Need & What You Get

For this leg of the crowdfunding campaign, we are seeking a total of $4,000. Your donations to this campaign will cover the following:

  • Pre-Production/Production/Post-Production Costs (Test shots, equipment rental, crew, reshoots/pick ups if necessary)
  • Catering/Crafts Table for Cast and Crew
  • Props/Practical Effects
  • Travel and Lodging for One or Two Cast Members
  • Fulfilling perks

Any excess or leftover funds will be applied to branding such as posters, etc., and used to fund the full season. 

Perks for contributing will range from a hearty thank you to digital and physical copies of both the pilot and the script to actual props from production to even invitations to set, screenings, and after parties. We even offer an opportunity to be an executive producer. 

Funds, if we reach at least 80% of our goal but fall short, will still be applied to production costs as best we can. If we do not raise enough funds, production will not be possible and refunds will be offered. 

The Impact

  • While our overall goal is to create an entertaining and well-produced pilot episode, our intentions are to bring a new perspective to the superhero genre. As superhero and comic book fans, we have grown frustrated with not only the lackluster representation of females, but also realistic female heroes when they are present. We have decided to remedy this issue by creating superheroes women, young and old alike, can relate to and support. No fawning over boys. No costumes that make them look like Jane Fonda in an exercise video. Real, down to earth, teenage girls that face everyday struggles and just happen to have powers. 
  • In addition to the female representation, we seek to tackle issues that currently face the nation; issues/topics that we feel the nation needs to see and hear. 
  • In the end, we hope to create a world of superheroes that ALL people can look up to and cheer on.
