Check out our tiers for more info! Our financial goal seems like a pretty penny, but filmmaking is anything but cheap. It’s important you know where your money’s going, so we’ve laid out our budget for you.•Health Safety: We pledged to provide hand sanitizer, disposable masks/gloves, and disinfectant on all our sets this spring. We take the critical issue of COVID-19 extremely seriously, and you can find our safety plan farther down.•Equipment: As hard as we can try, it would be ambitious to create a TV show without a camera. We’re raising funds to obtain better equipment to present our story to you with our best foot forward.•Props/Location: World-building is much harder than it seems. We tried a dry run without any props and locations and… well, it wasn’t great. That’s why our budget will also go to renting safe locations and constructing props.•Food for Cast/Crew: You should see a film set before lunch and compare it to a film set after lunch. Considering all the hard work our cast and crew dedicates to the show, this is crucial. A Small NoteIt’s not like college students to ask for money… cough... but we want to reiterate how important to us your contributions are. Whether you’re here to donate, share with friends, or DM to Tiger Woods (which reminds us, please DM this campaign to Tiger Woods), we cannot express how much we appreciate your support. By taking time out of your day to read this, you’re helping us an incredible amount. Thank you, and we hope you’ll watch A Piece of Art after our production in Spring 2021! Risks & Challenges2020 has taught us that plans change. Events are canceled, postponed, accidentally reserved at landscaping companies instead of luxury hotels… That’s why we have prepared for the chance that school may revert to remote education. Because of this possibility, we are planning to finish filming our pilot only three weeks into production, postponing the production of the remaining five episodes to Fall 2021 if needed.As stated earlier, we take the health of our cast and crew very seriously. Below, you can find a link to our COVID-19 safety protocol. We are filming in accordance with NY state’s production guidelines, and some of our policies have been summarized below.•Filming with minimum cast/crew on set, 50% occupancy of every location.•Disinfecting props and equipment between takes.•Handling as much business remotely as possible.Please take a minute to review our full document if you get a chance:https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sVYbnbzZbq55gd... How Else Can I Help?There are lots of different ways to contribute to our campaign. Here are just a few:•Know someone who’s interested in film/television, or might find this project interesting? Send the link to this campaign their way!•Are you an Ithaca College student? We’re still looking for talented and eager members to join our community!•@TigerWoods on Twitter about it. C’mon Tiger, notice us. Got any questions or comments? We’d love to respond! Send them our way at APieceOfArt@ICTV.org. Thanks!

story:
Vous avez déjà entendu parler de sorcellerie africaine...

Vous savez que l'Afrique regorge de légendes plus fascinantes les unes que les autres.

Mais vous êtes frustrés par leurs raretés dans les séries et films qui vous sont proposés.

Et quand ces légendes sont abordées, les personnages qui les incarnent vous semblent peu modernes, grotesques et moqueurs.

Vous voulez que cela change ?

Soutenez-nous et ensemble valorisons les légendes africaines à travers un projet moderne et ambitieux :

La série Doctor K

 

 

 

Doctor K est le marabout des stars, des hommes politiques et des criminels en tous genres. Ces hommes d'influence le consultent pour assouvir en secret leurs vices les plus immoraux.

Pour cela, ils sont prêts à payer une fortune. Mais ce qu'ils ignorent c'est qu'avec Doctor K, il y a toujours un prix caché bien plus cher que l'argent…

 

 

Parce que c'est votre série !

Sans vous et votre soutien, ce projet ne verra pas le jour avec les moyens qu'il mérite.

Grâce à vos dons le prochain épisode durera 20 minutes.

Avec plus d'acteurs, de lieux et de moyens techniques.

Son succès dépends de vous. 

Etes vous prêt à relever le défi ?

 

 

 

 

 

Hakim

Karim Lasmi

Hakim est un avocat qui a beaucoup de succès ! 

Rien ne lui résiste, il gagne tous ses procès, même les causes les plus perdues. 

Son succès dans les tribunaux, son charisme naturel et le milieu dont il est issu (fils d'immigrés qui a grandi dans un quartier défavorisé) lui vaut une couverture médiatique digne des plus grandes stars du show business. 

Une couverture médiatique qu'il apprécie; d'ailleurs Hakim n'aime pas grand chose en dehors de lui-même...



Jacques

en cours de casting

La couverture médiatique d’Hakim, cette arrogance et cette invulnérabilité vont irriter Jacques, un policier qui voit en lui le sabotage récurrent du travail de la police. Impossible de mettre quelqu'un derrière les barreaux quand on a Hakim en avocat. 

Et Jacques n'a pas peur de se faire justice lui-même et de s'écarter de la loi quand il a quelqu'un dans son viseur...

 

Christelle 

Lara Sberveglieri

Christelle est une jeune policière, co-équipière de Jacques. 

C'est la policière exemplaire, elle espère en apprendre beaucoup sur le terrain grâce aux années d'expérience de son co-équipier même si elle n'est pas spécialement fan de ses méthodes. 

Christelle devra faire un choix : suivre son coéquipier et sortir du cadre de la loi pour défendre les intérêts de la police face à un avocat imbattable dans les tribunaux ou rester intègre et suivre la loi. Mais ceux qui font la loi sont-ils vraiment intègres ?



 

Docteur K

Interprété par Khadim Dione

Docteur K est toujours dans les parages quand on parle d'argent et de vice. 

Cette fois-ci, il a pour client Hakim, un avocat riche et intelligent qu'on ne berne pas facilement. A priori un bon client pour Docteur K, mais quels sont vraiment les critères pour être un bon client de Docteur K ?

Hakim en a les moyens financiers mais en a t-il les moyens moraux ?

 

Vous l’avez compris l’épisode pilote vous plongera dans une enquête policière menée par Jacques autour de Hakim l’avocat à succès. A travers l’enquête borderline de Jacques nous verrons à quel point Hakim est prêt à payer son succès auprès de Docteur K.

 

 

Nous sommes ambitieux :

Le but de ce pilote est de créer un vrai buzz sur internet autour de Docteur K. Comme pour le trailer, il y aura aussi une grosse communication autour du pilote. D’ailleurs comme le trailer, l’épisode pilote sera diffusé sur Youtube et Facebook.

Et nous visons le million de vues !

Cette audience et cet engagement de votre part (en finançant le pilote), va nous permettre d'attirer les grandes plateformes de streaming (Netflix, Amazon, OCS...etc) et trouver les financements qui nous permettront de vous proposer Docteur K sur plusieurs saisons !

Nous avons tout mis en place : l’écriture du scénario, les lieux, le budget, le casting. Imaginez le trailer que vous venez de voir avec un budget de 25k€ et 20 minutes de plus ! 

Il ne manque plus que vous pour concrétiser ce projet.

 

 

Comme évoqué dans l’interview du scénariste, le pilote est un épisode beaucoup plus long avec des figurants, plusieurs lieux, plus de personnages. Tout ceci demande beaucoup de personnels et de moyens techniques. 

Ces derniers sont nos deux plus gros pôles budgétaires.

 

 

Par exemple Docteur K et son client avocat seront dans plusieurs scènes à l’extérieur. Des personnages de cet envergure doivent s’habiller de manière élégante et conduire des véhicules à la hauteur de leur réputation.

 

Plus nous avons de budget, plus nous pourrons vous proposer un épisode pilote riche visuellement et de qualité, que ce soit au niveau du son, des images ou du encore du décor.

 

 

 

Nous avons réalisé ce trailer avec 0€ de budget pour vous donner le ton de la série mais aussi pour vous montrer notre créativité et ce que l’on est capable de faire.

 

 

Docteur K s’habille de manière soignée, il reçoit ses clients dans des grands bureaux et s’adresse à des personnes puissantes ayant l’esprit plutôt cartésien (police, politique, avocat, mannequin, acteur, narcotrafiquant...etc).

Dans la série Docteur K, le maraboutisme est une affaire sérieuse !

Le but de la série est de confronter deux mondes complètement différents : l’occident moderne et le mysticisme africain.

Dans la série, Docteur K n’est pas sollicité pour des raisons médicales mais pour des problèmes que la société moderne n’a pas encore su résoudre (vengeance, gloire, réussite, amour...etc)

Docteur K est aussi la rencontre entre le maraboutisme africain et le côté sombre d’autres milieux qui fascinent. La politique, le show business, le monde judiciaire sont des mondes qui fascinent. 

Avec cette série nous avons voulu montrer que derrière même les milieux les plus respectables, les côtés les plus sombres de l’être humain peuvent se cacher.

 

 

 

Le couple Underwood est vicieux et ambitieux, c'est ce trait de caractère qui m'a inspiré pour la série Docteur K. Franck et Claire Underwood vont toujours plus loin et n'ont aucune limite pour arriver à leurs fins.

C'est aussi le cas pour Docteur K et ses clients. Les clients de docteur K ne viennent pas le voir pour de bonnes intentions ! Ils sont tous animés de ce vice que l'on retrouve chez les Underwoods.

La série House of cards ne met pas seulement en avant le trait sombre de leur caractère, elle met aussi en avant l'intelligence du couple. C'est aussi ce que nous mettrons en avant dans les futurs épisodes :

L'intelligence de Docteur K. 

Docteur K n'est pas une caricature du vilain bête et méchant. C'est un personnage plus subtil qui défend ses propres intérêts grâce à ses pouvoirs mystiques mais surtout grâce à son intelligence et sa force de caractère.

 

 

Dans Black Mirror la technologie améliore notre quotidien et peut aussi le transformer en cauchemar quand on en abuse. Au delà de l'impact sur la vie des personnages, la série Black Mirror nous amène à nous poser des questions sur l'impact des technologies sur notre quotidien. 

Avec Docteur K, la magie noire remplace la technologie.

A chaque nouvelle histoire Docteur K utilise des pouvoirs mystiques pour ses clients.Il leur permet d'abord d'assouvir leur désir les plus fous. Mais ses sortilèges ne sont jamais sans conséquence sur ses clients. Il y a toujours un prix à payer.

La magie ici est un outil qui repousse les limites de notre vie quotidienne, tout comme la technologie de Black Mirror. La magie noire va vous amener à vous poser des questions sur votre quotidien et sur la société dans laquelle vous voudriez vivre.

Seriez-vous un client de Docteur K ? Si oui, quel sortilège utiliseriez-vous ? Et seriez-vous prêt à en payer le prix ?  

Docteur K doit-il exister dans notre société ? Et si finalement Docteur k était d'utilité publique? Une sorte d'ange noir qui punit les personnes les plus mal intentionnées.

 

 

Notre ambition est de créer une série internationale sur Docteur K.

Cette série, c'est la vôtre ! 

Cet univers, ce personnage, ces références culturelles ne verront jamais le jour sans vous.

Vous avez vu ce que nous avons pu réaliser avec 0€ de budget ? 

Imaginez ce que nous pouvons faire avec un budget de 25 000€.

Nous avons fait un 1er pas vers vous avec ce trailer, il ne nous manque plus que vous pour faire le deuxième !

Le financement va nous permettre de faire deux choses :

Réaliser un 1er épisode pilote. 

Mais aussi mesurer le potentiel succès de la série. 

Plus l'engouement est grand, plus la série a de chances d'attirer d'autres investisseurs qui nous aideront à être autonomes, rentables et vous proposer plusieurs saisons que vous retrouverez sur vos plateformes de streaming préférées (Netflix, Amazon, OCS...etc)

 

 

 

Dans la pop culture, il y a très peu de héros africains en dehors des personnages historiques, et des anti-héros encore moins.

Au delà de l’univers de la série, j’ai voulu faire du personnage de Docteur K une icône. Le premier antagoniste africain ! Joker a un style vestimentaire, une manière d’éliminer ses ennemis (gadgets, gaz hilarants...etc.). 

Bien que n’évoluant pas dans l’univers des super-héros, Docteur K a son style vestimentaire bien reconnaissable (chapeau, bagues aux doigts, costumes) et sa manière d’éliminer ses ennemis (sortilèges africains).

Joker est dans nos esprits, il est facilement reconnaissable. Notre but c’est que Docteur K devienne aussi facilement reconnaissable et marque les esprits.

Pour arriver à ce niveau de reconnaissance cela peut prendre des années et la 1ère étape commence ici avec cette campagne de crowdfunding.

En nous finançant vous faites entrer Docteur K dans la pop culture.

 

"Etant d’origine camerounaise, les histoires que vivent les personnages de Docteur K me sont familières car souvent racontées par mes parents, oncle ou tante ayant grandit en Afrique. Ces histoires m’ont toujours fait peur et fasciné. 

Mais pas seulement moi, elles fascinaient aussi mes amis occidentaux de souche quand je leur racontais. Car Il existe aussi des marabouts en Europe et en Amérique du nord mais personne n’en parle.

La peur et la fascination du maraboutisme est donc internationale.

Pourtant, j’ai rarement vu ce sujet abordé à la télé ou au cinéma en occident. Il n’y a d’ailleurs aucun personnage de référence dans la culture populaire.

Docteur K est une réponse à ce manque sur ce sujet.

Joël T."

 

 

Khadim DIONE - Acteur & Producteur

A 30 ans, Khadim est déjà Producteur & Directeur général de Cardinal Films, société de production de longs et courts-métrages pour le cinéma, qu’il a lui-même lancée dès la fin de ses études aux MBA ESG. En 2019, suite à plusieurs rencontres lors du festival de Cannes, il décide de partir à Hollywood et devient producteur consultant sur des longs-métrages. Il a notamment récemment travaillé aux côtés de Michel Hazanavicius lors du tournage du film The Search.

Par ailleurs, il a produit une dizaine de courts métrages avec sa propre société fondée en 2012. Le dernier court métrage, En morceaux, réalisé en 2018 par Guillaume Tordjman a été sélectionné dans 25 festivals dans le monde (en France, Italie, Tunisie, Inde, Etat-unis etc).

 

 

Joël TAGHEU - Scénariste & Expert en Webmarketing

Expert et Formateur en webmarketing aussi diplômé d'un MBA ESG E-Business. 
Créatif et curieux, Joël se lance à son compte dès l'obtention de son diplôme. Très vite il travaille pour de grand compte comme Sodexo où il fait valoir son expertise en Webmarketing.
Aujourd'hui avec Docteur K, il souhaite allier son expertise sur le web avec ses talents de scénariste.

 

 

 



 

 

 

1)   2€ -  Soutien Symbolique 

Vous soutenez la cause et les valeurs que défendent la série Docteur K

Toute l'équipe de Docteur K vous remercie pour votre contribution
 

 

2)   10€ - Crédit à la fin du générique

Votre nom et prénom sera crédité à la fin du générique du pilote

Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.

 

3)   20€ - Deux premières pages du scénario

Vous recevrez en exclusivité les deux premières pages du scénario pilote.

Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.

 

4)   40€ - Vous habillez Docteur K

Vous participerez à un des éléments les plus importants de de la série :

Le costume de Docteur K

Vous pourrez choisir entre différents accessoires proposés.

Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.

 

 

5)   60€ - Participation au tournage du prochain épisode de Docteur K

Vous voulez participer au prochain épisode de Docteur K ?

Avec cette récompense vous ferez partie du casting de l'épisode pilote ! Vous serez immergé dans l'univers de Docteur K en participant au tournage !

Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.

 

6)   80€ - L'épisode pilote avant les autres.
Vous voulez voir le 1er épisode avant les autres ? C'est possible !
Nous organiserons une diffusion de l'épisode en ligne en avant première, avec tous ceux qui ont financé à hauteur de 80€ ou plus.

Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.

 

7)   100€ - Dernière réplique de Docteur K
Vous déciderez de la dernière phrase que Docteur K dira à la fin de l'épisode.
Soyez créatifs ! On est impatient de vous lire !
Vous pourrez non seulement proposer une phrase mais aussi votez pour les 5 phrases sélectionnés dans toutes les propositions que nous aurons reçues.

Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.

 

8)   500€ - Sponsoring
Vous êtes une entreprise ou un influenceur ?
Avec cette récompense vous pourrez mettre en votre entreprise avec votre logo, votre marque (nom de votre site web, nom de votre  page Facebook, Instagram...etc.) mais aussi un message publicitaire.
Une vraie opportunité commerciale car le prochain épisode pilote sera diffusé sur YouTube avec une campagne autour de ce projet. Et nous visons le million de vues !

Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.

 


Vous avez des questions ? Contactez nous à docteur2020@gmail.com

 

Graphisme par Stéphane Cuxac

Dans la pop culture, il y a très peu de héros africains en dehors des personnages historiques, et des anti-héros encore moins.
Au delà de l’univers de la série, j’ai voulu faire du personnage de Docteur K une icône. Le premier antagoniste africain ! Joker a un style vestimentaire, une manière d’éliminer ses ennemis (gadgets, gaz hilarants...etc.). 
Bien que n’évoluant pas dans l’univers des super-héros, Docteur K a son style vestimentaire bien reconnaissable (chapeau, bagues aux doigts, costumes) et sa manière d’éliminer ses ennemis (sortilèges africains).
Joker est dans nos esprits, il est facilement reconnaissable. Notre but c’est que Docteur K devienne aussi facilement reconnaissable et marque les esprits.
Pour arriver à ce niveau de reconnaissance cela peut prendre des années et la 1ère étape commence ici avec cette campagne de crowdfunding.
En nous finançant vous faites entrer Docteur K dans la pop culture.

 
"Etant d’origine camerounaise, les histoires que vivent les personnages de Docteur K me sont familières car souvent racontées par mes parents, oncle ou tante ayant grandit en Afrique. Ces histoires m’ont toujours fait peur et fasciné. 
Mais pas seulement moi, elles fascinaient aussi mes amis occidentaux de souche quand je leur racontais. Car Il existe aussi des marabouts en Europe et en Amérique du nord mais personne n’en parle.
La peur et la fascination du maraboutisme est donc internationale.
Pourtant, j’ai rarement vu ce sujet abordé à la télé ou au cinéma en occident. Il n’y a d’ailleurs aucun personnage de référence dans la culture populaire.
Docteur K est une réponse à ce manque sur ce sujet.
Joël T."
 

 

Khadim DIONE - Acteur & Producteur
A 30 ans, Khadim est déjà Producteur & Directeur général de Cardinal Films, société de production de longs et courts-métrages pour le cinéma, qu’il a lui-même lancée dès la fin de ses études aux MBA ESG. En 2019, suite à plusieurs rencontres lors du festival de Cannes, il décide de partir à Hollywood et devient producteur consultant sur des longs-métrages. Il a notamment récemment travaillé aux côtés de Michel Hazanavicius lors du tournage du film The Search.
Par ailleurs, il a produit une dizaine de courts métrages avec sa propre société fondée en 2012. Le dernier court métrage, En morceaux, réalisé en 2018 par Guillaume Tordjman a été sélectionné dans 25 festivals dans le monde (en France, Italie, Tunisie, Inde, Etat-unis etc).
 
 

Joël TAGHEU - Scénariste & Expert en Webmarketing
Expert et Formateur en webmarketing aussi diplômé d'un MBA ESG E-Business. Créatif et curieux, Joël se lance à son compte dès l'obtention de son diplôme. Très vite il travaille pour de grand compte comme Sodexo où il fait valoir son expertise en Webmarketing.Aujourd'hui avec Docteur K, il souhaite allier son expertise sur le web avec ses talents de scénariste.
 
 
 

 

 
 

1)   2€ -  Soutien Symbolique 
Vous soutenez la cause et les valeurs que défendent la série Docteur K
Toute l'équipe de Docteur K vous remercie pour votre contribution 
 

2)   10€ - Crédit à la fin du générique
Votre nom et prénom sera crédité à la fin du générique du pilote
Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.
 

3)   20€ - Deux premières pages du scénario
Vous recevrez en exclusivité les deux premières pages du scénario pilote.
Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.
 

4)   40€ - Vous habillez Docteur K
Vous participerez à un des éléments les plus importants de de la série :
Le costume de Docteur K
Vous pourrez choisir entre différents accessoires proposés.
Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.
 
 

5)   60€ - Participation au tournage du prochain épisode de Docteur K
Vous voulez participer au prochain épisode de Docteur K ?
Avec cette récompense vous ferez partie du casting de l'épisode pilote ! Vous serez immergé dans l'univers de Docteur K en participant au tournage !
Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.
 

6)   80€ - L'épisode pilote avant les autres.Vous voulez voir le 1er épisode avant les autres ? C'est possible !Nous organiserons une diffusion de l'épisode en ligne en avant première, avec tous ceux qui ont financé à hauteur de 80€ ou plus.
Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.
 

7)   100€ - Dernière réplique de Docteur KVous déciderez de la dernière phrase que Docteur K dira à la fin de l'épisode.Soyez créatifs ! On est impatient de vous lire !Vous pourrez non seulement proposer une phrase mais aussi votez pour les 5 phrases sélectionnés dans toutes les propositions que nous aurons reçues.
Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.
 

8)   500€ - SponsoringVous êtes une entreprise ou un influenceur ?Avec cette récompense vous pourrez mettre en votre entreprise avec votre logo, votre marque (nom de votre site web, nom de votre  page Facebook, Instagram...etc.) mais aussi un message publicitaire.Une vraie opportunité commerciale car le prochain épisode pilote sera diffusé sur YouTube avec une campagne autour de ce projet. Et nous visons le million de vues !
Toutes les récompenses précédentes sont incluses.
 
Vous avez des questions ? Contactez nous à docteur2020@gmail.com
 
Graphisme par Stéphane Cuxac

story:
The Houston Space Society is forming a network we call “Interactive Space History”

Interactive Space History is the first of a set of anticipated networks being developed by Houston Space Society for educational and scientific purposes. Our goal is to create a series of shows, including the history of space shows. The goal here is to raise $140,000 in donations. In addition to a series of episodes on the history of space, the network would tell the history of different ventures (MirCorp, Space Commerce Corp, Space Services, Space Travel Services, Hudson McKinney Experimental, XCOR, many others).

Our first series of shows the “Interactive History of Space” would have a “part one” covering 1870 when Konstantin Tsiolkovsky was 13 through 1919. A second episode, part two, would cover 1920 to 1939. Episode three would cover 1940 to 1959. Episode four would run 1960 to 1968.

“The Interactive History of Space Part Five” is a single episode intended for future distribution to be produced by the Houston Space Society covering the period 1969 to 1989. We have set the campaign goal for this first show at $50,000.

So part six would be 1990 to 2009, and part seven would bring us up to the present.

story:
STORY

It was a normal Wednesday morning for Melanie Johnson, aspiring singer from Ladera Heights, Melissa Muhammad, slam poet from Inglewood, and Melody Carter, future music producer from Bel Air as they prepared with great anticipation for their first day at the world renowned Holly High Conservatory for the Arts.....normal that is, until they get convinced by their home room teacher Mrs. Wilde to leave school with her unexpectedly.

They get lured away to Edith Mae Academy for Girls, an underground narnia for black girl magic ....

Melissa, raised by her older sister Beck in absence of their incarcerated mother, signs on to participate in Edith until she is approached by her childhood bestie Joy to start shoplifting and trading for easy cash. Her new found boosting hustle not only puts her in jeopardy with her seat at Edith, but also gets her in some legal trouble when she gets caught.

Melody, raised by her two dads Lenny & Tim Carter on the other hand is stoked by the idea of being surrounded by such powerful black women. After all, she has been longing to find her birth mother and finally gets the courage to speak up for herself to her dad about the young woman she is becoming. She is focused and committed to doing her best at Edith, until she gets distracted by her Holly High crush Rich and gets shocked with some interesting findings about her birth mother.

Melanie wants no parts in any of the “kumbuya bullsh*t”. Her only goal is to become famous at Holly High and frankly Edith is not homegirl's speed. She is distant and combative for most of the season, although she can truly sing her face off. We find out that Melanie secretly struggles with a learning disability. Once she lets her guards down, she gets the support of a lifetime.

MEET OUR TEAM

Unlimited Possibilities Studios
 


 

Kharmony Fortune
Creator/Writer/Executive Producer/Producer/Director 

Kharmony Fortune, originally from The Bronx, NYC is the CEO and Founder of multi Grammy & NAACP award winning talent management and production agency: Unlimited Possibilities Music & Talent (UPMT). Kharmony leads a team of innovators that believe in sowing knowledge, training and guidance to artists aspiring to successfully bring their visions to life.
 


Eboni Gentry 
Co-Executive Producer

Eboni Gentry, owner of Gentry Touring, is an accomplished live show producer and creative director, credited with producing notable performances and tours for artists such as Doja Cat, Snoop Dog and Normani. Eboni also functions as Tour Manager and Production Manager for Gentry Touring's current roster of artists including Doja Cat, Gallant, VanJess and Arin Ray.
 


 

Jivanta Roberts
Co - Producer

With a degree in Merchandising and Marketing from Johnson & Wales University, Jivanta Roberts is a full-time Actress, Creative Director, Producer, TV Personality, and Entrepreneur. Roberts can be seen producing and co-hosting "The Donnell Rawlings Show" available on Youtube, Apple Music and Spotify.
 


 

Janay Coplon
Co - Producer

Emmy nominated tv produce, creative executive, writer, director, dedicated to elevating diverse stories and voices.  She wakes up everyday motivated and inspired by this quote from Maya Angelou, “Nothing will work unless you do”.

 



Tae Daaz 
Associate Producer 

A finalist in the Urbanworld Teleplay Competition, semifinalist in The Script Lab” Screenplay Competition. Executive Producer for a streaming series on Revry TV and Pluto TV and current Executive Producer on a feature currently in production.
 



Jasmine Ellis
Writer

A New York based actress and screenwriter, Jasmine D.Ellis highlights black people’s joy, purpose and ability to reinvent themselves. She is an Upright Citizens Brigade Scholarship Recipient.
 


 

Sheila Nortley
Writer

Sheila is an award-winning filmmaker based in London, UK who has written, produced and directed several internationally renowned projects, recently securing an unprecedented development deal with the national broadcaster SKY and currently producing the forthcoming NETFLIX TV series ‘Stay Close’ with RED and NETFLIX.
 



Jessica Obilom
Writer

Jessica Obilom is a magnetic 1st generation Nigerian-American actor whose star is rapidly rising. A well-rounded artist, she writes, directs, and produces, aiming to put out work that not only makes a difference in people, but in the world as a whole.
 



Tay Ridge 
Writer/Director

Octavia Ethridge is a screenwriter and director and Marine Corps veteran who continues to be the voice for women, LGBTQIA community, and people of color by spreading awareness through her films such as her latest film, “Stand Up For Something”.
 



Angele Cooper
Writer/Director

Angele’s experiences have driven her to write stories that give a voice to the voiceless, represent the misrepresented, and bring visibility to the invisible. She has spoken on various panels including SXSW "Bridging Diversity in Film & Television and in 2020, she was a finalist in The American Film Institute Directing Women Workshop and Sundance Episodic Labs.

- Grand Rising -
 

NOTE FROM CREATOR

I chose to create The Mels because I wanted to show the world a world that only lived inside of my head; a place where every young black girl was taught who she was and WHOSE she was, that she is a product of royalty, heiresses to the throne, and that knowing her true power, her true magic she would have all the abundance her heart could muster up, because it is her destiny... 

I wanted the viewers to fantasize with me something that could be and should be in the world. I wanted them to see the vision and not only different lives of the ever- evolving black woman but also how our magic could sometimes disturb others so much that they hate to love it but still try to duplicate it.

I was inspired to create this sci fi dramedy by the work of dual reality, multi realm tv shows and films such as Heroes, Lovecraft Country, Get Out and Antebellum.

We auditioned so many people with great takes on the script and I am so excited to see the actors we selected bring these characters alive. They each had something unique about them and  performed so well, it either grossed us out, pissed us off and moved us to tears. 

Working with the writers and producers was an awesome experience and a great teacher as well. I loved working with other intelligent, supportive, forward thinking, boss ass black queens!  

This show will always be special to me because it is my series baby! My first born! And I promised those girls I would make them a show and I did. I worked on it and worked on it some more and after 2 years, it is ready!

Let's make it happen! Love y'all!

story:
Phoenix Inc: Season 3

With your help we have been able to produce 2 short seasons of a fantastic TV show, and now we are ready to go big! If you haven't had a chance to check out the early episodes of our show you find Phoenix Inc on Amazon Prime and YouTube.

Everything in this series so far has been done on a shoestring budget with mostly volunteers to make it all happen. With your help I am seeking the funds to pay everyone who is part of the show, and make sure that our locations, effects, sound and visuals are all top notch. 

I believe that we can make a show that can go toe to toe with many other shows out there in terms of quality of the idea, acting, scripting and even visuals and sounds, but that can't be accomplished without the phenomenal people who help us - you! 

Independent television is much more difficult than independent movies. It requires more work over time, but the payoff is a far more compelling story that can explore a world much more fully. Season 3 will take this series to new place!

What We Need & What You Get

Most TV shows, even on the low end can cost between $500,000 and $1,000,000 per episode. Our goal with this campaign is to raise $50,000 to create up to three 45 minute episodes of the show. We have implemented a wide variety of strategies to keep costs low, while maintaining a high level of professionalism. 

The money will be spent to pay all actors, rent and purchase necessary equipment and props and pay for some marketing. 

For contributing to this campaign there are numerous perks you can receive based on your level of contribution, but you will also be part of revolutionizing the way that TV is made.

One of the most important aspects of this show is actually the inspiration it is designed to give. It is a show which deals with dark and difficult subject matter, but it does so in a way which is intended to give hope to those who may feel suicidal, and to uplift all viewers. 

Risks & Challenges

We have a proven track record of delivering a stellar, award winning finished product, however every project has challenges. If we can raise the full $50,000 or more we will make as many episodes as we can, however if we fail to raise the full amount, we will have to scale back in many ways including shooting fewer episodes. 

Other Ways You Can Help

There is a fantastic video coming soon that will discuss this, but in the meantime there are some great things you can do even if you can't contribute today. Like the Phoenix Inc Facebook page, and watch for updates. Invite your friends and family to like the page and help them find this great show. Also please go and watch the episodes, even a few times to help them get recommended more often by the algorithms. Lastly, and most importantly, leave reviews, comments, and recommendations anywhere you can! Reviews on Amazon are very important to help Amazon recommend a show, also YouTube comments and Facebook recommendations are very helpful. 

On behalf of the entire dedicated Phoenix Team I want to thank you for considering this project and contributing in any way you can. You can get more information on the series by visiting our Facebook page or our website www.phoenixincseries.com

story:
What is PLUGs?

PLUGS is comedy crime drama web series created by Brandon James. The first season of PLUGS introduces our two main protagonists, Jeremy and Tyrone, and gives insight on how two best friends enter into the shroom selling business. Along the way, Jeremy and Tyrone meet a variety of odd and unique characters while discovering the dangers of being criminals.

 

Who are the Characters?

Jeremy has always lived an average life. Two-parent household, raised in the church, excelled in school... long story short, he's a clean guy. Jeremy attended one of the best business schools in the U.S., graduating college and not know what to do in life, Jeremy plans on exceeding in life... even if he's $75,000 in debt. 

Tyrone on the other hand, always had it easy in life. Living in Los Angeles his entire childhood, entering adulthood was going to be a breeze in Tyrone's head until his parent cut him off. They think it's time for him to fend on his own. Can you blame them? On top of that, Tyrone's "girlfriend", Maya cheated on him so yeah... the man's dealing with some stuff. 

 

Our Vision

Our vision is to create the first season which consists of 4 episodes ranging from 15-20 minutes each. Each episode that we create will cost around $6,000 dollars. With the $6,000 per episode, we'll be paying for talent, crew, equipment, locations, permits, food, and miscellaneous purchases. 

Even if we don't receive the full amount, with however much we receive, we'll at least be making the first episode. That being said, if you want the complete story, donating and spreading the word to your friends and relatives is the only way that we could finish the first season of PLUGS. 

 

The Impact

PLUGS is important to us due to this series being the first portrayal of our abilities of filmmaking. Writer and director Brandon James is currently studying Screenwriting at California State University, Northridge and plans on making this series his gateway into the film/tv industry. 

Ciera McGrew is a recent graduate of California State University, Northridge. She is currently pursuing a career in filmmaking, with her goal in becoming a creative producer. She is more than determined to produce unique stories and creative content, especially those that highlight the voices of POC. This project is only the beginning of her vision. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow the journey of the filmmakers. As Brandon and Ciera are making their footprints into the filmmaking world, they would love the support and feedback after you have viewed the project. Follow them at @thelifeofbrandonjames and @ciera31mcgrew on Instagram for more updates.

story:
OVERVIEW

The award-winning digital series, "Herrings" continues its riveting story about a skip maker, someone who helps people disappear in plain sight by disguising their digital footprint and how his actions reverberate with our ensemble of characters as they intersect and overlap within the mosaic of Philadelphia.

 

WHAT WE NEED

We hope that after you watch the trailer you'll see that the work we've done so far- even given the limitations of low budget, guerilla filmmaking- is of high quality.  We'll be operating under a SAG new media agreement this season, so we have access to some recognizable actors from stage and screen. We'd like to do a full 6 to 8 episode season and could really use your help to get there.  Our hope is to sell the series to an online platform like Netflix or Amazon Prime but if what we end up with is a really cool series that people like you enjoy, share and get excited for the next episode then we know we've done our job. 

 

THE CAST

WRITER/SERIES CREATOR:

KEITH CHAMBERLAIN

Keith Chamberlain is an award-winning filmmaker currently living in southern New Jersey. Keith strives to tell meaningful stories that capture the truth of the human condition as well as challenges society’s views and beliefs. He has written and directed several short films that have played in various film festivals. Keith’s award winning films have been screened at festivals around the world, including Golden Door International Film Festival, Pittsburgh Uncut Film Festival, Seoul Web Fest, NJ Web Fest and Hang Onto Your Short Film Festival among other venues.

 

WHERE WILL YOUR MONEY GO?

While it's true filmmaking (or technically, digital filmmaking) has gotten much less expensive in the last few years but still there are costs that can't be avoided and each episode costs a minimum of $2000 to make but the more we can raise, the better! 

A lot of times our cast and crew are working on a show below their normal rate, because it serves as a passion project for the whole team. Our crew is made up of incredibly passionate and hard working people who have been working for pizza (or occasionally Chinese).  Your money will go towards paying the cast and crew what they deserve to be paid, and ultimately providing the financial means to help each and every one of us give it our all to make "Herrings" the visually and narratively compelling series we know it can be.  And now, I present the obligatory pie chart that let's you know EXACTLY where your money will be going:

 

 

Other funds will also be put towards providing quality food for set, props and set decorations, and a small contingency budget for miscellaneous needs.

 

WHAT DO I GET IN RETURN?

We’re grateful for every single penny that comes our way. No amount is too small or too big! And we have some wonderful perks and incentives to show our gratitude. Things like:

  • Signed copies of the "Herrings" issue of Artistic Magazine!
  • Signed screenplays from the cast & crew
  • Swag! T-shirts, stickers and posters!
  • A special "thank you" in the credits and on social media
  • A Producer credit (and yes, it will be on IMDB)
  • Earn an Executive Producer credit  (yes, this will also be on IMDB)
  • Secure a spot on screen as an extra
  • Exclusive pictures and video from the show
  • Have your picture included in a scene
     

SO, IN CLOSING

Thank you very much for checking out our campaign page and for your support in reaching our fundraising goal here on Indiegogo. Please remember EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS!  And even if you can't lend financial support, you can still help by sharing this campaign with your family, friends, followers on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.   

If you haven’t watched Seasons One & Two of "Herrings", we invite you to take a look now!  Visit www.herringsseries.com  for trailers and episodes. We can't wait to show you "Herrings" in all of its glory and we're excited to have you along for this amazing journey! Thanks in advance!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone, and thank you for checking out this Indiegogo campaign. 

My name is Ian Allan James and the tale of "Spad's Hollow" has been in my head for over 10 years. When I was 14 years old my friends and I started making short horror films that all took place in the same continuity. Our films were filled with crazy and campy villains that were inspired by  '70s and '80's slasher films. All these characters lived in the fictional town of Spad's Hollow, WV. My friend Jordan Krueger and I have already started a comic series based on these characters but now my Producers and I think it is time for us to explore this twisted saga even more via web series. 

This is a project that means a lot to not only me but all of my friends who have helped flesh out these characters and have grown to care about them just as much as me.

We are a small group of friends  that always dreamed of making horror films togther and this is our chance. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The money we raise on indiegogo will be used to help pay our cast and crew aswell as rent equipment for our shoot. 
  • We worked hard to assemble a rock-solid cast of actors that will help bring to life these characters that we took so much time devoloping. We need your help to make sure these talented men and women are appropriately compensated for thier hard work on set.     

   The Cast

 

 

The Crew

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share our indiegogo campaign on social media.
  • Purchase our comics on Amazon or our T-Shirts on our Teespring store.                            Comic: https://www.amazon.com/Spads-Hollow-Cataclysmic...           Teespring:  https://teespring.com/stores/spads-hollow
  • Donate monthly to our patreon: https://www.patreon.com/SpadsHollow

story:
Premise: 

My Gay Bro is an episodic series which will entail the lives of both Kyle and Wesley. Kyle is your typical straight frat boy who thinks rolling blunts should be considered a sport. Wesley is your gay, frat boy influenced, type of guy who loves cannabis infused candles, or just candles in general. These two hold exciting lives of two roommates who are clearly different, but reciprocate the energy of frat brothers who get into unforeseen dilemmas. Mainly due to their poor, but fun choices; these two make memories worth remembering if they can remember the memories they’re supposed to remember…

Director’s Statement: 

A story like this is one not just worth creating, but worth the watch. With the LGBTQ community finally getting their name into the media, and the Full Send party community taking off this is a story of two communities living parallel to each other in harmony. It will be a fun, yet heartfelt journey, these characters will cast themselves in, and the audience has the utter luxury of going for the ride. We are the best ones to tell this story due to the environment the team is surrounded in, closely relating to the one Kyle and Wesley find themselves in. With this familiarity to the circumstances, the team will be relating to the characters, and circumstances just as much as the audience will be which creates not only a healthy product but a well done product. 

Bottom Line:

With a goal of $5000, this series will be shot at a speedy pace along with a creative eye to specifics. A majority of the budget will not just be going to production dates, but to marketing. Due to this being a story worth telling, we want to share it with as many people as possible. Instagram marketing will be used to promote this series, and create a following to hopefully produce another great set of episodes in a second season later in the future. The realm of Instagram is a pool of consumers, and this is a product which will grab due to its specific niches and the large following behind those. Donate now to receive a series this world has been dying to see!

story:
Hey everybody! If you’ve made it this far, you’ve probably caught on we are raising money for a new project. We're super excited to announce we're developing a TV SHOW. It's a wildly ambitious endeavor and we need help from friends, family, and supporters of the arts to make it happen. 

The Series

The series is a comedy called CherryBomb and is all about two young, female entrepreneurs finding their purpose and career in New York City. It's a 6-episode season with each episode lasting around 25 minutes. The series is largely based on our previous film,The Dine-and-Dash Dater, which served as the prototype to the tone, style, and comedy. Once finished, we plan to air it on a streaming platform in 2021!

The Impact

We think the story is important for a myriad of reasons, but some of the most vital reasons are female empowerment and representation of immigrants in the United States. Not only is our story about strong women, but is also largely being brought to life by them. Half our creative team are women, which as we all know is exceptionally rare for a television series. 

Our cast and crew represents 4 continents and 7 countries, which we are really proud of! Typically, international actors are asked to suppress accents & 'play America', but we've decided to embrace the internationality of our cast and creative team. In doing so, we hope to give a voice to communities that otherwise would remain unrepresented in American Pop-Culture. 

What We Need

It's no secret that filmmaking is a really expensive process. The greatest expenses are film and audio equipment, craft services, and props/costumes. 

"Craft Services" is code in the movie world for food and drinks. It's a huge portion of our budget, but it can't be overstated how important it is. Because we can't pay our cast and crew, we at least have to feed them. Craft Services is one of the most critical elements to boosting on-set morale and building a creative atmosphere. Everyone works better after a toasted Everything bagel with cream cheese. It's simple science.

The Creative Team

 

Mafalda Pinto Correia | Co-Creator, Producer,  Writer, Actor (Sofia)

Mafalda is a Portuguese actress based in New York. Her journey started in Portugal where she had her debut in the National Theater with “Far Away Hunger”. She acted in several theater companies and toured in Portugal, Spain, Italy, and France. Recent theater credits include "Down We Go", "Beyond Dreams" (which she also wrote and directed), and the Off-Broadway production of "The Big Knife". Film credits include "Going Beyond", "Todo Esta Bien", and "Dine-and-Dash Dater". For the later she received a Best Lead Actress nomination by the Strasberg Film Festival. She is also a proud graduate of The Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute. Besides excelling in acting - and self-promoting – she also does a pretty good job being human. She prides herself of being an outstanding pastry taster and Rockstar-level baker. www.themafalda.com

Quinn Cavin | Co-Creator, Director, Producer, Writer

Quinn is a director, writer, and producer known for The Dine-and-Dash Dater (2020), for which he received the Strasberg Film Festival’s award for Best in Fest, he was also nominated for Best Director and his script was nominated for Best Screenplay, moreover the film was a finalist at the New York International Film Awards. His film Rain Dance (2019), was awarded a Distinction from Wabash College and won the Phi Beta Kappa prize. As a producer he is also known for Blocked, Blank, Glass (2020), Going Beyond (2020), Nerds (2018), and more. www.quinncavin.com

Ryan Cairns | Director, Writer

Ryan is a filmmaker known for Green Book (2018), Miracle Workers (2019),The Last O. G. (2018), Crush (2019), and more. As a director, he's known forThe Dine-and-Dash Dater (2020), for which he received the Strasberg Film Festival’s award for Best in Fest and Best Director; NERDS (2018) and La Sac (2016). He's also the founder and President of Fish in a Top Hat Film Collective.

Sarah Barnett | Writer, Actor (Iz)

Sarah is an actor, writer, and comedian whose affiliations are with NYU-Tisch, where she recently graduated from with majors in both Drama and Dramatic Writing.  Her studio training includes The Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute, as well as Stonestreet Studios. Sarah has starred in many original plays, both drama and comedy, including “Goosey”, “Wine and Pizza”, as well as her her own full-length comedy,  “Judith’s Exit.”  When she isn’t acting or writing, Sarah enjoys performing stand-up, improv and calling her grandma as much as possible.  

Ana Moioli | Producer 

Ana is a Brazilian actress, writer, and director based in New York. Her acting trajectory started in her home country at 9 years old and was later expanded to Russia, where she studied and performed at the Moscow Art Theatre School, and then the United States, where she graduated from NYU Tisch Drama. Some of her recent theater projects include Running in Place (directed by Isabella Uzcátegui at Dixon Place), Birds of a Feather (directed by Lauren Grajewski at the Take Ten Play Festival and The Secret Theater), and Veinticinco (directed by Attilio Rigotti at The Tank). She's also starred in several independent films, such as the multi-award-winning Elsewhere (directed by Guilherme Pedra), as well as How to Water Roses (directed by Mirella Cardoso) and Julieta (directed by Vicente Gonzalez). Her first play For The Time Being was recently produced at the NYWinterfest Festival, and she also debuted as a filmmaker with the film Bridge. www.anamoioli.com

Kaylee Rodriguez | Sound, Composer 

Kaylee Shahira Rodriguez is a composer, producer, and audio engineer based in Queens, NY. She is invested in building projects that bring people a sense of humanity, so she is especially excited to help deliver such a silly yet completely irresistible human story to the world. You can find her music at kayleeshahira.com

Larissa Castilho | Costume Design 

Christopher Michael Ward | Actor (Gordon)

Chris is an actor known for The Edge of Town, Passos de Valor, J-1, The Player, Conquered Soul, and Dream Girl. He completed his conservatory training at the Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute. www.christophermichaelward.com

Jason Lee | Actor (Ernest)

Jason is a New York based actor/singer who has performed in English, Mandarin, Taiwanese and French since the beginning of his career. He is the series regular in Eighty-12 which launched on Amazon Prime in April, 2020. He's also been performing on stage, including a straight play which won the Excellence Award of Taipei Fringe Festival, and an original musical at the American Theatre of Actors. Jason is an alumnus of the Lee Strasberg Theatre and Film Institute. www.jasonchlee.com

Sergey Petrov | Actor (Michal)

Darya Savishkina | Actor (Nastia)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, it doesn't mean you can't help and support us. Getting the word out about the film and this fundraiser is hugely valuable to us. Please like and share to help us continue to reach more people!

story:
⚡️ Season 3 streaming now on YouTube! ⚡️

Watch the first episode of the third season here and stay tuned for more episodes, dropping every Sunday, on the official Teenagers YouTube channel.

THANK YOU to all of our backers for making this possible! We appreciate the support so much and could not have made this project without your help. Stay tuned for more! ✨

www.teenagerswebseries.com

story:
TRAINING WHEELS – SEASON 2

"GOOD AT DREAMING, BAD AT REALITY"

There are many obstacles in creating your own art, while managing adult life…

It's the eternal struggle of the up & coming filmmaker AND the plot of TRAINING WHEELS, a Portland-based online sitcom about two comedians shooting for the stars, while facing adulting adversity in life, love, and the pursuit of laughter.  

Hi, I’m Aaron Ross and ever since I was a kid watching the likes of Seinfeld or Conan, I wanted to star in my own sitcom AND late-night talk show (call me a dreamer!). Training Wheels combines BOTH of those things, and I am really proud of what we were able to do with first season on a shoestring budget!

This March, we plan to film Season Two of Training Wheels. While the show is about sidestepping adult life to achieve your dreams, we’re asking you to STEP UP and be our training wheels by donating to our campaign.

BE OUR TRAINING WHEELS!!!

Your donation will assist us in creating the entire second season of Training Wheels, giving us access to state-of-the-art video equipment, professional sound quality, paid actors, directors, and all the behind the scenes production touches that divide good production from the great.

We proved that we could make full-length sitcom episodes on our own in 2016. It was a romantic time where we created this series piece by piece, with elbow grease, blood, sweat, and tears (from laughing so hard!). This go round, we look to raise a modest budget of $11,000 that will allow us to shoot six new episodes on schedule AND deliver Season Two fresh, hot, and ready to Training Wheels and chill.

CHEERS TO YOU!

Without you, we can’t keep our Training Wheels rolling. Whether you can contribute financially or not, we’re counting on you to help raise awareness by sharing this campaign. We’re also presenting a live fundraiser as we tape our weekly late-night talk show "WHO'S the ROSS?" Feb 21, 9pm at Dante's. Join us for a night of live comedy & music, as we screen the first season of Training Wheels and present a series of kick-ass auctions from our generous sponsors to keep our wheels turning.

CHEERS! And now enjoy a quick ride down memory lane as we present a recap of Training Wheels season one...
story_txt: TRAINING WHEELS – SEASON 2"GOOD AT DREAMING, BAD AT REALITY"There are many obstacles in creating your own art, while managing adult life…It's the eternal struggle of the up & coming filmmaker AND the plot of TRAINING WHEELS, a Portland-based online sitcom about two comedians shooting for the stars, while facing adulting adversity in life, love, and the pursuit of laughter.  Hi, I’m Aaron Ross and ever since I was a kid watching the likes of Seinfeld or Conan, I wanted to star in my own sitcom AND late-night talk show (call me a dreamer!). Training Wheels combines BOTH of those things, and I am really proud of what we were able to do with first season on a shoestring budget!This March, we plan to film Season Two of Training Wheels. While the show is about sidestepping adult life to achieve your dreams, we’re asking you to STEP UP and be our training wheels by donating to our campaign.BE OUR TRAINING WHEELS!!!Your donation will assist us in creating the entire second season of Training Wheels, giving us access to state-of-the-art video equipment, professional sound quality, paid actors, directors, and all the behind the scenes production touches that divide good production from the great.We proved that we could make full-length sitcom episodes on our own in 2016. story:
King Girlz 

is a coming-of-age series centered around a young girl that has just begun her freshman year at one of the most illustrious high schools in her hometown. We tackle issues from academic pressures, finding ones self, and expanding friendships. 

King Girlz is created, written by and starring people of color from Milwaukee, Wisconsin. Its focus is showing a lesser seen narrative of young black women who come from middle class families. It also shows people who live in the inner city of Milwaukee, Wisconsin but do not experience the negative connotations associated with it.  From our crew to our desired audience, we aim to be diverse and inclusive.

About The Project 

King Girlz follows Tiffany,a young girl starting her freshman year at a high school that she has dreamt of going to for as long as she can remember. But her first couple of days were not like how she always imagined ... let's just say they were ROUGH. She was underdressed and way out of her league. She quickly realizes that THIS high-school is not all about the books but the looks. 

                                                

Season One 

Tiffany and Renee are best friends since 6th grade, and embark on the adventure of high school together. 

To Be or Not to Be A King Girl? 

Tiffany’s first couple of days are rough. She realizes that high-school is not all about the books but the looks when she is assigned a locker by the most popular girl in school,KENDRA.

Renee , however, has easily adapted to the culture and attempts to guide Tiffany into the “King Way” of doing things. Renee instructs Tiffany to work with what she has, and after much consideration Tiffany decides to give into Renee’s antics and follow her lead.

She constructs a “grownish” outfit and decides to amp it up by wearing her one and only pair of heels to school.However, Tiffany makes a complete fool of herself and has jeopardized her educational values attempting to fit in.

                                       

Incredibly embarrassed Tiffany realizes that she has put too much time into trying to fit into the “King Way” and contemplates what route she should take next.  Will she try again or give up her dream of being a King Girl?

Tone 

The King Girlz Web Series illustrates a period in time where young people are vulnerable to their environment. We plan to accomplish this through comedic yet blunt situations similar to the film The Wood to show how navigating through life as a young person regardless of your neighborhood, and economic class can be uncomfortable for any person.

                                   

Funds

In order to create the King Girlz Web Series we are asking for your contributions to raise 10 thousand dollars. Every penny is apprecatied and will be used to its fullest capacity. 

Your contibutions will go towards hiring a professional Milwaukee crew to make sure that we produce the best quality visuals. The crew will consist of a director of photography (camera), audio technician (sound) and gaffer ( lighting). Your donations will also go towards purchasing any items needed for equipment such as external hard drives, SD Cards, batteries, and stablizers. 

We are also raising money in order to fund location expenses and production insurance. This is to insure that we are protected if anything shall happen to our crew, cast, or the location while we are on location premises.  

Lastly, we are looking to create the tone and culture of Milwaukee in 2008 . Your contributions will assist in purchasing wardrobe that was popular in that era. We are also looking to purchase small portions of songs from Milwaukee artist from 2008 and now to insure that we include the Milwaukee community and artist as much as possible to illustrate the vibrant culture that Milwaukee has. 

If we do not reach our goal of 10 thousand dollars we will not be able to produce the King Girlz Web Series to it’s fullest capacity.

story:
WUT THE HECK IS DEAD FRIENDS:

 

Mel moves in with the eccentric Keely whose obsession with a dead boy causes her to question her new living situation...until that same dead boy appears to enlist her help in breaking Keely's obsession in the hope he can move on.

 

“Dead Friends” is a supernatural comedy that deals with self-acceptance, the interplay between the living world and the afterlife, and above all, friendship. Think the buddy comedy vibe of New Girl, mixed with the concepts of The Good Place, mixed with the familiar lovability of Broad City (watch out Abbi and Illana) ((jk love you)) 

 

The webseries began as a passion project for us to create our own content, but collaborative efforts from over 30 other talented artists allowed the project to grow in both professionalism and support. 

 

Dead Friends was created by Nicole Murray and Paige Henderson (Svelte Dog Productions), is produced by Phong Dang, and stars Paige Henderson, Nicole Murray, Jacob Osborne and Chase Michael Torrence.

 

And guess what? The first two episodes, which completed production last October, have already been official selection for various film festivals, where they have been nominated for Best Pilot, Best Dramedy, Best Supporting Actor, Best Supporting Actress and have already won Best Webisode. Pretty dope.

 

BUT WAIT, YOU ALREADY COMPLETED FILMING?

 

YES! With the completion and success of episodes 1 and 2 (see nominations above) we were able to film the rest of Season One in May, thanks to the support of our cast, crew, artistic collaborations and local businesses. 

 

BUT, as anyone who has worked in film knows, it is not enough just to shoot the thing. Now comes post-production, which means editing, color correcting, and sound design. We need help in order to achieve the funds necessary to hire talented individuals for these areas, and ensure the post-production process produces the best film quality possible!

 

SO WHAT THE HECK DO YOU NEED:

 

We are looking to raise $5,000 for post-production on episodes 3-8 of Dead Friends so that we may complete the season and release it out on Youtube!

These funds would go toward sound design, color correction, and marketing of the series for it to be seen and (hopefully) loved. 

Dead Friends relies heavily on sound design to convey the characteristics of the spirit world, (see an example of this in our Campaign Video!) Additionally, color correction is necessary for the supernatural occurrences and characters. And of course, having money for marketing is super important for us to be able to share our series with as many people as possible!

Our plan is to release the full season in October, just in time for Halloween (get ready to bingeeeee).

 

OKAY COOL, BUT WHY SHOULD I CARE?

 

First off, who doesn’t like to laugh. Weirdos.

But, seriously, more than just characterized by a light-hearted comedy atmosphere, Dead Friends deals with relevant themes of the afterlife, self-acceptance, and the boundaries of friendship.

Dead Friends addresses these in often humorous scenarios while getting real in moments everyone can relate to. Our characters are awkward, witty, lovable, and maybe even a little manic. They seek love and acceptance, doubt themselves, and get carried away in the moment, just as everyone does. We love our characters to death (lol), and we hope you’ll have as much fun watching them as we did writing them and seeing them brought to life (lol) by our talented cast.

Our hope? That this first season of Dead Friends will just be the beginning. Successful web series such as “Strangers” have achieved this goal; being found and loved, and eventually getting their series picked up by Facebook Watch. We have a lot more of this story to tell, and we want to continue making people laugh for 10 more seasons. Jk. But maybe like 9.

 

SOUNDS DOPE, BUT….

 

We know. There is the possibility that we may not get enough funding for us to complete Dead Friends to the best quality it can be. If we aren’t able to raise enough money, we would need to wait until we gained funding in order to get the series out onto our Youtube platform. However, we believe strongly in this series and the messages it carries with it, so will work as long as it takes to gain the funds to release.

 

I CAN’T DONATE, BUT I WANNA HELP:

 

If you’re not able to support financially, no worries! It’s still really helpful for us if you share our campaign and even the series, when it’s released.

Indiegogo has some great sharing tools, so feel free to check those out. Even one send to a friend or family member means more people hearing our story.

And please follow us on instagram @deadfriends_webseries and subscribe to our youtube channel (where full episodes will be released in October!) https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC03lX3s0NNcGQP...

story:
Short Summary

Ikiyago WebTV is for us a Television of proximity with a vision of sharing, educating and learn through the truth.  We believe, sharing our ideas, experiences, stories and learning from others through audiovisual means seems to be a key to understanding the challenges of development and the future construction of the country. It`s also a place of entertainment. Our shows are streamed live (or pre-recorded) on our YouTube Channel Ikiyago WebTV and later published on our new website www.ikiyagowebtv.org.

Ikiyago WebTV is for us an instrument of exchange and encounter that creates links between Burundians and friends of Burundi wherever they are in the world. Our great desire is to make this meeting place an instrument that allows communication and information to take a place in the processes of the development of our country.

Burundi is a small country in Eastern Africa that has been going through cyclical crisis since its independence in 1962. Because of those crisis, Burundi has several issues ranging from politics to economy to security to justice to hanger and poverty.

This meeting place was created to get all Burundians and friends of Burundi together through true dialogue to share ideas and solutions to actual problems and the development of Burundi communities.

What We Need 

We're looking to raise $ 7,736.99 to help create an agency in Burundi. We have a small but complete studio set up in Seattle that started live programs on our YouTube channel last year in April, and need to increase our video contents by creating another small studio in Burundi, the very first place we can find most important sources for our programs.

All the Ikiyago WebTV crew work on the volunteer basis (for free) and that`s why we are developing so quickly. We would very much like to able to create another small studio in Burundi. For that we need your help to buy 2 cameras JVC GY-HM170UA ($2,675.00), 1 Dell Precision Tower 3420 ($1,596.99), 1 laptop Dell Latitude 13 3000 ($1,570.00) and 1 Video mixer Roland VR-3EX SD/HD A/V with USB streaming ($1,895.00). We already have other equipment such as audio mixer, microphones, lights, cables, rented office and volunteer crew members.

The Impact

This project is valuable to you as a contributor and to the world as you will help us share ideas, experiences, stories and skills that would contribute to community development in Burundi. You will also notice the difference your contribution is making in Burundian communities and also follow our coverage on issue affecting Burundi communities.

Risks & Challenges

Ikiyago WebTV, a place of meeting, is registered as a non-profit organization under Washington State law and has signed-up membership with Seattle Community Media to have its video contents aired on Comcast channel 77 and wave broadband channel.

We are in the process of registering our representative agency in Burundi. Our legal status in the US is a strong element to influence the Burundian government to grant us a license to have an agency in Burundi.

We know people value our transparency and may wonder what would be our plan in case the Burundi government refuse to grant us the license to open an agency there. We have Studio that is operational in Seattle that will continue to operate as usual and we we look for other opportunities of creating other representative agencies in countries with higher number of Burundian immigrants such as South Africa, Canada and Sweden (where we have volunteer members).

Other Ways You Can Help

It`s true that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. If you like what we're doing please give us a share on Indiegogo, Facebook, Twitter etc., or if you are in possession of any used studio equipment please contact us and we will appreciate from the bottom of our heart.

story:
The Underwood brothers have inherited the character DNA of their male ancestors—a line of old-fashioned southern gentlemen who took great pride in protecting their families. 

Kenton Underwood is “the protective one.”  Protective of his family, Kenton wants to expand the family winery by adding white wines to its label, but his rival, Peter Keller of Eagles Nest Winery plots to ruin Kenton's expansion plans. When it comes to relationships, Kenton has no room for love until he meets unemployed chef, Briana Rutledge who inherits a cottage next door to the winery. Briana wants to turn the cottage into her dream restaurant, but Kenton's ex-girlfriend, Tiffany Young and her father have other plans for Briana.

Justin Underwood is “the strong one.” He’s a passionate civil rights attorney who fights to protect the woman he loves in court. But, Ashley Jacobs, has a family secret that prevents her from totally committing to Justin.   

Billionaire, Carter Underwood is “the gifted one.”  He’s a hard driving, self-centered, CEO who’s used to controlling his time, money, and heart until he meets Courtney Oliver, the former “Miss Oakland,” who forces him to realize his heart has a mind of its own, and he can’t tell it who to love.  

Brandon Underwood, is “the artistic one.” He has lost his passion for painting until he meets Ciara Alexander, an ambitious ballerina who hears her biological clock ticking. She must choose between her blind ambition and Brandon’s love.

The Underwood’s of Napa Valley Series takes a look at an African American, wine-producing family, the obstacles they face in the competitive wine industry, and how their lives are forever changed by loving relationships among the vines. 

The Impact

  • There are African American wineries scattered all over California and the United States, but they are in the minority. 
  • This movie shares the history of these overlooked wineries.
  • I want to bring awareness of these African American wineries and the history and romance of it all to the public.
  • The risks and obstacles we may face to achieve our goal are: reaching a large audience that would enjoy viewing a film about the lifestyle of an African American wine-producing family and their romantic relationships.
  • My plan for solving these challenges is to build my audience and promote the series via press and publicity.

Other Ways You Can Help

    • We are asking for $20,000 to pay for: 

    • Press & Publicity

    • Cast

    • Film Crew

    • Film Editing

    • Catering

    • All donors will be invited to special events located in the San Francisco Bay Area.

    • Unused funds will be donated to The American Cancer Society if entire goal is not reached. 

    Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
  •  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

And that's all there is to it.

Film Crew
Film Editing
Catering
All donors will be invited to special events located in the San Francisco Bay Area.

Unused funds will be donated to The American Cancer Society if entire goal is not reached. Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
 Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

From the group that brought the remarkable stage experience Kaleidoscope to Atlanta, GA, we present to you an original web series titled: IN PURSUIT, DANCE!™  

Marcus, Loretta, Ethan & Misty are each at varying stages of life, in circumstances shaped by their distinctive backgrounds, experiences, and complexes. In sharing their personal stories, ambitions, and challenges, we give viewers an opportunity to watch - and possibly relate - as these individuals navigate thoughts and emotions that bug them down in their mundane day to day.  You will also witness how dance can freely unknot burdens, take away stress, and reduce anxiety and depression. 

The Why

Did you know? 20 years of research suggest that Dance/Movement Therapy (DMT) and dance are effective for increasing quality of life and decreasing clinical symptoms such as depression and anxiety. Positive effects were also found on the increase of subjective well-being, positive mood, affect, and body image**. 

Through this series, we seek to highlight deep struggles faced by dancers, dance enthusiasts, and even non-dancers as we navigate everyday living. We then shine the spotlight on this not-so-popular application of dance i.e. dance therapy and persuade the viewer to dance... or dance again!

About Us

  • Spirit of David (SOD) is an arts organization specializing in creating unforgettable experiences through the fusion of dance & drama. 
  • For the past 22 years, we've used rather unconventional approaches to highlight tough societal issues and share messages of faith, hope & love.
  • We're talking 98 shows in 43 cities around the world including Lagos, Valencia, Aberdeen, Ouagadougou, Johannesburg, Mombasa, Dubai, Sydney and Atlanta!
  • IN PURSUIT, DANCE!™ is our 99th original production and our very 1st web series, and we need your help to bring it to life!

Please note: SOD's U.S. branch is a duly registered 501(c)3 nonprofit organization in the state of Georgia. Your contributions are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law.

 

GOAL TO FINISH $14,000

Timeline:

  • Treatment, Storyboards, Look-book & Moodboards JAN - APR 2019

  • Pre-Production, Casting, Locations, Shot List, Schedule locked APR 2019

  • Principal shooting MAY 2019

  • Post-Production MAY - JUNE 2019

  • First episode released JULY 2019!

WE NEED YOUR HELP! CLAIM A PERK OR SIMPLY DONATE TO HELP US BRING THIS 4-EPISODE WEB SERIES TO LIFE IN JULY 2019. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to make a donation or claim a perk, you can support by:

  • Helping to get the word out and making some noise about this campaign. Simply copy and share the following link (split.to/pursuit) or use the social sharing buttons at the top of this page.
  • Shopping on . Use our Amazon Smile link or click on the image below. Next, choose Spirit of David Gospel Dance Club, Inc.

You can also copy/paste this link - https://smile.amazon.com/ch/11-3732200

 

Be a part of a fresh and original story and help us bring this vision to the web!

Many thanks to our awesome cast & crew! 

 

 

TO SUPPORT THIS CAMPAIGN, CLICK THE "BACK IT" OR "SELECT A PERK" BUTTON.

THANK YOU!

 

** Koch, S., Kunz, T., Lykou, S., & Cruz, R. F. (2014). Effects of dance movement therapy and dance on health-related psychological outcomes: A meta-analysis. The Arts in Psychotherapy, 41 (1), 46-64.

story:
What is TheDeplorables.TV

“The Deplorables TV” is a web series focusing on the lives of the so-called “Deplorables” in our great country and is dedicated to being the voice of common sense in America. While each episode highlights the life and perspective of different Deplorables, all of the episodes are intertwined and related. 

How can all the episodes featuring so many deplorables from different walks of life be related?

I’m so glad you asked! Mainstream media, the Hollywood elite, and many on the left would have the world believe that Deplorables are the uneducated, toothless, living on welfare, gun toting buffoons of America. This show is going to let them know we’re anything but.

The Deplorables I know are hard working and chock full of common sense. We are patriotic. We are tough. ...So tough we don't have to get in gangs, cover our faces, break things, and attack people to get our points across.

Who am I? Who is helping me?

My name is Tom Antion and I’m the producer of The Deplorables TV, Internet Expert, Consumer Advocate, and professional speaker. I’ve created hundreds of video and audio productions with the latest being http://www.ScamBrigade.com a consumer advocacy show that's currently being handled by a major Hollywood production company for sale to the networks.

You should also know that I’m not a fan of any particular politician because they all suck in their own way. I am fan of a prosperous and safe USA and through this show I plan on showcasing the real people ....the hard working deplorables, patriots and business people that elected businessman Donald Trump to shake up the status quo and get some real results while putting America First.

I’ve created and am producing The Deplorables TV because I'm sick and tired of snowflakes, safe spaces and political correctness ruining our country and generations of young people to come. ​

We have a team of hardworking, deplorable video people, research and social media people, and production people who, even though this is a labor of love, hope to get paid as the show takes off. That’s right, they are all volunteering to make this happen right now!

The Format

The first season of The Deplorables TV will be 6 episodes with each episodes being around 30 minutes. We plan to start shooting the web series in June 2017, and will be releasing the episodes on YouTube with the possibility of adding other streaming sites later.

Each episode would highlight 3-5 deplorables during the approximately 30 minute episode. Our anticipated release would be October 2017.

Let's Talk About Money

Now, about the money.
I grew up frugal.

I know how to do things great, but cheap.

I've made full length, high quality TV and video shows for 1/10 th the cost of estimates from professional production companies.

I won't be blowing any of this money on lavish wasteful things.

You contributions to The Deplorable TV will be used to:

  • Pay hardworking video production people
  • Pay Editing, research and security people
  • Contract out to deplorable Web and social media people
  • Cover travel expenses to highlight many, wonderful deplorables around this country
  • Acquire permits when necessary
  • Pay legal fees, taxes and the cost of being on this system

What's In This for You?

Be sure to check out the perks on this page! Twitter shoutouts, shirts, show posters,DVD's, be featured in an episode and more! Take a look at all the perks, and email us if you have ideas for the show!

Risks & Challenges

I’ve been an entrepreneur for my entire adult life and have an enormous track record of success. For The Deplorable TV web series, I currently have a team of hard working Deplorables volunteering behind the scenes to help make this show happen.

Our biggest challenge is that we could have to change the release date due to unforeseen circumstances. There could be outrageous attacks and protests from the left and/or the mainstream media. This could slow us down, but absolutely won't stop us.  

My goal, which is similar to what you may have heard from President Trump, I like to finish ahead of schedule and under budget. I need your help to get started and highlight the people just like you who are making America great again.

Other Ways You Can Help

While I’d love for you to contribute and grab one (or more) of our perks, there’s other ways you can help!

Like The Deplorables TV on Facebook

Follow The Deplorables TV on Twitter and Instagram

Know someone with the media? Have them contact us for an interview or to feature The Deplorables TV.

Share our campaign and story with your friends, family, and enemies! Yes, share it with the liberals! haha Here's the link to share: https://igg.me/at/deplorablestv

Write a blog posting about The Deplorables TV

Interview me (Tom Antion) on your Podcast or Facebook Live Show! 

Sign Up to be notified of future The Deplorables TV updates at our website TheDeplorables.TV 

Thanks so much for checking us out. I'm dedicated to making a great show showcasing great people!

Know someone with the media? Have them contact us for an interview or to feature The Deplorables TV.
