story:
Short Summary

A rural county in West Tennessee has become the hot spot for drug trafficking due to a smaller police presence with minimal resources. Upon the request of the District Attorney, a team of regional narcotics investigators are formed to battle the growing crisis plaguing the area.

The Stix peels back the layers to a complicated issue as we peek into the lives of the detectives pursuing the drug activity and the people in the midst of it.

This series will be free to view online via Youtube, Facebook or Vimeo. Unfortunately it's not free to make. This is an ambitious project with it's fair share of characters, challenges and locations. Our plan is to film this series throughout the summer and have it available for you by Fall 2018.

What We Need & Why

$6000 is the bare minimum we need to complete this project comfortably. Here is a breakdown of how the money will be used...

  • $1000 for Props & wardrobe. (Super soaker water guns and badges drawn on paper aren't as believable.)
  • $1000 for Locations & Insurance. Being a series, we need to lock in agreements on locations. Continuity is essential.
  • $2000 for key cast members. We have an awesome cast of local up and coming talent. They are aware we won't get rich doing this but helping them with travel expenses and hopefully a day rate will go a long way.
  • $1000 for marketing  We want people to see the hard work we put into this series.
  • $1000 for food  Long days on set can work up an appetite. Feeding actors and crew is a necessity.

Why we need you

Low budget projects present a challenge within itself because, well it's low budget. Some directors would consider $6000 an impossible amount to get a series off of the ground, but the director has a great track record of getting his films made with minimal resources.

As mentioned, $6000 is the absolute bare minimum we need to get this project off the ground but anything over that goal would make this series even better as we could

  • Rent better equipment
  • Hire more crew help
  • Make the actors smile by adding a little more in their pockets.
  • Reach more people with marketing
Check out our perks section, consider contributing and being apart of the team! Also you'll get some real cool stuff!
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, we understand. But some things are just as good as cash.

  • We need locations! If you're in the West Tennessee area and you have a location we could use, Awesome! We promise to respect any location as our own!
  • Have an old car you barely drive? Bring it to set, we can use it!
  • Got a lot of friends and family? Spread the word and share this campaign on social media!

Check out past work from the director

story:
My name is Greg Garthe and thank you for reviewing our crowd fund campaign.  I’ve been a filmmaker since the age of 6 and have worked at a professional level since the early 2000s on movies such as “Wedding Crashers” and “Shanghai Knights” when I was a director’s protégé, up through joining the Producer’s Guild, and directing an independent comedy movie, which featured some well-known actors.  I have been around for a bit and seen a lot, but the entertainment world is a tough business.  While I continue to work freelance on a variety of shoots, I also develop my own projects, which I am passionate about.  This is where “Assholes In Arbitration” comes in and why I am launching a crowd fund campaign to help finish the project.  Having been developing this show for nearly three years, I believe that we have something special, which has never been attempted before in this way and I am very proud of the talented cast and crew we have assembled.  Now, all we need is your support to make my dream project a reality!

We are looking to raise $18,000 for production and post-production expenses.  We have shot most of the show but need financing to cover outstanding costs, additional shooting, and post production.  Thus far, I have funded things entirely out-of-pocket by selling assets that my grandfather left to me when he passed away.  In this business, when one is creating a low-budget project, there are many people who will work for free or for next-to-nothing.  But, I aim to run an honorable production where everybody gets paid a reasonable rate despite the challenges of the bottom number.  I believe in taking care of others and not taking advantage of peoples’ generosity with their time.  And that is a big part of why I need additional funding.  To incentivize your contribution, we are offering a number of fun items such as autographed cast photos, T-shirts & other swag, name in the credits, and even actual props and wardrobe items used in the show.  I want to give back to those who support my vision.  I have a lot of experience as a producer and director, so I know what it takes to get something like this done.  And get it done, we will.

Thank you again for considering a contribution and hey, if you can’t send any money, I totally get it!  I appreciate you taking the time to read this and watch the video.  And if you are up for posting it on social media and sharing it with others, that is also a significant way in which you can contribute.  I appreciate whatever you can do.  Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools and/or spread the word with our website: www.assholesinarbitration.com

The world needs comedy now more than ever and I strive to generate something unique that makes people happy and takes them away from their everyday problems, even if only for a little while.  Laughter is a very important part of the human experience.  So, please follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram (links are found in the website) and join the journey with us!

Thank you very much for your time!

Greg Garthe

story:
About the Project

Want to see a size 14-16 woman as the LEAD and LOVE INTEREST in a television show, and have her LOVE her body, NEVER be the butt of the joke, and have a fabulous love life?  This is your show.

Want to see Christians question their faith journey when the shit hits the fan?  This is your show.

Want to watch a bunch of imperfect humans tangle with what it means to love your neighbor but not judge your neighbor, and maybe not overfeed your neighbor at the potluck?  This is your show.

Want to have sex talked about in a real way, and challenge why modern Christianity puts pressure just on girls to be pure? Want to discuss celibacy until couples are married?  Maybe not.  Maybe that is too much.  But yeah, we deal with that on this show too.  We also deal with homosexuality on this show.  And guess what?  It isn't a sin.  So, maybe this is your show, and maybe it's not, but I hope maybe I can maybe make ya laugh, think, and possibly change your mind.

Want a show with a wide variety of female leads ages 5-80 (NO JOKE)?  THIS IS YOUR SHOW.

Lastly... do you want to be part of me breaking into that exclusive club, and help me produce this sucker guerrilla style?  THEN C'MON! I gots perks for ya.  Check 'em out in the PERKS section!

 

ABOUT ME

My name is Ann Mahoney, you may know my work from THE WALKING DEAD (Olivia), SUN RECORDS (Gladys Presley), BAD MOMS (Mousey Mom), RECTIFY (Beth Mitcherson), and most recently SAME KIND OF DIFFERENT AS ME and LOGAN LUCKY.

As a Christian (but not that judgmental, asshole kind), and an actress, I have grown increasingly frustrated with two aspects of the Hollywood television production machine: 

1.  Faith-based shows that: don't speak to me as a Christian who believes the faith journey is not simple, don't show how tremendously hilarious God/Church/Church People are, don't question why we believe what we believe, and don't challenge us to be LESS judgmental of others... aka - MORE Christlike.

2.  Television shows that only cast actresses over a size 2 as the "frumpy teacher" or the "funny best friend."  If they DO cast an actress who is, say, the size of the average American woman - size 14-16, she is the butt of the joke, she hates her body, and she is DEFINITELY NOT the love interest.

I knew the only way to see the kind of show I want to SEE as a size 14-16 woman, who is a Christian, who wants to explore the craziness of faith and the humor of God - was to WRITE it.  SO... I did.  

There I was sitting in a pew of my home church in Louisiana. I had just moved back to New Orleans after 6 years in Asheville, NC.  My husband and I moved there after Hurricane Katrina when our house was destroyed.  I had always heard people talk about the "still small voice" of God talking to you, and frankly, thought it was a load of bull.  But dang if I didn't hear that still, small voice that day.  And thus, PREACHIN TO THE CHOIR was born.  Yes, six years ago.  I have been refining the script ever since.

With all the horrific stuff happening in Hollywood right now, I hear the same refrain over and over again - we need more WOMEN in Hollywood, more WOMAN-PRODUCED shows, more DIVERSITY in casting.  But I have to tell you, from my standpoint - it has been quite difficult to break into the upper echalon of powerful women in Hollywood... and I am ready to do just that with this show.  

THAT is how you can help.

What if you haven't got that spare $200 to give to the campaign but you are FOR all these things??  You can help by doing two things:  sharing this campaign, and praying.  If you believe in string theory, which this Physics lovin' Christian does, you know that prayer WORKS.

THANK YOU for your SUPPORT!
story_txt: About the ProjectWant to see a size 14-16 woman as the LEAD and LOVE INTEREST in a television show, and have her LOVE her body, NEVER be the butt of the joke, and have a fabulous love life?  This is your show.Want to see Christians question their faith journey when the shit hits the fan?  This is your show.Want to watch a bunch of imperfect humans tangle with what it means to love your neighbor but not judge your neighbor, and maybe not overfeed your neighbor at the potluck?  This is your show.Want to have sex talked about in a real way, and challenge why modern Christianity puts pressure just on girls to be pure? Want to discuss celibacy until couples are married?  Maybe not.  Maybe that is too much.  But yeah, we deal with that on this show too.  We also deal with homosexuality on this show.  And guess what?  It isn't a sin.  So, maybe this is your show, and maybe it's not, but I hope maybe I can maybe make ya laugh, think, and possibly change your mind.Want a show with a wide variety of female leads ages 5-80 (NO JOKE)?  THIS IS YOUR SHOW.Lastly... do you want to be part of me breaking into that exclusive club, and help me produce this sucker guerrilla style?  THEN C'MON! I gots perks for ya.  Check 'em out in the PERKS section! ABOUT MEMy name is Ann Mahoney, you may know my work from THE WALKING DEAD (Olivia), SUN RECORDS (Gladys Presley), BAD MOMS (Mousey Mom), RECTIFY (Beth Mitcherson), and most recently SAME KIND OF DIFFERENT AS ME and LOGAN LUCKY.As a Christian (but not that judgmental, asshole kind), and an actress, I have grown increasingly frustrated with two aspects of the Hollywood television production machine: 1.  Faith-based shows that: don't speak to me as a Christian who believes the faith journey is not simple, don't show how tremendously hilarious God/Church/Church People are, don't question why we believe what we believe, and don't challenge us to be LESS judgmental of others... aka - MORE Christlike.2.  Television shows that only cast actresses over a size 2 as the "frumpy teacher" or the "funny best friend."  If they DO cast an actress who is, say, the size of the average American woman - size 14-16, she is the butt of the joke, she hates her body, and she is DEFINITELY NOT the love interest.I knew the only way to see the kind of show I want to SEE as a size 14-16 woman, who is a Christian, who wants to explore the craziness of faith and the humor of God - was to WRITE it.  SO... I did.  There I was sitting in a pew of my home church in Louisiana. I had just moved back to New Orleans after 6 years in Asheville, NC.  My husband and I moved there after Hurricane Katrina when our house was destroyed.  I had always heard people talk about the "still small voice" of God talking to you, and frankly, thought it was a load of bull.  But dang if I didn't hear that still, small voice that day.  And thus, PREACHIN TO THE CHOIR was born.  Yes, six years ago.  I have been refining the script ever since.With all the horrific stuff happening in Hollywood right now, I hear the same refrain over and over again - we need more WOMEN in Hollywood, more WOMAN-PRODUCED shows, more DIVERSITY in casting.  But I have to tell you, from my standpoint - it has been quite difficult to break into the upper echalon of powerful women in Hollywood... and I am ready to do just that with this show.  THAT is how you can help.What if you haven't got that spare $200 to give to the campaign but you are FOR all these things??  You can help by doing two things:  sharing this campaign, and praying.  If you believe in string theory, which this Physics lovin' Christian does, you know that prayer WORKS.THANK YOU for your SUPPORT!

story:
You can bring bluegrass, folk, old-time, blues, & gospel music recorded live on location on David Holt's State of Music to public TV audiences from coast to coast.

David Holt's State of Music has exposed to viewers in Los Angeles, Chicago, Boston, Washington, DC, and San Francisco, in all 85% of USA households. PBS broadcast the first 2 seasons of David Holt’s State of Music more than 4700 times. Our YouTube of Rhiannon Giddens playing "Julie" on Season One has been viewed more than 850,000 times. The Tunes from David Holt's State of Music 2 CD climbed to #9 on the folk radio charts.

We need your help to make Season 3 a reality. Shooting major southern traditional  artist at the very highest audio and video quality is expensive. The non-profit Will and Deni Foundation has to raise all the money for the show, more than $300K for Season 3. We can only produce Season 3 with the support of underwriters, funders, and donors like you. 

We have raised the funds for the first two seasons, and we can do it again for Season 3. We have learned how important the mix of business underwriting, foundation grants, and individual donations are to reaching our goal. We learned how valuable every contribution, big, little, or in the middle is to getting this American music from the southern Appalachian on the air across the USA.
 

When you see Season 3 of David Holt's State of Music on your Public Television Station or online, you will know that you made it happen.

story:
Short Summary

Hello there! Do you love animation/horror/teen angst? Probably, if you clicked on this page. This is Offspring, a 2D series I want to make into a TV show. Who am I? I'm Hannah, creator/director/writer/editor of the whole shebang! An avid fan of horror comedies, I thought to myself one day, "Wouldn't it be funny if a Slasher with a meat cleaver for a weapon had a son and his weapon was a butter knife?" and thus, Offspring was born. 

Do you remember watching something scary as a kid, and it left you a tiny bit traumatized, but also a little braver? That's my vision for this series. Fans of Danny Phantom, Gravity Falls, and Invader Zim, I want to give you that same feeling of shock, passion, and fan-girl fervor that rivals Tumblr circa 2012. (Yes, that serious.) Why do this, you may ask? Because creating this show has been the best experience of my life, and it was just getting those goofy fantasies from when I was an angsty pre-teen out of my head. I want this show to inspire the next generation  of people like me: the horror nerds, the sci-fi geeks, and the cringey romance lovers. 

Meet Our Team

Our team is made up of talented creative professionals with years of experience in animation and artistry. Read their bios and get to know them a little!

Hannah Silverman (She/Her)
Creator, Director, Writer, Editor
Currently working as a Staff Writer, she earned a BA in Creative Writing with a Double Minor in French and Film/Media Studies at the University of Kansas. She is earning her MFA in Dramatic Writing at Savannah College of Art and Design and is expected to graduate May 2021. Hannah loves creating new worlds and writing dialogue. (@HannahSilverm19)

Sol Valdez (They/Them)
Art Director, Character Designer, Storyboard Artist, & Animator
Former storyboard artist at CinemaChef Productions and Kolrom Media, they have earned a BFA in Illustration with a concentration in Sequential Art from the Maryland Institute College of Art. Sol currently works as a freelance visual development artist and loves exploring the intersections between design and storytelling. (@SolValdezArt)

Becca Katko (She/They) 

Becca is a designer and story artist with a BFA in Illustration from the Maryland Institute College of Art. Action and humor are at the heart of her work, and she loves telling stories that pack a punch. (@beccakatko)

Danny Motta (He/Him)

Lead Voice Actor and Tiktok content creator. Danny has directed, acted in, and voice acted in several projects including short films and comedy sketches. He has a Cinema and Photography Bachelor’s Degree and is currently working as a freelance videographer/photographer. (@dmotta3)

And so many more! Follow us on social media and see our exciting new content for Offspring.

What We Need & What You Get

Right now, we're in the beginning stage. The project currently stands as a two minute animatic of the pilot's teaser. Our mission is to make sure everyone who helps with this project (animators, voice actors, sound designers) are paid for their time and work. Any funds we make, under or over our goal, goes to giving these people a well deserved paycheck.

Our budget is broken down into four categories: Art, Sound, Voice Acting, and Promotion. Animators will cover art direction, Sound Designers will create an audio environment that matches the scenes, and Voice Actors will bring our characters to life for your viewing pleasure. Future promotion of this show will allow us to continue building this immersive story.

We do have stretch goals planned out, which include:

1. A two minute teaser animatic with voice acting and sound design, as well as a short intro with graphics/music

2. A fully animated two minute teaser and intro, colored/polished, full sound, all that jazz

3. A fully animated twenty-two minute episode of the series pilot

Basically, the more money we earn, the more Offspring you'll get to see!

The Impact

Here's the main reason why you should contribute: a series like Offspring created during the current animation Renaissance is going to foster a new love for comedy, horror, and young adult media. If you ever wished you could have been there at the start of Avatar: The Last Airbender or Infinity Train, this is your chance.

Experience-wise, I've got multiple degrees in Creative Writing (plus a double minor in French and Film/Media Studies) all with a concentration in animation screenwriting. I've been a coverage intern, a freelance writer, orchestrated multiple filmmaker interviews, and online script readings. I'm a part of this community, I know what goes on in it and most of all, I know what people want to see.

Risk and Obstacles

This is the first time I've undertaken a project like this, but I'm not going to let the idea of failure scare me or my team out of creating this series. We want to take every problem as they come and work together to find the solution. We've specifically allocated our budget for emergencies, because we know about the risk involved, just like every creator on this site.

Our team is loyal to my vision, and I want to compensate that loyalty with funds that cover their hourly rates and effort put into this project. If we do not reach our goal, Offspring will not be able to grow as a series. Our creative team includes LGBTQ+ folks, POC's, and professionally trained artists. Everyone working on Offspring has a full time job of their own,  and they're willing to make room for because they know it has potential.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're loving the sound of this, but still can't contribute financially, don't worry! There are still plenty of ways to support Offspring. We have a Facebook page, Twitter, and Instagram that we update regularly with exclusive new content. 

Tell everyone about it! Tell your friends, your family, your enemies, strangers walking on the street, your UberEats driver that always gives you extra ketchup packets. Get out there and spread the word!

story:
Hi there! Delius, Jonathan, and Ahmad here, the executive producers, writers, and stars of the new series in development, "Not Looking." We're immensely proud of this story and are eager to tell you more about it and how you can help.

“Not Looking” tells the story of three newly single gay best friends in New York City who make a pact to stay out of relationships for a year in order to support each other on their journeys of self discovery. The series examines themes often neglected by television: the first generation American experience, colorism, and the nuance of racism. 

The idea for the series spawned after the dynamic, inspiring, and often difficult summer of 2020, a summer that renewed our conviction for social justice, that catalyzed a reexamining of our own racial and sexual identities, and that brought unexpected solidarity, camaraderie, and adventure. We never get to see those themes centered around gay people of color: like us!

So why should you watch? Because as gay men, as men of color, as men born from immigrants, we are people who have always had to leave behind some part of our identity in order to advance our dreams. We hope that by representing ourselves bare, we can inspire further acceptance of those who dare to live at their maximum capacity along with us.

Our goal of $20,000 will go exclusively toward production and post-production costs. We've been producing this labor of love entirely out of our own pockets and will not be personally profiting from any of your contributions. By choosing to fund our project, you're supporting more than just our desire to share this story with the masses, you'll be amplifying our voices, respecting our challenges, and honoring our growth. We'll thank you back with exciting perks at various contributor levels. If you can't donate, we'll be equally grateful to see you share this initiative with friends and family. The generosity of your effort to help spread the word means a great deal to us.

Help us tell our stories!

Click here to check out our website for updates!

story:
Final Week - To get the reduced priced perks, click the perk that indicates 'Price Dropped!' 
 
If you're here to support the production of SHEro - click the pink 'Back It' button to the right and select a donation amount. Thank you! 

 

For details as well as perk terms & conditions, click here. Questions? Contact us here. 

 

Our Mission

As indie filmmakers, we know the likelihood of creating a narrative feature or short film with a real or profitable theatrical distribution run is against huge, if not impossible odds. Additionally, trying to sell that theatrical film to a major streaming service like Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, (SVOD) does not pay very much. What the market will pay for and wants is original episodic programming that viewers can binge watch.

We all see that the entertainment industry is changing by the minute and what I want for us, the indie film community, is to adapt to it. I hear a lot fear and talk in our community about what’s next. Read on...

Some Facts

Netflix is putting almost $7 billion into creating 1000 hours of programming much of which are new episodic shows. Half of which they are producing as a studio and the other half is purchased or licensed. Cable TV in the US lost 1.9M subscribers so far this year. Whereas, SVOD from Netflix, Amazon Prime and Hulu are up from 59% from last year. Now 64% of US households have SVOD solutions. Almost two-thirds of the 18 to 24-year-olds surveyed would choose streaming services over traditional pay-TV. Moreover, a majority (54%) of 25 to 34-year-olds would join them in that decision.

Our Purpose

Binge Watch Films (BWF) is seeking talent from the indie film community to submit your original program concepts. If accepted, BWF may fund your episodic pilot and shop it to various entities for licensing and distribution. There are many other streaming opportunities that have not been explored. BWF will shop its programming for licensing to a whole host of possible platforms, including major brands and retailers like Target, Best Buy and others to drive customers/viewers directly to their website to watch exclusive entertainment. We call this Retail Streaming Video on Demand (RSVOD). Our thinking is, why should a brand spend $200 million in advertising begging viewers via ads to come to their e-commerce or brick and mortar stores? Why don’t they have their own shows and have viewers watch them directly on their website? Then they can show them products that relate specifically to that demographic watching. To be clear, we are not talking branded content or product placement. We are talking real entertainment like you’d see on other SVOD platforms.

Do you have a concept for an original episodic series that speaks to a particular audience? Contact us here and we'll let you know if we think it's something we'd be interested in.

Steve Weiss, Creative Director - BWF

story:
The Book of Girl

Genre: Tween Sitcom

Two best friends embark on one of the biggest adventures of their life: High School. They befriend the new girl, who recently immigrated from an international school in India, and for their first class assignment create The Book of Girl. The book serves as a survival guide containing real life problems girls face everyday and how to approach them. At the end of their first semester, the trio leave the book in their school’s time capsule for future generations of girls to use.

Green Eggs and Fam Productions 

Rodas Dechassa - Co-Writer/Co-Director

Rodas hopes that 'The Book of Girl' will not only inspire young girls to be the best they can be but that they have the ability to take charge of their own narrative both onscreen and behind the camera. Her credits include behind-the-scenes work on a selection of music videos and short film "Breathe Maggie Breathe", as well as being a production assistant for RTA's 2017 TARA Awards.

Deepa Prashad - Co-Writer/Co-Director

Deepa Prashad is the current on-air host for Family Channel and blogTO. On top of hosting she is also an educational speaker for the TDSB. Deepa has a passion for writing and hopes to use that passion to bring new issues to light.

Joelle Farrow - Co-Producer

Joelle Farrow is an actress and client of Ambition Talent agency as well as a union member of ACTRA. She works at Crossroads and Yes TV as a social media intern and works for multiple marketing companies. She is also collaborating with multiple brands as a content creator. She co-hosts her own YouTube channel and is passionate about the broadcast and film industry.

Serena Harding - Co-Producer

Serena Harding is currently a Brand Partnerships Intern at MUCH and MTVCanada. Previous credits include working in various capacities on set of indie films, web series, a music video, and a documentary series. Her passion includes producing, directing, and girl empowerment.

Gabrielle Hagoriles - Technical Lead and Audio Lead

Gabrielle is delighted to be a part of such a special production. Identifying as an audio nerd, media geek, and a queer woman of colour, she wants nothing more than to bring diversity and inclusivity in mainstream media. Gabrielle is excited to bring her experience and passion to The Book of Girl.

Ryan Gaynor - Director of Photography

Ryan has  a deep passion for videography, photography and all things creative. Gaynor has thousands of hours of shooting experience and has amassed nearly 7 million views on his online photography and video channels. Gaynor currently works at Habitat For Humanity as a videographer and is excited to be the Director of Photography for The Book of Girl!

Talia Knezic - Marketing Lead

Talia is thrilled to be part of a show striving to create more inclusivity in the media! She has worked as a social media strategist for several organizations including Global Campus Network and Delmanor Seniors Communities, and has a passion for writing. Talia looks forward to bringing her enthusiasm and expertise to The Book of Girl.

Vitaliy Novikov - Lead Editor and Graphics

Vitaliy is very excited to bring his post-production magic to the table. He’s got over 6 years of experience in photography, video editing, VFX and 2D animation, all of which will definitely come in handy during creation of The Book of Girl.

We need all the support we can get. We hope to raise at least $7500 on top of our own individual contributions, and support from Girl Guides of Canada. All proceeds will go towards creating a quality production; including renting additional equipment, set props and wardrobe, and craft services (because you can't make quality work on an empty stomach). Our ultimate goal is to have The Book of Girl air on the YouTube Channel of a National Children's Broadcaster.

We are delighted to offer perks to contributors as our way of thanking you for helping us bring this vision to life! Any contributions of $10 and above will receive the perks in their tier.

**For social media shout outs, please send us your Instagram and/or Twitter handles!

The lack of inclusivity in the media is a problem which continues to remain unresolved. Through The Book of Girl, GE&F Productions hopes to speak to the minds of the media’s most impressionable audience: children. With a team largely comprised of women (our co-directors and co-writers being two women of colour), and a cast also reflecting our determination for diversity, we aim to inspire young girls while connecting with them via the relatable problems our characters face in each episode.

Key Episode Themes Include:

  • Embracing who you are
  • Standing up to bullies
  • Self-validation through social media

Other Ways You Can Help

Social media allows us to reach audiences (and potential contributors) on an exponential scale. If you are unable to contribute, please consider sharing this page with family and friends! Additionally, be sure to like/follow our social media pages for updates.
story_txt:
The Book of GirlGenre: Tween SitcomTwo best friends embark on one of the biggest adventures of their life: High School. They befriend the new girl, who recently immigrated from an international school in India, and for their first class assignment create The Book of Girl. The book serves as a survival guide containing real life problems girls face everyday and how to approach them. At the end of their first semester, the trio leave the book in their school’s time capsule for future generations of girls to use.Green Eggs and Fam Productions Rodas Dechassa - Co-Writer/Co-DirectorRodas hopes that 'The Book of Girl' will not only inspire young girls to be the best they can be but that they have the ability to take charge of their own narrative both onscreen and behind the camera. Her credits include behind-the-scenes work on a selection of music videos and short film "Breathe Maggie Breathe", as well as being a production assistant for RTA's 2017 TARA Awards.Deepa Prashad - Co-Writer/Co-DirectorDeepa Prashad is the current on-air host for Family Channel and blogTO. On top of hosting she is also an educational speaker for the TDSB. Deepa has a passion for writing and hopes to use that passion to bring new issues to light.Joelle Farrow - Co-ProducerJoelle Farrow is an actress and client of Ambition Talent agency as well as a union member of ACTRA. She works at Crossroads and Yes TV as a social media intern and works for multiple marketing companies. She is also collaborating with multiple brands as a content creator. She co-hosts her own YouTube channel and is passionate about the broadcast and film industry.Serena Harding - Co-ProducerSerena Harding is currently a Brand Partnerships Intern at MUCH and MTVCanada. Previous credits include working in various capacities on set of indie films, web series, a music video, and a documentary series. Her passion includes producing, directing, and girl empowerment.Gabrielle Hagoriles - Technical Lead and Audio LeadGabrielle is delighted to be a part of such a special production. Identifying as an audio nerd, media geek, and a queer woman of colour, she wants nothing more than to bring diversity and inclusivity in mainstream media. Gabrielle is excited to bring her experience and passion to The Book of Girl.Ryan Gaynor - Director of PhotographyRyan has  a deep passion for videography, photography and all things creative. Gaynor has thousands of hours of shooting experience and has amassed nearly 7 million views on his online photography and video channels. Gaynor currently works at Habitat For Humanity as a videographer and is excited to be the Director of Photography for The Book of Girl!Talia Knezic - Marketing LeadTalia is thrilled to be part of a show striving to create more inclusivity in the media! She has worked as a social media strategist for several organizations including Global Campus Network and Delmanor Seniors Communities, and has a passion for writing. Talia looks forward to bringing her enthusiasm and expertise to The Book of Girl.Vitaliy Novikov - Lead Editor and GraphicsVitaliy is very excited to bring his post-production magic to the table. He’s got over 6 years of experience in photography, video editing, VFX and 2D animation, all of which will definitely come in handy during creation of The Book of Girl.We need all the support we can get. We hope to raise at least $7500 on top of our own individual contributions, and support from Girl Guides of Canada. All proceeds will go towards creating a quality production; including renting additional equipment, set props and wardrobe, and craft services (because you can't make quality work on an empty stomach). Our ultimate goal is to have The Book of Girl air on the YouTube Channel of a National Children's Broadcaster.We are delighted to offer perks to contributors as our way of thanking you for helping us bring this vision to life! Any contributions of $10 and above will receive the perks in their tier.**For social media shout outs, please send us your Instagram and/or Twitter handles!The lack of inclusivity in the media is a problem which continues to remain unresolved. Through The Book of Girl, GE&F Productions hopes to speak to the minds of the media’s most impressionable audience: children. With a team largely comprised of women (our co-directors and co-writers being two women of colour), and a cast also reflecting our determination for diversity, we aim to inspire young girls while connecting with them via the relatable problems our characters face in each episode.Key Episode Themes Include:
Embracing who you are
Standing up to bullies
Self-validation through social media
Other Ways You Can HelpSocial media allows us to reach audiences (and potential contributors) on an exponential scale. If you are unable to contribute, please consider sharing this page with family and friends! Additionally, be sure to like/follow our social media pages for updates.

story:
Story

Bravo!! Hurray!! Well-done…the super hero Motuball from the Lattu Planet was very happy as he had landed after rolling n rolling hard. But to his dismay…the happiness couldn’t stay longer on his face when he discovered that he had landed on the exactly opposite pole …AHHH…urrghhh…it was SOUTH POLE!!!

It was freezing cold there and the movements were practically numb!! It seemed that the South Pole was stuck up in mid of a library….SILENCE PLEASE!!! It took more than a minute for Motuball to realize where he actually was and required tons of energy and courage to fight back and reach home: (!!!

The HERO NEVER DIES!!!! Yes….minutes later the mischievous brain turned the tiredness into bundle of ideas and Motuball started experimenting with the brilliant ideas… (Yes as always…haha). Riding on the roller coaster of crazy ideas Motuball reached his destination the….NORTH POLE!!

Wait wait….the story is still on….to his amaze,  he was welcomed in the NORTH POLE by a charming surprise, the Lady Love of his life... .Pajaimia Stick!!! And here the magical world of Motuball turned into the world of Love, laughter and what not more….!!!!

Wondering how did he reach there? Well all that and lots more is answered in the series ….Catch up and follow us for brain teasing and fun filled ideas used by Motuball  ………………. enjoy the super powers of Motuball and his mysterious world!!

Benefits And Our Mission

Team MOTUBALLS includes independent storytellers who love to create a new set of dimension in Animation industry. We are working in the direction to articulate "Chocolate" with superlative power creature which is as funny as our childhood.To start with, we produced the trailer of Motuballs  from our pocket to grab the digital space via Youtube and other social media source but to continue Episode development we require your generous support. MOTUBALLS in its artistic format would like to connect with millions of animation lovers through different modes and channels.We have a large group of followers who are curious to explore Chocolate World Imagica.

Will seek support to further grow our Studio platform with more such stories in a high pixel animation!!!

Budget 

Initially we want to give fair salary to our team for their work, we have already discussed all the payments and hours with them.The majority of fund shall go towards maximum output with respect to feel and looks. 

Rest will go in  advertising and crowdfunding fees.We are showing our investment through pie-chart.Lets checkout the percentage distribution of total fund.

We have a requirement of $ 10 K for our project.

Timeline:

We have already released our 1st official trailer on Youtube channel on 24 September 2017.

2nd Official Trailer will be released in Diwali (Indian Festival).. Dated 18 October 2017.

1st Episode will release in Christmas..Dated 25 Dec 2017.

Each future episode will be released after a  regular interval of 45 days.

    Glimpse of Motuballs with multiple characters to get a feeling of this Mysterious Story  

    Motuballs lifting up by flying Kakeda :

     

    Pajamia Stick in Love with Motuballs :

     

    Our Team 

    Poonam : Founder

    Shankar : Creative Director

    Soumitra : Animation Director

    Gaurav : Screenplay

    Saurabh : Writer

    Dhiraj : Background Score

    Victor : Sound Mixing

    Manoj : Dubbing Artist

     

    Other Ways you can Help 

    If you are not sharing a donation to our campaign,you can help us by promoting our campaign through Facebook,twitter and Youtube. You can like/tweet/share/subscribe our page/channel.

    All the links/pages are given below 

    1) Our Official Website : www.motuballs.com 

    2) Facebook Page :  https://www.facebook.com/MOTUBALLS/

    3) Twitter Page : https://twitter.com/MotuBalls

    4) Youtube Channel link : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x5l2mxHhThA 

    There is an Indiegogo share option that allows you to send this campaign out via Email and other social media.

story:
She was a nun the whole time!

Nun the Wiser is a web-series by Emily Keene. This project will serve as my graduate thesis as part of the Writing and Producing for Television program at Loyola Marymount University. My team and I are looking for $3500 to cover production and post-production costs for this exciting series. 

Mary is a member of the Special Espionage Character Reconnaissance and Eavesdropping Team aka S.E.C.R.E.T. They're an elite squad that travel the world to stop dangerous terrorists, splinter groups and all around bad people. All of the agents on the team are different costumed characters - firefighters, judge, surfers and of course a nun. The team is managed by Major Theodore Graham, an old army officer who was brought out of retirement to run this elite team. 

Each episode will follow Mary as she goes on a mission. It's fun, silly, ridiculous and sure to have you rolling with laughter. 

What We Need & What You Get

Nun the Wiser is a digital series, and we're trying to produce the first two episodes.

To do this we need:

  • Costumes
  • Sets
  • Props
  • Locations
  • Food for the cast and crew
  • Post-Production costs

Your contributions would be instrumental in securing all these items. 

But wait, there's more - PERKS!

Even $5 would make a huge impact in bringing this project together and to ensure you know how much we appreciate your help we have some fun perks for our backers. To the right side of the page you can see our fun perks.

 

The Team

Emily Keene - Writer, Director, Producer.

Originally from Melbourne, Australia, Emily has always had a love of silly comedy. Beginning as a director and designer for Theatre in Melbourne, Emily graduated from Monash University with a Bachelor of Arts in Film Studies in 2014, and realized that film and television was where her heart really lay. Moving to Los Angeles in 2015, to study Writing and Producing for Television at Loyola Marymount University, Emily has expanded her love of comedy. She's excited to direct and produce this fun show and hopes that you will share her passion for this crazy comedy. 

Andrew Gioia - Director of Photography.

Andrew Gioia is a current graduate student in the Film & TV Production program at Loyola Marymount University. He completed his undergraduate degrees at the University of Florida where he double majored in Telecommunications in Production and Finance. There, he worked for Gainesville's local news channel, WUFT, and with the ESPN and SEC production crews for live broadcasting of select sporting events. Prior to moving to LA, he interned for Business Insider as a video producer in NYC. Despite his eclectic past, Andrew's passion resides in creating anything in the realm of comedy. 

The Cast

Mikki Hernandez - Sister Mary Danger

Mikki, a California native, is a fresh face to the acting world. She has spent the last three years building a repertoire in acting for film/tv, voiceover, theater, combat fighting, improv and recently began exploring the art of sketch comedy. Her acting credits include short films Hexit and 62 Million; feature film The Night I Died; web series Shades and Layers; ID Network’s The Coroner; and most recently performed in the play Farragut North by Beau Willimon. She is a proud UCLA alum and enjoys traveling, dancing, and keeping up with meme culture.

Christopher Hazlehurst - Major Theodore Graham

Christopher grew up in a small town in Northern California and ended up moving to New York to be a lawyer.  After a few years of practicing law, he realized it was not the life for him; he quit his job and left the country for awhile.  After some very serious soul-searching, he decided to ditch the stable life and pursue his true passion as an actor.  He moved to LA and has been at it ever since.

Shane JP Monaghan - Mr. Johnson/ Samuel Inferno

Shane JP Monaghan is from San Diego, CA. He started acting his freshman year of high school and has continued to act ever since. He went to Grossmont Community College in San Diego and completed his Associates in Arts with a Theatre degree with an Acting emphasis. He then transferred to CSU, Long Beach where he completed his Bachelor of Arts with a Theatre Degree in the Performance Emphasis.  He has been very fortunate to start this journey with this cast and crew!  A couple of his recent theatre credits include The Good Boys and True (CSULB) and Elements (CSULB) . 

Tristan Biber - Skyler Garden/ Dr. Von Bulow

Tristan Biber was born and raised in Geneva, Switzerland and has somehow found his way to Los Angeles. He completed his undergrad education at Kenyon College in Ohio, where he studied Film and Anthropology. During his time at Kenyon, he performed in several productions, playing Chris Keller in All My Sons, Hank in Marvin's Room, and Mac in You Got Older. He has also performed in the Fringe NYC as Samuel in You Belong With Me Because You're So Vain. While he has been in LA, Tristan has worked on several short films, portraying Liam in Speak No Evil and Dave in A Big Missed Steak. He is truly honored to be part of the cast of Nun the Wiser, and is incredibly thankful to all those involved and those who have supported him along the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone has the means to donate money, but you can still help! If you're into this project, please share this campaign, or like us on Facebook (Facebook.com/nunthewisertv), Twitter (@nunthewisertv) or Instagram (@nunthewisertv).

Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone has the means to donate money, but you can still help! If you're into this project, please share this campaign, or like us on Facebook (Facebook.com/nunthewisertv), Twitter (@nunthewisertv) or Instagram (@nunthewisertv).

story:
Written, directed, and produced by local self-published science fiction and horror novelist and screenwriter, Ronald J. Rossmann Jr., The Dusk Series is a groundbreaking web series, the only dramatic series filmed entirely on Facebook LIVE.  This innovative horror/science fiction/dark comedy project effectively mixes both theatrical and cinematic feel.  

Season one is now available in our VIDEO section of our Facebook page and on feature length DVD with bonus features and content.  

Now we are taking our production to the next level with Season Two...

New and veteran cast members...

Updated technology...

More action and thrills...

An exciting story that is filled with twists, turns, and mind-boggling surprises...

We need your help to accrue the last few bits of tech we need to truly succeed and market our series to networks and services...

Like Adult Swin, Netflix, Amazon, etc.

As stated before, we are seeking $2000 to obtain the following items:

1) A secondary, location use laptop 

2) Updated Adobe Editing Software

3) Wireless sound equipment

And we are offering some incredible perks to those who support us through this campaign.

Check them out and help us assure that Darkness Will Fall!

story:
What is Indiegogo and how does crowdfunding work?

Indiegogo is a platform to fund ingenious, work-in-progress products and ideas. Although contributing to a campaign is not the same as purchasing a product, when you support a crowdfunding project, you help bring ideas to life! Learn more.

How do I select a perk that interests me on this page?

On desktop, you’ll see a list with all available perks on the right hand side of the page. Click on the perk you want, then click the "Get This Perk" button to be redirected to the payment page. If you're on a mobile device, scroll up to see all available perks.

How do I ask the project owner a question?

If you’ve already backed this campaign, you can leave a comment on the Comments tab, or send the project owner a direct message. Otherwise, you may be able to contact the project owner through their website or social media accounts. Learn more.

Already contributed to this project?

Can I change the shipping address for my perk?

In most cases, yes. Here’s how to do it. However, if the project has already started to ship perks, or if you need to change your country, you’ll need to contact the project owner in order to request any changes.

Can I change the item, or perk, I selected?

You’ll need to contact the project owner directly to request any change to perks, like color or quantity.

Can I ask Indiegogo for a refund?

Indiegogo does not guarantee that the perks offered by the campaigner will be produced or delivered and is not directly responsible for refunding contributions. Learn moreabout our Refund policy.

campaign_city: Greater Los Angeles Area, United States

story:
My name is Ali Karim.  I am an American internal medicine doctor from Washington DC.  A little over one year ago, I began feeling left unsatisfied by the impact I was having on my patients.  For months, I wrapped my mind around finding better ways to help humanity on a bigger scale.  All the while, I’d look around only to witness more violence, more hatred, more illnesses, and more discrimination.  Enough was enough.  I had to do something.  

So, I quit my job to travel indefinitely around the world in search of humanity and figure out a grander way of world change.

Working as a physician and volunteering around the world has been an enlightening period, as I’ve come to believe that people truly can change the world if we unite together.  In our modern day, the power of media is more influential than any other power available to us, as it can reach from one end of the earth to the other.  So, I’ve traded my car for a camera and my apartment for a backpack to capture life abroad and share it for all to see.

Throughout my journeys, I've captured the beauty that life has to offer, as well as the horrors that you weren't meant to know.

The diffusion of knowledge and ideas is our most powerful tool.  I wish to harness this tool for the greater good by bringing this series into the limelight, in order to display the lives of the voiceless people around the world and share the beauty of humanity to the general public.

What We Need & What You Get

I’ve linked-up with a production company in Washington DC to help me professionally produce, edit, and distribute my material for the masses.  But production isn’t cheap – and traveling on my own dime has left me with little money to cover all the expenses. 

Our goal is to raise $50,000 to get the first several episodes of this series completed.  Each episode will feature a different country and will discuss the topics of humanity, culture, war, peace, prejudice, as well as a host of other political conversations and what we can do to create change. 

100% of the funding will go towards the production of this series and will help pay our seasoned veteran television producer, our broadcast editor/owner of the production company, as well as his team of talented professionals.  It will also help pay for music licensing and rights, coloring the film, graphics work, audio mixing, legal and marketing fees, distribution and syndication.

Funding will also help us put the finishing touches on our North Korea episode, "The Last Americans" - to be submitted for film festival consideration in 2018.  You can watch the sneak peek here:

 

We appreciate any donation you can make and we want to reward you with some really neat original perks, including:

  • Your name in the credits(!)
  • A chance to meet and talk with Ali via Skype or Google Hangouts
  • A digital download of a special behind-the-scenes episode of "The Backpacking Doc"
  • A chance to be a part of the post-production process as an episode is being finished
  • And many more chances to be a part of this production!

 

THE TIME IS NOW!

I’ve put my life on the line to capture many of these stories in some of the most dangerous places on earth.  Now, we need your help to bring this series to fruition.  And every little bit counts!

I'm lucky to be working with such a talented and thoughtful production team, and with over 25 years of combined broadcast television production experience, ranging from writing & producing to shooting & editing, you can be sure the series will make an impact.

Mahatma Gandhi once said, "Be the change that you wish to see in the world."  I'm living my part.  Now, you can be a part of this change, too.  Show your support by backing this project.  Help me to open the hearts and minds of people around the world and share what truly unifies us in this human experience – life. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation, that doesn't mean you can't help.  Help us spread the word of this fundraiser using the Indiegogo and Facebook share tools.  Like, follow, and share my social media pages and join the conversation!

https://www.facebook.com/backpackingdoc/

@backpackingdoc

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCzzdw2syPotx6t...
story_txt:
My name is Ali Karim.  I am an American internal medicine doctor from Washington DC.  A little over one year ago, I began feeling left unsatisfied by the impact I was having on my patients.  For months, I wrapped my mind around finding better ways to help humanity on a bigger scale.  All the while, I’d look around only to witness more violence, more hatred, more illnesses, and more discrimination.  Enough was enough.  I had to do something.  
So, I quit my job to travel indefinitely around the world in search of humanity and figure out a grander way of world change.
Working as a physician and volunteering around the world has been an enlightening period, as I’ve come to believe that people truly can change the world if we unite together.  In our modern day, the power of media is more influential than any other power available to us, as it can reach from one end of the earth to the other.  So, I’ve traded my car for a camera and my apartment for a backpack to capture life abroad and share it for all to see.
Throughout my journeys, I've captured the beauty that life has to offer, as well as the horrors that you weren't meant to know.
The diffusion of knowledge and ideas is our most powerful tool.  I wish to harness this tool for the greater good by bringing this series into the limelight, in order to display the lives of the voiceless people around the world and share the beauty of humanity to the general public.

What We Need & What You Get
I’ve linked-up with a production company in Washington DC to help me professionally produce, edit, and distribute my material for the masses.  But production isn’t cheap – and traveling on my own dime has left me with little money to cover all the expenses. 
Our goal is to raise $50,000 to get the first several episodes of this series completed.  Each episode will feature a different country and will discuss the topics of humanity, culture, war, peace, prejudice, as well as a host of other political conversations and what we can do to create change. 
100% of the funding will go towards the production of this series and will help pay our seasoned veteran television producer, our broadcast editor/owner of the production company, as well as his team of talented professionals.  It will also help pay for music licensing and rights, coloring the film, graphics work, audio mixing, legal and marketing fees, distribution and syndication.
Funding will also help us put the finishing touches on our North Korea episode, "The Last Americans" - to be submitted for film festival consideration in 2018.  You can watch the sneak peek here:

 
We appreciate any donation you can make and we want to reward you with some really neat original perks, including:

Your name in the credits(!)
A chance to meet and talk with Ali via Skype or Google Hangouts
A digital download of a special behind-the-scenes episode of "The Backpacking Doc"
A chance to be a part of the post-production process as an episode is being finished
And many more chances to be a part of this production!

 
THE TIME IS NOW!
I’ve put my life on the line to capture many of these stories in some of the most dangerous places on earth.  Now, we need your help to bring this series to fruition.  And every little bit counts!
I'm lucky to be working with such a talented and thoughtful production team, and with over 25 years of combined broadcast television production experience, ranging from writing & producing to shooting & editing, you can be sure the series will make an impact.
Mahatma Gandhi once said, "Be the change that you wish to see in the world."  I'm living my part.  Now, you can be a part of this change, too.  Show your support by backing this project.  Help me to open the hearts and minds of people around the world and share what truly unifies us in this human experience – life. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't make a donation, that doesn't mean you can't help.  Help us spread the word of this fundraiser using the Indiegogo and Facebook share tools.  Like, follow, and share my social media pages and join the conversation!
https://www.facebook.com/backpackingdoc/
@backpackingdoc

story:
Hello and thank you for visiting our campaign!

Mamas.TV is an online media company that serves two purposes: to create an incredible information hub and community for mamas, and to create a sustainable funding source for the charity Mamas for Mamas. 

Somehow there has become a stigma surrounding issues with parenting. Although not everyone talks about the struggles they face while raising children, every single mama faces a challenge. At Mamas.TV, we are dedicated to becoming the “Voice of the Village.” We will broadcast videos that show the real side of parenting, not just the fantasy parenting seen on television and online. Mamas.TV is a platform that will allow mamas to connect in a supportive community that is not only diverse but is welcoming of every single person. We are dedicated to making sure every mama’s voice is heard.

Nobody has a manual when it comes to parenting and at Mamas.TV, we want to learn from one another as the road of motherhood is navigated. So, sit back and relax as you will find hours of entertainment and dive in to some of our helpful parenting hacks. We will address the struggles of being a Mama and will keep you up to date with all the hottest topics. Our number one goal is to be dedicated to Mamas around the world. We are your voice.

In addition to covering production costs, 50% of our net profits will go to furthering the work of Mamas for Mamas. A non-profit organization that is working tirelessly to change the landscape of poverty for families and address the systemic issues that keep them there. Mamas for Mamas is impacting change around the world and helping families who are silently suffering.

By contributing to our campaign you will be helping us with our start-up costs and enabling us to launch this community for parents to go to for support and helping Mamas for Mamas...join us on the journey because this is a movement not a moment!

We are asking for $60,400 which will go towards: 

Equipment

Filming and editing Mamas.TV to this point has been done on borrowed equipment along with minimal purchased equipment. To continue to make Mamas.TV a reality we need more equipment to bring you the amazing content we have been working so hard on for the past year! We want to increase our production abilities to include more on location filming and we are adding a podcast to our channels - we need some updated equipment to make this a reality.

The Crew

For the past year our amazing crew has been putting in many many hours filming and creating content - all while working their day jobs! You got that right! We have been working other jobs and trying to bring this show to life during the evenings and weekend. We want to be able to support our crew financially which will eventually lead into full-time work. We will continue to introduce our team members throughout the campaign so you can see who we are and why we care so much about this community!

Marketing & Broadcasting

Like any other company we need to market Mamas.TV in order to get the word out that this community exists. We will use social media, radio ads, online ads, editorial and other means to raise awareness. The more people we can reach, the bigger and better this community will be.

To contribute to our campaign we came up with some amazing perks available: virtual hugs (who doesn't love those!), social media shout-outs, on-set visits, co-hosting, t-shirts, podcast hosting, mala bracelets, being a star, along with promotional opportunities on both our website and individual episodes. We will also being doing a couple giveaways and auctions throughout our campaign that might excite you some more!

We would also love your feedback. If you have an idea for a perk let us know! We want to make our backers feel special and like they are part of this movement.

If you can’t contribute financially, that’s ok! Please go to our website at mamas.tv and subscribe! Also, tell your friends - use any of our share buttons and let your community know. Thank you for your support as we forge the way!

Mamas.TV…it begins with you!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Heather Milam the creator and co-writer of "She's Just Making it Up." This new pilot (series) is especially dear to my heart. It is a mix of fact and fiction from a particularly painful season in life. You know, that moment when the BIG QUESTION of "What on earth am I doing with my life?" knocks you off your feet.  Some choose to ignore the question and suppress it. But some, like our heroine Addie, choose to act. That choice to act can be risky, vulnerable and at times even tragic. Yet despite the many failures and mistakes along the way opportunities always emerge allowing us to become stronger and braver individuals.

Help support our vision and make this show a cinematic reality.

THE TEAM

Andie Botrell - WRITER/CO-CREATOR and overall gift of a talent. As cliche as it sounds, Andie is a true Artist. She is always, and I mean ALWAYS creating. Plays, books, short poems, paintings, musical compositions, screen plays, tv pilots. Seriously this woman never stops. And even amidst all that creation she maintains the ability to be an overall gem of a human being. If you don't know her stuff already... you should. Check out her web series Seek Help now https://vimeo.com/212271607.

T.C. De Witt - DIRECTOR and film guru.  T.C., like Andie, is the truest of true in the artistic sense. An actual cartoon artist, visual artist, actor, director, writer, is there anything this man can't do? T.C. has a generosity about him that is infectious. He knows how to run a set (drama free), and is one of the most genuine human beings I know. 

Abbey Cayanan - PRODUCER and foodie at heart! This woman is dynamic and I was lucky enough to snag her as a co-producer. Her film credits to date have been primarily within the corporate realm, but recently she rocked the creative arts world with her editorial debut. She can do it all from design, to casting, to editing and beyond.  She just gets it done! There have also been rumors about her writing a female driven war/combat story... so let's hope that happens soon. It's a fresh perspective we have yet to see on the big screen.

Nicole Buckenmeyer - PRODUCER/CO-WRITER and a woman who just makes my heart happy. Nicole's whit astounds me and having her around makes life that much more humorous. She is a dynamic actress, writer, and puppy lover extraordinaire. She is committed to the core and has been a massive encouragement in getting this production moving and on it's feet. I'd keep an eye on this one.  She's going places!

What We Need & What You Get

Filming in LA ain't cheap - especially if you choose to do a SAG project. So, all support will go to the following.

$3000 – Insurance (Liability & Workers Comp) & Permits

$1250 – Food for Cast & Crew

               Breakfast/lunch/dinner for 5-day shoot

               10-30 people on set per day

$2000 – Locations & Additional Equipment

               Locations include: College campus, coffee shop, bar, etc... 

               Additional lighting/sound/camera equipment that isn’t already donated

$2000 – Editing/Color Correction

               This is a must have – as we want to complete the project and have it

               looking as professional as possible

$1750 – Misc. Expenses

   Costumes, parking, gas, travel (for some crew/cast), and much much more.

Note:  any extra or remaining funds raised will go directly to pay Crew and Cast members (at this point everyone will be working for free). No person will be profiting from this fundraising campaign in any way.

 

The Impact

Our hope is to represent a variety of voices throughout this series and that begins with this pilot episode. We live in a world that demands we see everything in black and white whether it be religion, race, or politics. But life is more complex, more intricate than that. Recognizing the gray can often bring us to a place of empathy and compassion. This is Addie's journey and a story we feel has a place on the big screen.

Risks & Challenges

If you know me, you know I HATE asking for money. It dates as far back as grade school fundraisers.  However, I am giving it my best go and looping it in with the ever popular "Birthday Month". Strangely I feel no guilt about people gifting me things during my birthday month. So please, instead of buying me a drink for my birthday (assuming in fact you would do that), think about donating $10 or $15 to this project. It's a much better investment. Believe me!!

Other Ways You Can Help

1.  Share our campaign posts and links with friends and family - especially if you know of any fine folks that like contributing to the arts.  We want to create as much buzz about this project as we can, so your help in spreading the word is essential.

2. If you know a production company that currently has liability/workman's comp insurance...  and would want to take on our little project,  it would save ALOT in costs. Here's to hoping :)

3. Location Connections: If you have a space (or know someone connected to a space) that we could film for little to no cost, that would help us immensely.  Here are some locations we need: College campus, gymnasium/dance studio, coffee shop, bar/club, classroom/theater, corporate office (ideally with cubicles), and a 1 bedroom apartment.
