story:
Teaser Trailer
 
Poster designed by Michael Wiley.

 

Earth-Link Origins is an animated sci-fi web series that tells a huge story featuring an ensemble cast. If you were to cross Star Trek and Star Wars with aspects of Dragon Ball Z and the classic video games Colony Wars and Wing Commander, you would get Earth-Link Origins -- a series set in a huge universe with unforgettable characters, rich lore, and an ambitious story about friendship, conspiracy, betrayal, romance, heartbreak, and the power of faith.

 

The series is set 2,000 years into the future and tells the story about two warring factions, the benevolent Earth Empire and the vicious Morningstar Pirates, and how their conflict ultimately leads to an event that changes the face of the entire galaxy. The overall story will be told from both sides of the war: on the side of the Earth Empire, we chronicle the adventures of several characters including Commander Zero, Lieutenant Commander Rose, Lieutenants Aiden and Meatbag, and pilot Colonel Catscratch, and how these five characters come together to overcome incredible odds; on the side of the Morningstar Pirates, we get an up-close-and-personal view of their leader, Jupiter the Unstoppable, his friend Ganymede the Ambitious, and his new ally, the mysterious Endymion, and how they plan to overthrow and destroy the Earth Empire -- and their reasons for doing so.

 

 

Earth-Link Origins was originally conceived back in 2009 by Chris Kroznuski and Chris Cameron. After almost 10 years of fine-tuning the story, ideas, and visual style, Kroznuski is producing and directing a 20 minute pilot episode to "light the fuse" for production of the full series. We are looking to IndieGoGo donors, fans of indie sci-fi, fans of indie animation, and of course, anyone else who just wants to see this project succeed, to raise a minimum goal of about $4,500 to help us see this project through with the best quality we can manage -- and purchase gear that we can use for the rest of the series run!

As mentioned before, our Prologue is set to only be 20 minutes long; however, depending on whether we meet certain stretch goals (see below), we may be able to fund one or even several 60-to-75-minute Episodes/Acts. As the Prologue is finished, our next goal will be to finish Act I, which will pick up immediately after the Prologue is finished (Act I combines the Prologue plus the next 40 minutes we plan to create).

 

We are a small production team consisting of both new and veteran talent in regards to both actors and artists; many of our cast and crew hail from science fiction fan and indie productions.

Our cast of actors includes:

  • Tim Torre (Star Wars: Revan, EOS 10) - Commander Zero
  • Ashley M. Kalfas (Star Trek: The Romulan War, The Lone Ranger) - Lieutenant Commander Rose
  • Chris Beckman (The Sandwich) - Lieutenant Aiden
  • Clint Bracey (Star Trek: Red Squad) - Lieutenant Meatbag
  • Brandon Rainsford (Naruto: The Abridged Series, Go Go Parody Rangers) - Colonel Catscratch
  • Tom Gore (Knob Goblins, Doctor Who: The Ginger Chronicles) - Admiral Maverick
  • Grant Patrizio (Party of Sin, Smackdown) - Councilor Dascar
  • Robert S. Benjamin (Wing Commander Saga, Final Melody) - Jupiter The Unstoppable
  • Greg Arnold (War Tech Fighters, A Desperate Mother's Love) - Endymion
  • Alex LaFreniere (Cat on a Hot Tin Roof, No Exit) - Ganymede The Ambitious
  • Keaira Kusanagi (Renegades) - Kore The Swift
  • Cassidy Rose Munley (Oliver!, Shrek: The Musical) - Miranda The Elusive

Our creative team includes:

  • Sean Tourangeau (Axanar, Star Trek: Titan) - Concept Artist and Designer
  • Tristan Cameron - Concept Artist and Designer
  • Gabriel Koerner (The Orville, Firefly, Battlestar Galactica) - Visual Effects Artist
  • Michael Wiley (Star Trek: Ships of the Line) - Visual Effects Artist
  • Hayden Aeries (Stage 9) - Visual Effects Artist
  • David Metlesits - Visual Effects Artist
  • Ali Ries (BSG: Blood and Chrome, Renegades) - Visual Effects Artist
  • Matt Haslam - Audio Engineer
  • Julia Saltflower - Additional Music
  • Aram Zero - Additional Music
  • Olivia Szlasa - Writer
  • Chris Cameron - Executive Producer
  • Chris Kroznuski (Project Potemkin, Starship Deimos) - Director, Producer, Writer, Visual Effects Artist, Composer

 

$4,500 is our absolute, bare-bones minimum goal, however we do have several stretch goals in the event that this campaign becomes popular enough:

Yes, you read that top one correctly -- in the event that we make anything past our 6th and Ultimate Stretch Goal over the first 30 days of this campaign, we will automatically donate all excess donations to three different charities (see below), in addition to what we already promise to donate. For example, if we make $35,000 in this campaign, we will donate 10% of the $30,000 we make on this campaign PLUS an additional $5,000 to our selected charities.

You may be asking, why are our stretch goals set up this way? The answer is because in producing the Prologue, more than half of the digital assets needed for the entire series have been produced. However, we still need to pay for our artists, our actors, our musicians, and all mediums of promotion throughout the rest of the series run.

As we stated before, our absolute, bare-bones minimum goal is $4,500 USD. This money will help us purchase motion capture systems including the Perception Neuron Full-Body MoCap Suite (approx. $1,500 USD) and the Faceware Facial MoCap Plugin for Reallusion iClone (approx. $1300 USD). That's $2,800 USD total for both hardware and software.

We know what you're thinking: why set a minimum goal of $4,500 if you only need $2,800? There are several reasons for this:

  • IndieGoGo campaigns -- and by extension other crowdfunding sites-- usually take out about 10% of all sum total donations -- this includes a 5% fee that goes directly to IndieGoGo, where the other 5% involves per-transaction processing, international money conversion, and, depending on your currency and location, additional wire fees. This is extrapolated as per IndieGoGo's Pricing and Fees Page.
  • Most crowdfunding campaigns have a dropout rate of approximately 10% -- in other words, about 10% of people that contribute either drop out or lower their donation amount.
  • Another 10% will go towards perk fulfillment, including shipping and handling of physical perks and processing of digital perks.
  • Finally, in running this crowdfunding campaign, we want to help others as well; to this end, 10% of what we make off of this campaign will be split between and donated to three different charities: Have a Gay Day, Doctors Without Borders, and a small fundraiser for a local friend who lost his home back in December. Help us, help them!

In donating to us, you will be giving us the opportunity to create a sci-fi series of epic proportions, filled with dazzling visuals, a huge story, and a universe with the potential to expand far beyond its limits. Also, you'll get a little something from us in exchange for your donation!

 

Here is a list of perks we have to offer for this campaign. Some are physical, some are digital, but they all have one thing in common: whatever you donate, you will get something in return, and we don't just mean our eternal gratitude. Have a look!

In the event that we manage to make ANY of our Stretch Goals, these perks will be modified and upgraded accordingly; for example, if we make Stretch Goal #1, all donors who donate at the LIEUTENANT Level will AUTOMATICALLY receive a digital download of the Prologue, Act I, and both the Prologue AND the Act I Original Score!

All physical perks in this campaign will be shipped out within one month of release of the Prologue.

If you are an investor and want to donate more than what is listed on our perk chart, please don't hesitate to reach out to us directly!

 

Three things:

  • Any money we receive will be saved and go towards purchasing the gear in the future, and we will still donate 10% of whatever we make to the three charities mentioned above.
  • All donors who donated will still receive their perks, though it may take some extra time to ship them out.
  • Finally, we will do everything in our power to still release the Prologue as per our original release date of June.

 

Earth-Link Origins promises to be a series that pushes forward with leaps and bounds in its visual style, storytelling, and characters by blurring the lines between science fiction and science fantasy, creating huge, powerful, overarching story arcs, and using beautifully rendered CGI to tell its story. By helping us invest in Earth-Link Origins, you will be helping us nurture a sci-fi/sci-fantasy universe that is set to continue for years to come. Have we mentioned that we've been working on this project for almost a decade?

 

We are fully aware that by accepting your pledges, we are accepting a responsibility to our investors -- a responsibility to you. And thanks to the talents behind this project, we are set to deliver a quality product your way. That being said, in the event of unexpected delays, we will gladly notify you -- our investors -- in regards to what will be happening behind the scenes. In the face of unexpected obstacles, our team has risen to the challenge again and again -- and we can count on their endurance to continue doing so, so that we can deliver you the best film we can.

 

  • Tell people about what we're doing. Tell your friends. Tell your friends' friends. Tell your cousin's sister's daughter. Tell all the sci-fi fans you know.
  • Spread the word about us through e-mail and social media. We are on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and have our own blog updated periodically on our website.
  • If you know of a website or news outlet that would want to hear our story, please don't hesitate to put us in touch with them! The more people that know about what we're setting out to do, the better!

 

Thank you for your time. Thank you for your support. Thank you for your donations, whatever size they may be. Thank you for spreading the word about us.

And above all else, thank you for your interest in Earth-Link Origins!
story_txt:
Teaser Trailer

 
Poster designed by Michael Wiley.

 

Earth-Link Origins is an animated sci-fi web series that tells a huge story featuring an ensemble cast. If you were to cross Star Trek and Star Wars with aspects of Dragon Ball Z and the classic video games Colony Wars and Wing Commander, you would get Earth-Link Origins -- a series set in a huge universe with unforgettable characters, rich lore, and an ambitious story about friendship, conspiracy, betrayal, romance, heartbreak, and the power of faith.
 

The series is set 2,000 years into the future and tells the story about two warring factions, the benevolent Earth Empire and the vicious Morningstar Pirates, and how their conflict ultimately leads to an event that changes the face of the entire galaxy. The overall story will be told from both sides of the war: on the side of the Earth Empire, we chronicle the adventures of several characters including Commander Zero, Lieutenant Commander Rose, Lieutenants Aiden and Meatbag, and pilot Colonel Catscratch, and how these five characters come together to overcome incredible odds; on the side of the Morningstar Pirates, we get an up-close-and-personal view of their leader, Jupiter the Unstoppable, his friend Ganymede the Ambitious, and his new ally, the mysterious Endymion, and how they plan to overthrow and destroy the Earth Empire -- and their reasons for doing so.
 









 

Earth-Link Origins was originally conceived back in 2009 by Chris Kroznuski and Chris Cameron. After almost 10 years of fine-tuning the story, ideas, and visual style, Kroznuski is producing and directing a 20 minute pilot episode to "light the fuse" for production of the full series. We are looking to IndieGoGo donors, fans of indie sci-fi, fans of indie animation, and of course, anyone else who just wants to see this project succeed, to raise a minimum goal of about $4,500 to help us see this project through with the best quality we can manage -- and purchase gear that we can use for the rest of the series run!
As mentioned before, our Prologue is set to only be 20 minutes long; however, depending on whether we meet certain stretch goals (see below), we may be able to fund one or even several 60-to-75-minute Episodes/Acts. As the Prologue is finished, our next goal will be to finish Act I, which will pick up immediately after the Prologue is finished (Act I combines the Prologue plus the next 40 minutes we plan to create).
 

We are a small production team consisting of both new and veteran talent in regards to both actors and artists; many of our cast and crew hail from science fiction fan and indie productions.
Our cast of actors includes:




Tim Torre (Star Wars: Revan, EOS 10) - Commander Zero

Ashley M. Kalfas (Star Trek: The Romulan War, The Lone Ranger) - Lieutenant Commander Rose

Chris Beckman (The Sandwich) - Lieutenant Aiden

Clint Bracey (Star Trek: Red Squad) - Lieutenant Meatbag

Brandon Rainsford (Naruto: The Abridged Series, Go Go Parody Rangers) - Colonel Catscratch

Tom Gore (Knob Goblins, Doctor Who: The Ginger Chronicles) - Admiral Maverick

Grant Patrizio (Party of Sin, Smackdown) - Councilor Dascar

Robert S. Benjamin (Wing Commander Saga, Final Melody) - Jupiter The Unstoppable

Greg Arnold (War Tech Fighters, A Desperate Mother's Love) - Endymion

Alex LaFreniere (Cat on a Hot Tin Roof, No Exit) - Ganymede The Ambitious

Keaira Kusanagi (Renegades) - Kore The Swift

Cassidy Rose Munley (Oliver!, Shrek: The Musical) - Miranda The Elusive

Our creative team includes:


Sean Tourangeau (Axanar, Star Trek: Titan) - Concept Artist and Designer

Tristan Cameron - Concept Artist and Designer

Gabriel Koerner (The Orville, Firefly, Battlestar Galactica) - Visual Effects Artist

Michael Wiley (Star Trek: Ships of the Line) - Visual Effects Artist

Hayden Aeries (Stage 9) - Visual Effects Artist

David Metlesits - Visual Effects Artist

Ali Ries (BSG: Blood and Chrome, Renegades) - Visual Effects Artist

Matt Haslam - Audio Engineer

Julia Saltflower - Additional Music

Aram Zero - Additional Music

Olivia Szlasa - Writer

Chris Cameron - Executive Producer

Chris Kroznuski (Project Potemkin, Starship Deimos) - Director, Producer, Writer, Visual Effects Artist, Composer

 

$4,500 is our absolute, bare-bones minimum goal, however we do have several stretch goals in the event that this campaign becomes popular enough:

Yes, you read that top one correctly -- in the event that we make anything past our 6th and Ultimate Stretch Goal over the first 30 days of this campaign, we will automatically donate all excess donations to three different charities (see below), in addition to what we already promise to donate. For example, if we make $35,000 in this campaign, we will donate 10% of the $30,000 we make on this campaign PLUS an additional $5,000 to our selected charities.
You may be asking, why are our stretch goals set up this way? The answer is because in producing the Prologue, more than half of the digital assets needed for the entire series have been produced. However, we still need to pay for our artists, our actors, our musicians, and all mediums of promotion throughout the rest of the series run.


As we stated before, our absolute, bare-bones minimum goal is $4,500 USD. This money will help us purchase motion capture systems including the Perception Neuron Full-Body MoCap Suite (approx. $1,500 USD) and the Faceware Facial MoCap Plugin for Reallusion iClone (approx. $1300 USD). That's $2,800 USD total for both hardware and software.
We know what you're thinking: why set a minimum goal of $4,500 if you only need $2,800? There are several reasons for this:


IndieGoGo campaigns -- and by extension other crowdfunding sites-- usually take out about 10% of all sum total donations -- this includes a 5% fee that goes directly to IndieGoGo, where the other 5% involves per-transaction processing, international money conversion, and, depending on your currency and location, additional wire fees. This is extrapolated as per IndieGoGo's Pricing and Fees Page.


Most crowdfunding campaigns have a dropout rate of approximately 10% -- in other words, about 10% of people that contribute either drop out or lower their donation amount.

Another 10% will go towards perk fulfillment, including shipping and handling of physical perks and processing of digital perks.

Finally, in running this crowdfunding campaign, we want to help others as well; to this end, 10% of what we make off of this campaign will be split between and donated to three different charities: Have a Gay Day, Doctors Without Borders, and a small fundraiser for a local friend who lost his home back in December. Help us, help them!


In donating to us, you will be giving us the opportunity to create a sci-fi series of epic proportions, filled with dazzling visuals, a huge story, and a universe with the potential to expand far beyond its limits. Also, you'll get a little something from us in exchange for your donation!
 

Here is a list of perks we have to offer for this campaign. Some are physical, some are digital, but they all have one thing in common: whatever you donate, you will get something in return, and we don't just mean our eternal gratitude. Have a look!

In the event that we manage to make ANY of our Stretch Goals, these perks will be modified and upgraded accordingly; for example, if we make Stretch Goal #1, all donors who donate at the LIEUTENANT Level will AUTOMATICALLY receive a digital download of the Prologue, Act I, and both the Prologue AND the Act I Original Score!
All physical perks in this campaign will be shipped out within one month of release of the Prologue.
If you are an investor and want to donate more than what is listed on our perk chart, please don't hesitate to reach out to us directly!
 

Three things:

Any money we receive will be saved and go towards purchasing the gear in the future, and we will still donate 10% of whatever we make to the three charities mentioned above.

All donors who donated will still receive their perks, though it may take some extra time to ship them out.
Finally, we will do everything in our power to still release the Prologue as per our original release date of June.



 

Earth-Link Origins promises to be a series that pushes forward with leaps and bounds in its visual style, storytelling, and characters by blurring the lines between science fiction and science fantasy, creating huge, powerful, overarching story arcs, and using beautifully rendered CGI to tell its story. By helping us invest in Earth-Link Origins, you will be helping us nurture a sci-fi/sci-fantasy universe that is set to continue for years to come. Have we mentioned that we've been working on this project for almost a decade?

 

We are fully aware that by accepting your pledges, we are accepting a responsibility to our investors -- a responsibility to you. And thanks to the talents behind this project, we are set to deliver a quality product your way. That being said, in the event of unexpected delays, we will gladly notify you -- our investors -- in regards to what will be happening behind the scenes. In the face of unexpected obstacles, our team has risen to the challenge again and again -- and we can count on their endurance to continue doing so, so that we can deliver you the best film we can.

 



Tell people about what we're doing. Tell your friends. Tell your friends' friends. Tell your cousin's sister's daughter. Tell all the sci-fi fans you know.

Spread the word about us through e-mail and social media. We are on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and have our own blog updated periodically on our website.

If you know of a website or news outlet that would want to hear our story, please don't hesitate to put us in touch with them! The more people that know about what we're setting out to do, the better!


 Thank you for your time. Thank you for your support. Thank you for your donations, whatever size they may be. Thank you for spreading the word about us.And above all else, thank you for your interest in Earth-Link Origins!

story:
Overview

Welcome to the “reading” portion of the Slightly Damaged Indie Go Go.  Clearly, the video wasn’t good enough for you. Honestly, I feel like you’re becoming a bit high maintenance.  

Slightly Damaged a half hour single-camera dark comedy show about people who procure used items and sell them online. Episodes centre around the four main characters Dani (Rebecca Applebaum), Steve (Brennan Martin), Noah (Ryan Ali) and Claire (Caitlin Robson) finding strange items. Comedy ensues.  

What we would like to do is shoot the pilot episode of this series as a proof of concept to pitch further to networks.

Why are we doing this?  

Which one of these questions are you more likely to answer “yes” to?   

A:  Hey! Do you want to watch a TV show???

-or-

B:  Hey! Do you want to read my 24 page TV pilot script???

If you answered B, congrats! You’re a very abnormal person.  Unlike you, most people don’t like reading scripts. Having audio/visual proof that the show is funny is a major selling point to networks.

The diverse cast and crew of Slightly Damaged are all multi-faceted content creators having self-started a number of projects independent of mainstream support.  The cast and crew are equally represented between genders and are made up of a diverse set of ethnic backgrounds properly showing Toronto’s multiculturalism.

The Pilot

In our pilot episode, Steve buys a stack of unclaimed travel luggage at an auction.  Within one of the bags, he finds the burial urn of an unknown person. Dani finds a bottle of “Vitamin D Pills” which turn out not to be Vitamin D.   Noah finds a woman’s camera and becomes smitten with her pictures. Claire finds nothing because she’s introduced in the second episode.

We would describe the pilot in more detail but it's really annoying when people do that (Am I right?).  On the other hand, if you want to read the pilot script ahead of time, it’s one of the perks for donating. Just sayin’.  

Our Budget

If reading wasn’t boring enough, let us present to you a pie chart:

Note:  All gag items on this pie chart (totaling 7%) actually go towards food for cast and crew.  

Because actors and crew members are unable to eat TV credits for dinner, the majority of the prospective budget is allocated to paying people. 

If we don’t reach our entire goal....  That’s a tough one. People will most likely have to volunteer their time.  It’s doable but not ideal.

If we were to get more money than our goal, extra money will not go to Nick Dolinski cocaine parties (We promise).  It will mainly go to paying cast and crew better and obtaining better quality equipment.  

Other ways you can help

If you don’t have the budget to donate to Slightly Damaged, you can still help out in the following ways:

  1. Become a television network executive and "green light" Slightly Damaged.
  2. Donate your RED or Arri cinema camera to our production.  It’s just collecting dust anyway.
  3. Bake cookies and deliver them to set for the cast and crew warm out of the oven.  Brennan Martin is vegan but he doesn’t have to eat any.
  4. Have “Slightly Damaged” tattooed on your face.  After all, it’s probably true.
  5. Judgementally slip “Have you donated to the Slightly Damaged Indie Go Go?” into every conversation you have.  
  6. Let us build a set in your garage.
  7. Share this campaign on your social media and spread the word.    

Final word... 

If you enjoyed this Indie Go Go page, we strongly encourage you to donate to the Slightly Damaged pilot.  Imagine how much you'll enjoy us when we're not asking you for money!

story:
hot. strong. unfiltered. like a g̶o̶o̶d̶ decent cuppa coffee!

 

 

A little over a year ago, writer/creator Ellis stumbled back upon a collection of bright, upbeat blog posts she'd written during a contrastingly numb, depressive semester abroad. Healing from heartbreak and addressing mental illness had, at the time, felt incredibly isolating and lonely. But since opening up and in return hearing similar stories from truly resilient, sincere individuals, she realized the universality, optimism, and - what a concept! - comedy in the universal experience. Being a human is hard as hell, and hiding that reality on Instagram (or LinkedIn, or Tinder, or KinkedIn, a patent-pending hybrid devised by Yael, a character inThe Only Coffee Shop's characters) is even frickin' harder.

Ellis then wrote a thesis on millennial cynicism as a coping mechanism, along with exploring television format and style in theatre and vise versa, and now considers herself totally equipped to create contemporary meta-dramedic (drama + comedy) satire. Or at the least, she'll critique, defend, and analyze modern audiences and this generation until it's overtaken by the next one. 

We produced this piece originally as a stage play in December 2018. Rehearsals oscillated between improv comedy and emotional sharing sessions. Reception from the public was encouraging and affirmative. Many folks said something along the lines of: "I wish this were a Netflix show, so I could watch it whenever I need it."  

So that's what we're doing! Giving the people what they want and need. Love and laughter with this initially zero-budget limited series: high in caffeine, low in self-esteem, and ultimately maturing, empowering, and surreally real.

The Only Coffee Shop in the City is also making its NYC premiere October 2019 at the Hudson Guild Theatre as part of NY Theatre Fest. 

(below: the original cast and crew of The Only Coffee Shop stage play)

(above: the original cast and crew of The Only Coffee Shop stage play)

collaborative team of pals

Here in our imaginative little metaphorical coffee shop, we see the potential in working together towards this common vision. We think it's honestly rare to find someone who cares about and/or is good at only one single thing, and artists and creators especially love experimenting with mediums and roles.

So this is kinda an all hands on deck operation! Everyone offers a range of skills and thoughts across the board.

**Stage Production Team** 

Bios and headshots, and cast, will be included soon.

Director & Producer: Ellis Stump

Assistant Directors: Tyquan Stevens & Lauren Spinabelli

Stage Manager: Taiwo Aloba

Public Relations: Emily Hulbert

Set Design: Ryan McCloy

Music Director: Nick Karafellis 

 

**Web Series Team** 

We all act in the series, and also help with filming here, directing there, whipping up snacks on set, discussing the critical dramaturgy, contributing to wardrobe, selecting original soundtrack songs by our musical friends, etc. We all go to Penn State, are involved with theatre, film, and media extracurriculars on campus, and genuinely like each other. 

Ellis Stump is an award-winning writer, performer, director, and producer of dramedic, feminist, activist stories for stage and screen. She graduated this May from Schreyer Honors College with majors in English and Media Studies (Film), minors in Gender Studies, Psychology, and Theatre, and two fellowships including the inaugural Donald P. Bellisario's. She is currently a full-time screenwriter at Inkitt Galatea, headquartered in Berlin (one of three cities she studied abroad), freelancing, and preparing to attend Pace University in NYC for her Dramatic Writing MFA this fall. Additionally, Ellis dabbles in affordable solo world travel and quirky, self-deprecating visual art.

insta: @ellis_liketheisland // twitter: @_liketheisland 

production roles: Co-Producer, Director 

Rachel Rosinger is by no means a cinematographer,  but she’s very excited to take on the challenge of trying out a new role in production. She is a caffeine addict who is currently finishing up her senior year as a film major hoping to pursue a career in screenwriting/directing and acting. Rachel could not be more excited to reprise her role as Rowan and to help bring this wonderful piece of theatre to the screen. 

production roles: Co-Producer, Director of Photography  

Hannah Kelly  is an Art History major. She is primarily a Weird Horse Girl™️ but dabbles in theatre from time to time.

production roles: Assistant Producer, Assistant Director 

Emily Hulbert is extremely excited to be working on Coffee Shop both acting in the production and behind the scenes. She is a rising senior majoring in Communications who hopes to continue acting after college.

production roles: Assistant Producer, Public Relations 

Elijah Armstrong  is an Education and Public Policy major graduating and attending Harvard for his Masters this fall. He is a captain falcon player in Super Smash Bros Ultimate, and is eagerly anticipating the release of Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3 this July. Watch his TEDx Talk on "Conquering Discrimination and Inequality in Education."

 

what do THE PEOPLE say?

If you're into group think, then you're in luck. Invest in, or simply b̶i̶n̶g̶e̶ watch, The Only Coffee Shop in the City, and prepare to join the cool kids table.

Written reviews from various students, professors, audience members:

"A tome/poem to the writing gods, and I enjoyed every minute of it! These unique and extraordinary characters as they process their unique and extraordinary lives. This is tremendous work. Truly."

"I truly loved your play. I relate to it so much. I felt incredibly connected to the protagonist, be it in her awful cynical comments, her imagined scenes of conversations turning into jazz numbers, her dealings with grief, etc. I wish you could turn this into a movie so I could deliberately seek it out and watch it at my will when I need a good caricature of my life to reflect upon. God bless your artistry, seriously."

"How beautiful and empowering and emotionally rich your play is. It’s been a few days and I’m still thinking about it. It was incredibly well done, the cast was impeccable and you are so so talented!" ​

"I hope you'll keep me on your mailing list. I want to be there when you and your act go nationwide."

"Very, very well constructed and cleverly written. You all have done a nice job." ​

"Refreshingly honest conversations involving mental health, independence, relationships, and grieving in a society dominated by social media dominate. Realistic characters that portray the awkwardness experienced in everyday life. Even the side characters show depth and affect the plot in surprising ways." - Onward State article

annnnd here's where you come in, my dudes! ​

Making money is not the mission, as perhaps clear from most of our career aspirations. Sharing the themes and ~relatable content~ within this story is our primary wish. Also, we're nearly finished with production, proving we can create art without cash (we're quite thrifty b*tches). We just need your help to distribute it. 

Here's the legit breakdown of where your pennies may go: 

  • Food and water on set - nothing bougie, just basic sustenance 
  • Support to our generous locations - all local, very giving places that sincerely aid the Penn State and State College communities 
  • As aforementioned, promotion and dispersion - we'd love to submit to some festivals!

All that said, your generous contributions can make important art happen. After all, haven't you always dreamed of being a PRODUCER? No? Okay never mind then. 

bangin' perks!!

Go check out the PERKS, baby, among them: "a good morning dog pic of your favorite breed" or "a sketch of you" or "personalized Instagram shoutout" both by a "character of your choice," as well as the opportunity to play a background role in the show or have your name in the credits!

*** After donating, send your e-mail, phone number, or preferred contact info to THEellisstump@gmail.com so we can get you a frickin' puppy pic.***

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH for all your support, from the bottom of our hearts! 

Love,

The Only Coffee Shop team <3

Rachel Rosinger is by no means a cinematographer,  but she’s very excited to take on the challenge of trying out a new role in production. She is a caffeine addict who is currently finishing up her senior year as a film major hoping to pursue a career in screenwriting/directing and acting. Rachel could not be more excited to reprise her role as Rowan and to help bring this wonderful piece of theatre to the screen. 
production roles: Co-Producer, Director of Photography  
Hannah Kelly  is an Art History major. She is primarily a Weird Horse Girl™️ but dabbles in theatre from time to time.
production roles: Assistant Producer, Assistant Director 
Emily Hulbert is extremely excited to be working on Coffee Shop both acting in the production and behind the scenes. She is a rising senior majoring in Communications who hopes to continue acting after college.
production roles: Assistant Producer, Public Relations 
Elijah Armstrong  is an Education and Public Policy major graduating and attending Harvard for his Masters this fall. He is a captain falcon player in Super Smash Bros Ultimate, and is eagerly anticipating the release of Marvel Ultimate Alliance 3 this July. Watch his TEDx Talk on "Conquering Discrimination and Inequality in Education."
 
what do THE PEOPLE say?
If you're into group think, then you're in luck. Invest in, or simply b̶i̶n̶g̶e̶ watch, The Only Coffee Shop in the City, and prepare to join the cool kids table.
Written reviews from various students, professors, audience members:
"A tome/poem to the writing gods, and I enjoyed every minute of it! These unique and extraordinary characters as they process their unique and extraordinary lives. This is tremendous work. Truly."
"I truly loved your play. I relate to it so much. I felt incredibly connected to the protagonist, be it in her awful cynical comments, her imagined scenes of conversations turning into jazz numbers, her dealings with grief, etc. I wish you could turn this into a movie so I could deliberately seek it out and watch it at my will when I need a good caricature of my life to reflect upon. God bless your artistry, seriously."
"How beautiful and empowering and emotionally rich your play is. It’s been a few days and I’m still thinking about it. It was incredibly well done, the cast was impeccable and you are so so talented!" ​
"I hope you'll keep me on your mailing list. I want to be there when you and your act go nationwide."
"Very, very well constructed and cleverly written. You all have done a nice job." ​
"Refreshingly honest conversations involving mental health, independence, relationships, and grieving in a society dominated by social media dominate. Realistic characters that portray the awkwardness experienced in everyday life. Even the side characters show depth and affect the plot in surprising ways." - Onward State article




annnnd here's where you come in, my dudes! ​

Making money is not the mission, as perhaps clear from most of our career aspirations. Sharing the themes and ~relatable content~ within this story is our primary wish. Also, we're nearly finished with production, proving we can create art without cash (we're quite thrifty b*tches). We just need your help to distribute it. 
Here's the legit breakdown of where your pennies may go: 

Food and water on set - nothing bougie, just basic sustenance 
Support to our generous locations - all local, very giving places that sincerely aid the Penn State and State College communities 
As aforementioned, promotion and dispersion - we'd love to submit to some festivals!


All that said, your generous contributions can make important art happen. After all, haven't you always dreamed of being a PRODUCER? No? Okay never mind then. 


bangin' perks!!
Go check out the PERKS, baby, among them: "a good morning dog pic of your favorite breed" or "a sketch of you" or "personalized Instagram shoutout" both by a "character of your choice," as well as the opportunity to play a background role in the show or have your name in the credits!
*** After donating, send your e-mail, phone number, or preferred contact info to THEellisstump@gmail.com so we can get you a frickin' puppy pic.***
 
THANK YOU SO MUCH for all your support, from the bottom of our hearts! 
Love,
The Only Coffee Shop team <3

story:
Hi everyone! Thank you so much for stopping by and checking out the Indiegogo campaign for our first season of Between Friends!  We at Between Friends cannot thank you enough for your support and contributions to our project! 

 

A quick synopsis of our show: In life we are all looking for the same thing, mostly.  Love.  We all need it and we all want it.  We fear and hate it.  It’s love, not money, that truly makes the world go around.  It is also the root of all evil.  It is the pot of gold at the end of every rainbow. It doesn’t matter if you’re an attorney, doctor, actress, police officer, business woman or a bartender.  We all need the same thing, and it’s how we find it that creates the amazing story.  Our story. Sometimes our stories are right in front of us; sometimes they have to be fought for and uncovered; sometimes a tragedy helps us recognize what our own eyes are too afraid to see. Between Friends is a show about a well accomplished group of friends from LA that lead very different lives. The one thing that they have in common is their weekly dinner date. The weekly dinners become a comical therapy session for the women and their hit and miss love lives. Each woman has to learn how to deal with a life and death tragedy, being there for each other, and learning that love may have been right in front of them all along.

 

Please  follow along with us in this romantic dramedy and watch as a group of friends grow up, overcome adversity, and share the best and worst parts of their lives and friendship!  The story of who they were, who they are and who they will become together, in life and in love.

 

Helping us spread the word of our campaign is so important! Every social media shoutout helps, and you will have our eternal thanks!

story:
IT'S A HARD KNOCK, KNOCK LIFE

This is a comedy about the big drama of the funny business in the little city.

This 6 episode series tells the stories of Steve, Jack and Dennis...three comedians at various stages of their careers, as they try to navigate through the difficulties and the  pratfalls of the Regina comedy scene.

Seasoned actor Shawn Koch (Supernatural, Talent, Pysch) makes his directorial debut, leading a talented crop of actors that include Saskatchewan Independent Film Award winner Logan Vanghel, David Carnegie, Andrew Valdez, Josh Flemming, Jon Hill, Amy Manytka, Amber Goodwyn and Cam Chomyn.

Director of photography, Jason Rister, and sound man extraordinaire, David Roman are also on board.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise $25,000 with this campaign. This amount is a large portion of our budget. The funds will help us with:

  • Pre-Production (i.e. rehearsal/studio space, legal costs)
  • Production costs
    • Equipment rental - $3,000
    • Cast/Crew salary - $15,000
    • Digital storage - $2,000
    • Craft Services - $5,000
  • Post-Production costs (i.e. editing, sound, marketing)

Check out of all the great gifts you can receive with your contribution!

The Impact

We are incredibly excited to start shooting the series. Our sizzle reel was a lot of fun to put together and the team is chomping at the bit to film the whole 6 episodes. Your contributions will ensure that this project will be a success.

Risks & Challenges

Of course there are risks and challenges with any film project but the producers of It's A Hard Knock, Knock Life have assembled a team of hard working industry professionals who know how to get a creative project finished.

We have the will. We have the way. Now all we need is a little more money...

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with your family and friends! If you think this is something that they might be interested in please don't hesitate to pass it along.

Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter at @knockknockshow for all future updates.

Special Thanks

The producers would love to send some special thanks to a few businesses that have already helped immensely:

The Saskatchewan Filmpool

Play Creative

CJTR 91.3 fm

Gabbo's Nightclub

The Cure

story:
What We Need & What You Get!

We are currently looking for $11,000 for the full filming and post production of season two of SOUND BOOTH. This money will go towards:

  • Paying Actors and Crew
  • Equipment Rental
  • Location/insurance costs
  • Craft Services
  • Any extra funds will go towards future seasons and shows!

We understand that your dollar is valuable, so we've come up with some great perks for different tiers of donations!

TIER ONE: GROUPIE

Get access to our VIP SOUND BOOTH facebook page! Stay up to date with the project and be the first to know what's going on!

TIER TWO: ROADIE

Get the perks from tier one as well as a special SOUND BOOTH guitar pick. Also, a Rene Collin's CD! Rene is one of the actors and creators of this project who has a phenomenal musical talent; you're sure to love his music!

TIER THREE: FAN

Get the perks from tiers one and two as well as a SOUND BOOTH poster signed by the entire cast!

TIER FOUR: SUPER FAN

Get the perks from all lower tiers as well as early access to season one of SOUND BOOTH. Also, get a "Special Thanks" credit both on screen and on IMDB for season two!

TIER FIVE: BAND MEMBER

Get the perks from all lower tiers as well as early access to BOTH seasons of SOUND BOOTH. Also, get promoted from "Special Thanks" to co-producer!

TIER SIX: ROCKSTAR

Get the perks from all lower tiers as well as a signed, hard-copy blooper and extras reel. Also, get promoted from co-producer to producer!

TIER SEVEN: LEGEND

Get the perks from all lower tiers as well as an on-set experience. We will write a speaking role in for you in a future season of SOUND BOOTH or one of our other shows currently in development. Also, get promoted from producer to co-executive producer!

THANKS & MORE

Thank you so much for your contribution! Feel free to share our campaign on social media, and check out SOUND BOOTH on IMDB here!

story:
LAWLESS An Original Television Series and more...

From Executive Producer Ray Murphy Jr. "Another 48 Hours" "Harlem Nights" "Coming to America" featuring Tonea Stewart "Mississippi Burning" "A Time to Kill" "Girls Trip" and Kymani Marley "One Love" "Money Talks" "Shottas" comes this hard hitting episodic series entitles "LAWLESS". Betrayed by the very thing he was sworn to uphold a former officer turned operative delivers with blind vengeance a brand of justice that shakes the foundation of organized crime and all who would profit from it.

You ever believe in something so much that no matter what anyone else said you just knew it was the thing you needed to be doing? Ever believe it so much that you continued to fight for it no matter how hard it was to obtain? Have you ever lost sleep over it, sacrificed for it, and even in your failure continued to long for it and press towards it? If you can identify with any of those then you know exactly what this project is and what it is about. Its about HOPE. Through these stories told we hope to engage your humanity, bridge divides, and bring about an understanding through the drama and conflict each character experiences.

We are here to prove to ourselves and others that anything is possible when you believe in yourself ANYTHING!!! A message that needs to be heard!

We've been here before on this platform and though our purpose has not changed the vehicle to achieve it has. "LAWLESS " is an original television series which speaks to the various issues effecting us all and though it is expressed through the lives of fictional characters the underlying purpose is to fulfill a lifelong dream that is not just my own but the collective dreams of all who make this show what it is and will be, our cast our crew... and most importantly you our fans. 

Ever cheer for the underdog ever see a competitor just grateful to finish the race before them? This show is comprised of those who believed that what they had was all there was and though content there is nothing wrong with desiring more out of life.  We all have strived to experience the very best that life can yield and if given the opportunity wouldn't you seize it? This cast like so many before us have been told "that's a silly dream" or "c'mon isn't it a little late for that in your life" and don't we all love this one "so your going to be a star huh... yea right". The fact of the matter is no dream that burns within is silly , its never to late in life to pursue your passion, and each and everyone of us is a star in our own right because we are all different and still yet the same. 

We need your help to prove it not just to the world but to all those who would look to us for an example.  Can we count on you? 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise 15,000.00

  • "LAWLESS" is a dark detective drama think "The Blacklist" meets "The Equalizer" and a bit of "Leverage" thrown in for seasoning and as such the show is action intense. All funds raised will be used to provide the production value needed to make the show what it needs to be successful.
  • Props, special effects, makeup, wardrobe multiple camera shooting, editing and post production are just an example of some of the costs we'll incur and don't want to deliver a show that disappoints. 
  • Take a look at our perks from special mentions on our social media to iMDb credits on the show itself. Join us in making LAWLESS the very best it can.

The Impact

Film and entertainment as it were has left Florida for the most part. Many people worked on projects like "Miami Vice" "Burn Notice" "Ballers" 2 of these shows had a great run provided many with their big break but now the industry has left due to the lack of incentives but there still remains those among us who would like to explore opportunities and we believe we should create our own. There are students in our local schools taking drama, tv production, graphic arts design, computer graphics once they have graduated what then? This show could be the beginning of many more opportunities to come and it starts with you and this campaign. There is an old saying "its always impossible until someone does it" and with your help and support WE CAN DO IT!!! How would it feel to know you're responsible for launching someone's career? That my friend is impact and that is priceless.  

Risks & Challenges

Indiegogo says we should speak about our risks and challenges, they say people value transparency...okay our greatest risk is doubt and lack of support as you can see we've tried this platform before. There are many great projects on this platform but this one is ours it is woven into our community and is a part of each of us but we want to make a that is built by and belongs to our fans and our supporters.

Our challenge is being heard above the din of skepticism and beyond the cloud of doubt. Ours is a promise to bring you a show that both entertains but speaks to the human condition. We also want to create opportunity for others both in front of and behind the camera and ultimately bring the industry of film and entertainment to our city. Can we reach enough supporters? How will we get others to hear our voice? The only way to overcome it is with your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign to get the word out and help don't forget to follow us on social media Instagram, Facebook, Twitter and if you'd like updates and behind the scenes subscribe to our YouTube channel many thanks.

  • Black Triad Entertainment Group
  • Instagram.com/blacktriadentertainment
  • facebook.com/blacktriadent
  • twitter.com@blacktriadent1

story:
My name is Chiffon Valentine, an independent producer that lives and works in Los Angeles, but, I am a proud native of Virginia. So proud that I am taking my first venture into scripted television back home this summer to shoot a pilot under my independent company, Naturally Red Productions LLC. A major component to a town’s culture is the art that is reflected within it and local artists have always enriched their communities as their art reflects that area’s history and roots. So to be able to spotlight these unique facets of American creativity is a task worth undertaking and supporting. Independent art forms are constantly on the rise and often times without a big Hollywood studio behind it, the artists have the ability to contain the creative control. On the flip side, the financial backing is never on the same scale. For independent producers, we count on the generosity of local businesses, family/friends and sometimes even strangers to help tell our stories. That is why we are coming to you. Partnering with our vision would provide prestige in the independent and potential television programming world, as well as a helping those outside of the "hollywood" bubble get their chance to shine! 

 

A little about the show: “Cliques,” is an hour-long series that follows the lives of 5 high school students from different social, economical, and racial backgrounds as they navigate the world of adolescence learning to balance class, relationships, puberty and all of the drama that entails.

story:
Short Summary

Beer Academy is a travel TV show created by film and media students in Charleston, South Carolina. The entirety of the film crew comes from Trident Technical College students. We filmed an entire Pitch Episode in Charleston, SC over the course of 9 months. The pitch episode premiered during Charleston's Beer Week in September 2018 and won the Best of Show award for WRPN's Global Webisode Competition in December 2018. We want to keep the show going by traveling to other cities that have unique beer communities. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to reach a grand total of $6,000.00

This will fund our crew of 12 people to travel to Sylva, North Carolina for four days during North Carolina's beer month during April. 

Any money raised will go towards the travel to Sylva, NC, then to feeding the crew, then to merchandise to promote Beer Academy, and lastly to reimburse the crew for their work. 

In return for your donation we will give you:

$50 donation - Beer Academy STICKER

$100 donation - Beer Academy COOZIE

$100 donation - Beer Academy BOTTLE OPENER

$250 donation - Beer Academy T-SHIRT

$250 donation - Beer Academy HAT

$400 donation - Beer Academy SHOT GLASS

$450 donation - Beer Academy 16OZ BEER GLASS

$500 donation - Beer Academy BEER BOOT

The Impact

During the Charleston Beer Week in 2018 our fan base grew and they are thirsty for more. There are many beer drinkers and enthusiasts out in the world and they each have a reason to support why their favorite brewery is the best. We want to showcase the uniqueness that each brewery has. 

Risks & Challenges

The lead producer has coordinated with the Director of Tourism for North Carolina in order to find the best locations to film for the next episode. With the Director of Tourism's help, the Beer Academy crew will be able to securely and confidently film at unique breweries in the area during North Carolina's Beer Month.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, please share this campaign and get the word out about craft beer!

Our goal is to reach a grand total of $6,000.00
This will fund our crew of 12 people to travel to Sylva, North Carolina for four days during North Carolina's beer month during April. 
Any money raised will go towards the travel to Sylva, NC, then to feeding the crew, then to merchandise to promote Beer Academy, and lastly to reimburse the crew for their work. 
In return for your donation we will give you:
$50 donation - Beer Academy STICKER
$100 donation - Beer Academy COOZIE
$100 donation - Beer Academy BOTTLE OPENER
$250 donation - Beer Academy T-SHIRT
$250 donation - Beer Academy HAT
$400 donation - Beer Academy SHOT GLASS
$450 donation - Beer Academy 16OZ BEER GLASS
$500 donation - Beer Academy BEER BOOT

The Impact
During the Charleston Beer Week in 2018 our fan base grew and they are thirsty for more. There are many beer drinkers and enthusiasts out in the world and they each have a reason to support why their favorite brewery is the best. We want to showcase the uniqueness that each brewery has. 

Risks & Challenges
The lead producer has coordinated with the Director of Tourism for North Carolina in order to find the best locations to film for the next episode. With the Director of Tourism's help, the Beer Academy crew will be able to securely and confidently film at unique breweries in the area during North Carolina's Beer Month.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute monetarily, please share this campaign and get the word out about craft beer!

story:
Short Summary

Two mismatched friends meet at a laundry mat regularly. Max who struggles daily with his sense of worth, while Stan who seems like he has everything also feels disillusioned with his life. Max and Stan discuss their point of view on life topics. Along the way they are forced to deal with uncomfortable characters, situations and themselves. When they're together it brings out the personal issues they both have to face head on. Both are mindlessly drifting along, desperately seeking more. It begs the question; Would these two have a relationship not washing their laundry? 

What We Need & What You Get

We have shot 3 episodes on our own budget and we're asking for help in finishing our story. We're asking for funds to shoot the remaining episodes. We would like to compensate for our;

Crew

 Cast

Food 

Who can forget coffee! 

The Owner of the shooting location which is a working laundromat. 

When you donate you get; 

Credit

Thank You

Producer Credit

The Impact

We never attempted a fundraising campaign, and we understand the risks involved. As filmmakers we are releasing a project not knowing the public's response, but this makes us grow as artists. All in all, it's a learning process.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by sharing this page on social media and watching the episodes when they're released. THANK YOU!

story:
After Hours is a pilot/ proof of concept for a series about a woman who examines the unconscious choices she made which led to her cheating on her husband.

The project explores the boundaries of relationships, and how a seemingly innocent interaction can quickly spiral out of control.

For this project we are asking for $9,500. This money will go toward equipment rentals, securing locations, feeding our amazing cast and crew, as well as paying for festival fees upon completion.

In exchange for your support you can get anything from a personalized shout out on social media, to a producer credit (if you have the big bucks). We also have After Hours merchandise, and passes to see the finished product later this year.

This project is important, because I wanted to explore how relationships are tested when gender roles are reversed.

We all know the cliche of a husband trading up his wife for his hot young secretary.

With After Hours, we’re flipping that narrative, and documenting the very real consequences of Michelle’s (our main character) actions.

Any contribution help, from $1 to the entire $9500. However, if you cannot contribute financially then please please please find us on Facebook @afterhoursatl and on Instagram @after_hours_series. Like and share our posts, and get the word out!

story:
An accidental web series

This was never intended to become a ‘thing’. It started as two showreel scenes titled CAVENDISH written in September 2019 that shot one day in October. Click the play button above in the gallery to watch the intro built to introduce each episode. What was intended to provide showreel material instantly grew potential for it to continue. Sharing clips of cuts on Instagram and official photos from set garnered curiosity. Will there be more? Can you add another scene? Do you have any roles available for me? Well, guess what?

  • Episode 2 is written and slated to shoot in late January at the Trades Hall and Brigadoon hotel gardens
  • Episode 3 is written and ideally would shoot within a few weeks of Ep 2.
  • We want to keep writing and bringing this series to life; just like any series wouldn’t stop after one episode.

Almost all our crew from the showreel scenes (which we now call Episode 1) can commit to future episodes because they love the story – it’s definitely not because of our awesome low-budget to date - we can assure you!

We do this because we love it

Everyone on cast and crew is career-oriented. Some are trained, some aren't. One or two have grey hair and as much experience as others have been alive. A few are in school. All of us work professionally in various capacities in low-budget, big-budget and unpaid jobs in the industry depending on what is available and because we all want to work.

  • Episode 2: We need to provide at least the same terms as Episode 1 but we would like to offer everyone more than £25 for two days of work. We have a few new wardrobe requirements due to shooting outside. We need a specific location which will require a budget and get a lighting kit for all future shooting.
  • Episode 3 requires triple the funds used on previous episodes because as per the script we will need around ten actors, and to dress them in Cavendish-branded wardrobe, which requires several weeks' notice to have made. The location for episode three takes place in a girls' dormitory and there is no way to cut corners, so a healthy budget for location is needed or risk not being able to shoot.  
  • All funding for episodes will always go to the same basic areas: cast payment, crew payment,  location fees (sometimes multiple locations will be used to shoot one episode), kit hire for sound, wardrobe for all actors (almost always embroidered or custom-made due to the nature of the show) travel on day of shoot, good food for everyone, one-off equipment purchase (replacement bulbs for lighting, extension leads, specific props) and then there are casting, rehearsal and audition space rentals needed before shoot day.

No one works for free or experience alone on Cavendish. We will always pay people something to show we respect their time and talents, and that we believe they are making an incredible contribution to the series.

Creating work for ourselves

We aren't waiting for someone to open a door. By shooting Cavendish, we just built our own:

  • There is no other television show or web series like Cavendish, and we like it that way.
  • Family-friendly language.
  • Providing opportunities for both up and coming as well as established Scottish or Scottish-based talent. The industry here has been crying out for the talent pool of both cast and crew to join together and make something instead of waiting for a big production to appear and give us work. This is our little contribution.

Getting as many local actors onto the show as guest stars as we can. The Scottish film industry is a small small world, and we want to give them a chance to be part of Cavendish by writing in parts for them and bringing back other characters in recurring roles.

Finances are necessary, but they can't control the script

We don't want the joy of creating original content to be controlled by money or the lack of it. That great location the scene takes place in? Well, if you imagine a beautiful or specific setting but can't afford it, then you need to rewrite the scene or you simply can't shoot it. We don't want to compromise what's possible to bring to screen due to worrying about not having the budget.

We will be inventive and frugal, but not at the expense of staying true to the continuity of what we’ve created so far, or delivering a high-quality performance.

The incredible amount of time commitment required to shoot one episode means cast and crew would need to turn down other work, and many are willing to commit, but it would be great to offer at least national minimum wage. We want to build a solid, consistent team and not make them have to choose between a higher paying job on another film project and Cavendish if they don't want to.

Be an alumnus of Cavendish in three ways

  • Join as a backer, which means you also get perks in exchange for the level of financial support you give. Perks range from signed scripts, photos from the set on a postcard sent to your front door, official portraits taken by our photographer on location of actors in character, social media shoutouts, Cavendish apparel and merchandise and a chance to visit us on set or have a video call from us!
  • If the 'fuss' or the perks aren't for you, you can support Cavendish through Indiegogo via the 'contribution' button.
  • Watch the show, and if you like us, share our links or talk about us. If we're not your cup of tea that's okay too.

story:
Aren’t you ready to have some fun? Now more than ever we could all use a good laugh. 

So the timing couldn’t be better for It Had to Be Lou, the comedy pilot from Adam Sandel, creator of the satirical web series The Gay Husbands of San Francisco.

It Had to Be Lou is a modern gay twist on a comedy classic! It’s a fresh, funny take on the LGBTQ experience, and a celebration of today’s San Francisco in all its eccentric glory!

It stars some of San Francisco’s brightest talents, including Christopher Goodwin ("Beach Blanket Babylon”), Pablo Schmidt-Escobar (“Sex and the City Live!”), Scarlett Hepworth, Michael Patrick Gaffney, Helena Levin, and Ed Gonzalez Moreno.

We’d love to have you join our team as a financial supporter of this exciting new project. We literally can’t do it without you!

Our goal is to raise the very modest budget of $10,000 to produce the half-hour pilot. This will enable us to compensate the brilliant cast, crew, and production team. The more money we raise, the more generous we can be!

You can join us as an Executive Producer, an Associate Producer -- or give what you can and earn our special thanks and eternal gratitude!

To thank you for your contribution, we’ll invite you to celebrate with us at the private It Had to Be Lou premiere party and screening in San Francisco (date TBA).

So join our team! You may participate and be credited as an individual, or under a company name. The levels of participation, and billing that you’ll receive in the closing credits, are:

$3,000 - $10,000 

Executive Producer credit (solo card)

VIP table for four, and a bottle of champagne, at the private It Had to Be Lou premiere party and screening in San Francisco (date TBA)

$1,000 - $2,999 

Executive Producer credit (shared card)

VIP table for two, and a bottle of champagne, at the private It Had to Be Lou premiere party and screening in San Francisco (date TBA)

$500 - $999

Associate Producer credit (shared card)

Two VIP tickets to the private It Had to Be Lou premiere party and screening in San Francisco (date TBA)

$250 - $499

Special Thanks credit (shared card)

Two tickets to the private It Had to Be Lou premiere party and screening in San Francisco (date TBA)

$50 - $249

Two tickets to the private It Had to Be Lou premiere party and screening in San Francisco (date TBA)

If you’re not able to contribute, you can still help! Share your enthusiasm and help us out by spreading the word about this campaign to your family, friends and social networks, using the Indiegogo share tools!

However you choose to contribute…

Thank you!

The It Had to Be Lou Team

 

Video credits:

Musical arrangement by Bob Crawford

Artwork by Elliott C. Nathan, originally created for the San Francisco Dept. of Public Health eNav Program.

story:
Sinners Haven - a TV show you haven't experienced before!

The story follows Christian who begins working at Sinners Haven, a popular East London gay bar, and we quickly learn that he’s not like the other Sinners; Aaron, Max, Tom and Rachel. However, one thing that everyone has in common is that they’re all hiding their own deadly secrets. Especially the bar’s owner, Peter Parish.

We follow Christian’s story further down the rabbit hole under it ends with one jaw-dropping murder sure to leave everyone wanting more.

  • This campaign is for the pilot episode of a TV series of 8 episodes
  • We are final year film production students from The CASS and Greenwich University; Leon, Inka, Ella, Aminah and Kieran, making Sinners Haven as a graduation project. 
  • We are self-funding the project, but will need YOUR help to cover location, props, costumes and expenses. We will highly appreciate your contribution, how ever big or small!

"This project is something different to anything I feel I've seen lately on conventional broadcast television or beyond. The cast is made up of LGBTQ characters and set in a world of murder, mystery and mayhem. While writing the project I wanted to make characters that were relatable but I didn't want to handle them with kid gloves. They have flaws, passions, mishaps, downfalls and aspirations. These characters are not see through, paper cut out, "gay best friend" stereotypes. They are complex and have a voice which I'm excited to share. That matched with the deadly storylines and mysterious gay bar's past equals a thrilling story we can't wait to tell.

The money we raise will all go towards actors expenses, location, make-up, costumes, props among many other things. Our backers get fun perks which keep in the spirit of the project along with updates on everything so you'll be a Sinners Haven super fan in no time." - Leon Moore (Writer/Producer/Director)

What We Need & What You Get

  • The majority of the funding will go towards the location - we are filming 4 days in the beginning of April.

  • We wanted to create personal and unique perks; fancy a cocktail course, a chance to win tickets to a private screening or to even feature in Sinners Haven yourself?

Meet the team

Leon Moore is a short film producer/writer with experience in live events and scripted projects. In 2016 Leon worked for Nicky Hambleton-Jones to produce and film a style video, filmed a student fashion show, wrote/produced a short film named 'Destination' and produced promotional videos for Orchard Skin Clinic. 

Inka Ritola comes from an editor / assistant editor background and has worked as a producer / production manager in shorts throughout her degree. For Sinners Haven she will be co-producing as well as a casting director.

Ella Jay is a passionate music photographer and a make-up artist. She will be making special behind the scenes vlogs for everyone who claims a perk of £5 or higher and will of course take charge of make-up and production design.

Aminah Tariq is a multitalented Greenwich University final year student. On Sinners Haven Aminah will be working as a DoP. 

Kieran Worboys is a film editor with a wealth of experience editing short films and documentaries. His latest short film, "Housewife", will be released in June 2017.

 

Can't pay? 

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially - and that's completely okay! 

  • By sharing our post on Facebook and other platforms you are helping us a lot
  • Follow us on Facebook, Instagram and Twitter to spread the word!

Every thing counts and we appreciate every single share, penny, nice thought and conversation you have about Sinners Haven!
