story:
My name is Peter Lang and I animated the original series of Pigeon Street. 

It was one of my first major projects after leaving Art College.

Originally, it was a series for pre-school children, about a community of 20 or so, friendly, likeable characters that the audience could relate to. They came from different class, ethnic, socio-economic and political backgrounds. They covered all ages. Their broad area of experience gave them a wider knowledge to draw on to better solve the various problems they were confronted with in their lives. They even sung about it. The series was repeated on the BBC for over twenty years. That's a lot of pre-schoolers.

Pigeon Street was a show for children, but those kids who formed the original audience have long grown up. I’d now like to use it and tell the stories about those same familiar characters, but other stories, ones that address adult concerns. Let us go back and look at the street and its inhabitants from an adult point of view. The other side.

Everyone still gets on as they did. After all… These are still the people you would meet in Pigeon Street. And since the artwork still exists I will re-scan the original artwork, re-rig the characters and animate them digitally, the colours and quality will be higher today due to the technology.

Since animating Pigeon Street I have created commercials, music videos and series in 2D and 3D, stop-motion and digital. I have also done everything from writing, storyboarding, designing, editing, adding sound and music and post-producing entire projects as well to being part of bigger teams and directing a factory-full of animators oversees. But, I prefer working in smaller teams where what you make can remain quite personal and intimate.

With your help I aim to put together a small production team to create a 10 minute freestanding pilot episode. With this in hand we can discover how much interest there is in the idea and how far to take it, and of-course keep you updated on how it's progressing.  Any new, original concept is always difficult to finance because its potential success is hard to quantify to the people who invest their money as business. A pilot episode showing the new Pigeon Street will give the project the best possible chance of success for further investment and keep to the shows vision. The aim is to be different, being a remake with a twist. I genuinely want to see if a broader audience can enjoy and gain inspiration from a community that continues to lead by example.

This is where your support becomes crucial. Initially, I will use the money pledged to get the script written, create a storyboard and make the initial rewards. I will then move into production. We will be creating the characters/actors from the existing artwork, only sourcing any extra artwork if and when necessary. I intend to use Alan Rogers, my long-term collaborator and the original designer/director of Pigeon Street. Because this is a more mature production with need for extra facial expressions the characters will need extra facial rigging. Using digital animation software, we can combine the original scanned artwork and new animation technologies, such as lip sync and vocal characterisation. Actor/Singer Will Guppy, of the "cult-hit" comedy, 'Snakes! The Musical', will provide his vocal talents. We have musicians lined up who will write and perform any extra music/songs needed and a sound engineer ready to record any sound effects. We have access to most of the technology and software but we may need but allocate some contingency for the unforeseeable. Our overall budget for an original 10-minute short would normally be much higher than the campaign goal. But in this case, because most of the design and artwork are already there we only need to raise £25,000 on Indiegogo.

I have tried to create really special perks as a reward for you supporting me. They range from you or your loved one actually taking part in the animation as a drawn, cut-out version of yourselves to having your name up in lights, well at least the credits at the end of the show. I want to invite some of you to the preview screening. There will be opportunities for you to see the work as it takes shape. No one will come away unrewarded.

The funding will be firstly used to cover the creation of the rewards. If less than the 25K target is reached I will create a shorter section with a cliff-hanger ending which I will still be able to use as an example of what the finished piece will look like, this will help with pitching the show to the TV companies, animation festivals and media markets.

Having talked to many people who remember Pigeon Street, seeing the enthusiastic and continued enjoyment with online communities and Facebook groups,  I have been persuaded it would be foolish not to give it a go! So please join us in sharing the campaign, pledging, and don't forget to tweet with the hashtag #coo  - they are pigeons after all!
story_txt: My name is Peter Lang and I animated the original series of Pigeon Street. It was one of my first major projects after leaving Art College.Originally, it was a series for pre-school children, about a community of 20 or so, friendly, likeable characters that the audience could relate to. They came from different class, ethnic, socio-economic and political backgrounds. They covered all ages. Their broad area of experience gave them a wider knowledge to draw on to better solve the various problems they were confronted with in their lives. They even sung about it. The series was repeated on the BBC for over twenty years. That's a lot of pre-schoolers.Pigeon Street was a show for children, but those kids who formed the original audience have long grown up. I’d now like to use it and tell the stories about those same familiar characters, but other stories, ones that address adult concerns. Let us go back and look at the street and its inhabitants from an adult point of view. The other side.Everyone still gets on as they did. After all… These are still the people you would meet in Pigeon Street. And since the artwork still exists I will re-scan the original artwork, re-rig the characters and animate them digitally, the colours and quality will be higher today due to the technology.Since animating Pigeon Street I have created commercials, music videos and series in 2D and 3D, stop-motion and digital. I have also done everything from writing, storyboarding, designing, editing, adding sound and music and post-producing entire projects as well to being part of bigger teams and directing a factory-full of animators oversees. But, I prefer working in smaller teams where what you make can remain quite personal and intimate.With your help I aim to put together a small production team to create a 10 minute freestanding pilot episode. With this in hand we can discover how much interest there is in the idea and how far to take it, and of-course keep you updated on how it's progressing.  Any new, original concept is always difficult to finance because its potential success is hard to quantify to the people who invest their money as business. A pilot episode showing the new Pigeon Street will give the project the best possible chance of success for further investment and keep to the shows vision. The aim is to be different, being a remake with a twist. I genuinely want to see if a broader audience can enjoy and gain inspiration from a community that continues to lead by example.This is where your support becomes crucial. Initially, I will use the money pledged to get the script written, create a storyboard and make the initial rewards. I will then move into production. We will be creating the characters/actors from the existing artwork, only sourcing any extra artwork if and when necessary. I intend to use Alan Rogers, my long-term collaborator and the original designer/director of Pigeon Street. Because this is a more mature production with need for extra facial expressions the characters will need extra facial rigging. Using digital animation software, we can combine the original scanned artwork and new animation technologies, such as lip sync and vocal characterisation. Actor/Singer Will Guppy, of the "cult-hit" comedy, 'Snakes! The Musical', will provide his vocal talents. We have musicians lined up who will write and perform any extra music/songs needed and a sound engineer ready to record any sound effects. We have access to most of the technology and software but we may need but allocate some contingency for the unforeseeable. Our overall budget for an original 10-minute short would normally be much higher than the campaign goal. But in this case, because most of the design and artwork are already there we only need to raise £25,000 on Indiegogo.I have tried to create really special perks as a reward for you supporting me. They range from you or your loved one actually taking part in the animation as a drawn, cut-out version of yourselves to having your name up in lights, well at least the credits at the end of the show. I want to invite some of you to the preview screening. There will be opportunities for you to see the work as it takes shape. No one will come away unrewarded.The funding will be firstly used to cover the creation of the rewards. If less than the 25K target is reached I will create a shorter section with a cliff-hanger ending which I will still be able to use as an example of what the finished piece will look like, this will help with pitching the show to the TV companies, animation festivals and media markets.Having talked to many people who remember Pigeon Street, seeing the enthusiastic and continued enjoyment with online communities and Facebook groups,  I have been persuaded it would be foolish not to give it a go! So please join us in sharing the campaign, pledging, and don't forget to tweet with the hashtag #coo  - they are pigeons after all!

story:
Short Summary

The webseries takes place via vlogs posted by Rae as she starts her first semester of uni, detailing her struggles as she settles into uni life. With her best friend Kasey, gay spirit guide Julia and not-so-secret crush Alex, the semester is filled with mischievous plans, shocking revelations, some heart break, and self-discoveries.

Posterity was the brain child of a tough first year at university (also doesn't help that that year was 2016) as well as hearing other people's struggles. It's about the realities of that daunting experience, but also perhaps there's good that can come out of it. It's about independence, self-discovery, friendship, relationships and perspectives.

 

The Impact

The broader purpose of Posterity, is to firstly show people that they are not alone - either in the starting university/new scary chapter of your life struggle, finding who you are struggle or questioning your sexuality/coming out struggle. 

Further, specifically, Posterity was written as a direct response to the lack of diversity (gender, sexuality, race) in media. The series wants, it whatever small way possible, to tip the scale back, and add one more to the tally of female characters, LGBTQ characters, and POC characters. 

Also Posterity is written and directed by Anna Yuen (view my lovely face below), a gay woman of colour, so in real life representation, my dudes. 

 

Format

Posterity will be released in real time, in Australia's semester one 2017. (Late Feb-early June 2017) There will be 26 episodes in total, with two episodes released per week, and maybe even some bonus videos.

 

Moneys and Perks

We need funding for props and set design to make the series look as real as possible, equipment to improve the quality of image and sound (lights, mics, sound recorders, SD cards, and also cases to transport these to location (it's surprising how much those cost)), and for crafts to feed our wonderful actors so they can do what they do best. At the moment our cast and crew are working for free (with some travelling from quite a distance away), so your contribution shows us how much you value our work, storytelling, filmmaking and the arts.

There's all sorts of awesome perks available including behind the scenes and blooper extras, the original storyboard (hard drawn, or more like scrawled), original title art (also hand drawn, a lot prettier),  a Skype sesh or meet up (if in Sydney), nominating a tag/challenge video idea for us to do and an interview opportunity!

If we don't reach our goal, the series will still be made, but we would be literal starving artists and the series would not look or sound as awesome as it can be. (Dodgy sound is not fun at all.)

 

Our Cast

story:
We are a team of creators with Lissette Camacho, our Creator/Showrunner, leading the production of the summer web series, Here We Are. 

It's a passion project about two girls, Evie and Lia, falling in love during summer break, but one of them has to go back by the end of August for college, leaving Evie with a shocking revelation.

Here We Are tackles mental health and sexuality as the show continues on. We want to help young people, especially in the LGBTQ+ community, to embrace who they are and know that they are not alone.

We want to make people smile and be excited again for the summer. 

  • Follow us on Instagram for regular updates about cast & crew: https://www.instagram.com/herewearewebseries/

Producing a web series with a small cast & crew is NOT easy, especially after the past year we had.

We saved money for our web series with the little we make, but after making a detailed budget plan, we realized it's not enough. 

We need your help with the following for the shoot in September 2021: 

  • Equipment Rental: We need lighting equipment, a grip package, and camera filters which will be around $650. 
  • Location #1: Beach & Beach House is $110/hour. We need 3 days, 10 hours per day in this location to be able to shoot Season 1. That makes it $3300.
  • Location #2: Main character's house (indoor) will be shot in a beautiful place in LA that is $60/hour. We need 12 hours here to be able to shoot Season 1 scenes. That makes it $720.
  • Transportation: Estimated $400.
  • Equipment Truck: Estimated $420.
  • Editing: Estimated $400.
  • Insurance: Estimated $700.
  • Film Permit: Estimated $400.

If we don't reach our goal, we will downsize the crew and the equipment rentals, but we will shoot Season 1 no matter what, so feel free to get the perk "VIP PASS" to the early premiere because we are not giving up!

Our perks are designed just for you!

  • Social Media Shoutout: Get a shoutout on our Instagram story. 
  • Thanks Email from the Creator: Our creator will send you a personalized thank you email. 
  • Thanks Credit on Screen: Get a "Thanks" credit on-screen in one of the episodes of this season.
  • VIP Pass to Early Premiere: The web series will release in Summer 2022, but those of you who select this perk get to be at the early Zoom premiere with the cast & crew. 
  • Associate Producer Credit: Get an Associate Producer credit in Season 1. 
  • Executive Producer Credit: Get an Executive Producer credit in Season 1.

And you get to support the summer love story of two girls for seasons and seasons to come.

The creator of Here We Are is an award-winning screenwriter...

And our team of professionals includes an award-winning producer, cinematographer, and professional editor with more than 10 years of experience. 

We are at the heart of the entertainment industry with a fresh idea, an all-female cast, and our diverse crew from all around the world and from the LGBTQ+ and Latinx community. 

Here We Are will be the voice of young LGBTQ+ members as well as other diverse groups, who struggle to exist in our society.

Mental health and Sexuality are the cores of this web series. 

It's okay if you can't contribute at the moment.

You can still give us a shoutout on social media and share our page with people you think will be interested in Here We Are. 

If you read this far, thank you so much for your time and support. Sending love <3 

Sincerely,

Here We Are team

Follow us on social media for updates!

IG: @herewearewebseries

FB Page: Here We Are: Summer Web Series

Twitter: @HereWeAreSeries

story:
What is The Redemption of Randy About?

The Redemption of Randy is a television series that follows a cursed, suicidal man as he stumbles blindly within his own darkness. Consumed with regret from his past, our leading guy, Randy Michael James, is haunted by ghosts born from numerous tragedies that have plagued him all his life. His nightmares leave him with many sleepless nights. Hallucinations occur during his waking hours. His mind is so screwed up, he has a hard time differentiating what’s real from what’s not.

When he’s literally at the end of his rope, an unlikely, sassy woman with supernatural gifts, barges her way into his life. Her name is Cassie and she’s a southern transplant who’s had her own fair share of tragedies throughout her journey. Unlike Randy, she’s always found a way to keep pressing on and staying positive, even in the darkest of times.

The two of them seem to meet by chance and almost go their separate ways, wanting nothing to do with the other. However, something (or someone) compels Cassie to not take no for an answer, and make herself a part of this broken man’s life, whether he likes it or not.

The story starts there, and over the course of the series, our heroine will use her unique form of “treatment and counseling” to get our main character back on the right path. Their journey will encompass a message of hope, even when all hope seems to be gone. Along the way, the two of them will battle his demons side by side, and will cross paths with various individuals who each have issues of their own. Some larger and more nefarious than others.

The series will take place in Alaska and like all things Alaska, it will have a lot of elements that are larger than life. Everything up here is bigger (sorry Texas) so we decided to try to tell an Epic Story, unlike anything that’s come out of this state yet. Call us ambitious. But we think we could have a hit show on our hands, with many seasons to come!

Our show is fantasy based with elements of drama, horror, suspense, and faith. It has a plethora of flavors to hopefully appeal to a wide audience. Throw in the uplifting message from Touched by an Angel. Add a touch of night terrors from Nightmare on Elm Street. Pour in the visions of ghosts from The Sixth Sense. Topped off with the ability to solve problems with animals from Lassie. All rolled into one delicious burrito.

What We Need to Shoot our Pilot

Here’s a quick rundown of what this campaign is for:

We are shooting a PILOT EPISODE for the series. The script is written (with more rewrites to come) and shooting dates are locked in. We just need the money so that we can take this story from script and put it to screen.  We landed on a budget of $100,000 to help us cover the costs associated with creating something that’s independent yet still cinematic enough to fall in line with the popular shows you see on TV and streaming services today.

The money will go towards securing a solid mostly Alaskan cast and crew, locking down locations, renting high-end camera equipment, transportation and accommodations, and most importantly: Craft Services

Any additional funds will go towards us marketing and pushing the pilot out to the world like crazy. We are laser-focused on making this a success and getting it in front of as many eyes as possible. Ultimately, our goal is to sit down with a network, studio, or streaming platform with our solid, professionally made Pilot, and get them to buy and fund the rest of our series. ABC. FOX. HBO. Netflix. Amazon Prime. Facebook Watch. We are going after them all.

 

The Impact

Intertwined with the Fantasy and fictional storytelling that takes place in our pilot episode, is the subject matter of mental health. Our main character deals with PTSD, depression, anxiety, suicidal thoughts… the list goes on. On top of the unique brand of counseling that he gets from our gifted leading lady, we will show Randy Michael James authentically pursue various forms of healing and treatment. He will do the necessary things to finally allow himself to be unburdened by the past and deal with his issues in healthy ways.

We hope that in doing this, it could bring a realness to what it really takes to bring one’s self out of a dark place. It’s never easy. There’s a lot of ups and downs. Sometimes it may feel more like regression, than progress, but you must go through it and continue to move forward. Our leading guy will do the whole gambit. We hope this, in turn, could be inspiration and a beacon of hope for people who suffer from depression or some of the similar mental illnesses that our character(s) portray, and encourage them to seek help in their own lives.

On top of that, we want it to be entertaining. TV is the hot medium for storytelling, and we want to put a unique story that’s based in Alaska in the mix. Alaska is popular within the realm of Reality TV, but we feel this great state has even more to offer to the scripted television world. The characters up here are unique and diverse (Most people outside of Alaska, don’t know the melting pot of cultures that we have just in Anchorage alone). The scenery is second to none.  And the stories we could tell about this place are endless.

We still haven’t touched the surface of the kind of storytelling that can come from the state; we hope this show ignites a fire that gets more shows produced. And we have talented people within the filming industry that can make this happen. We are fortunate enough to have a few of them working on this project with us!

Other Ways You Can help

If you are unable to donate, you can still help us out in a big way by spreading the word about our project! We want to get this campaign in front of as many eyes as possible and you can make that happen.

Share our IndieGoGo page on Facebook. Instagram. Twitter. Snapchat. TikTok. Any social media platform! We aren’t picky about where the support comes from. We just want to get as many people as possible as excited about the project as we are.

story:
What is INDY - ON THE TOWN?

INDY - ON THE TOWN is a half-hour docu-series program that aired its first season on WHMB TV-40 and features people around Indy who are:

  • Creating New Ideas
  • Discovering New Potential
  • Developing New Concepts
  • Designing the Future
  • And DARING TO DREAM BEYOND THE REALMS OF IMAGINATION!

We're ready to get rolling on a second season showcasing incredible people around the Circle City, and we're asking you to help make that happen!

Why This Campaign?

In an effort to help people around Indy get marketing exposure that they might not otherwise receive, we've launched this campaign to raise money so that we can continue into our next season and continue to feature amazing individuals around greater Indianapolis who are doing amazing things!

And... we want to be able to hire and pay film makers, audio technicians, sound operators, lighting technicians, and other personnel a decent fee for their talent and expertise. In addition, contributions to our campaign will help cover other production costs. 

  • We seek to raise $25,000 to fund season 2.
  • A TV Program like no other in Indy that brings exposure to people who might not otherwise get discovered.  
  • In our next season we have a great line up of people and ideas who deliver a powerful and positive message in a time of negativity.
  • Local, local, local!!! Doing high quality work and we want to focus on events and people doing great things. 
  • Whether you're interested in becoming a major sponsor/producer of a television show, or if you just want to see local programming continue to showcase your favorite city, we have a large variety of contributor levels to match your interest.
  • Our crowdfunding goal will not only help us continue to produce exciting educational programming, but also to hire local industry professionals. Even if we don't reach the full amount, every dollar we raise will go toward expenses and hiring costs!

The Impact

We love Indianapolis! We love the city itself, the landmarks, the venues, the sports, the conventions, and most importantly: the people. Most likely, if you've spent enough time here, you do too! Every member of our team has a background in some aspect of the television industry, and we wanted to use our experience to showcase the city that we are proud to call our home. From local celebrities embarking on new adventures to families helping strangers get through a pandemic, our mission is to tell the stories that make Indy special. In our first season we promoted local small business owners, helped fight the opioid epidemic, and gave people an additional platform to share their voice. IOTT has been a labor of love, but we want to grow our team so that we can continue to raise Indianapolis up by connecting entrepreneurs to their audiences, employing top-notch industry professionals, and providing real world experience to interns.

INDY - ON THE TOWN has already had a HUGE impact on the local community. 

In our first season, we produced 13 segments featuring art, culture and human interest stories including:

"The Addict's Wake" - about the opioid crisis in Indiana was featured and we helped them raise funds to complete their documentary.

"Black Sheep Collective" - a local, black-owned apparel shop that spreads their message of faith through art was featured in one of our episodes. 

            ... And so much more!!!

*We produced season one from blood sweat and tears and to continue we want to make an impact on the television industry in Indy by hiring top-notch professionals. 

Below is a photo taken on location while filming INDY - ON THE TOWN!

Here's another photo of Creator/Executive Producer/ Host ASHTON WOLF doing voice-over work in the studio! That's Co-host Aaron Henze in the background!

And finally... here's a photo high atop a roof top in downtown Indy where our production team filmed the final fly-away drone shot that you see at the end of every episode!

Trust

We've already produced one season, so this is not a start up but a continuation of something we've already achieved. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't still help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about INDY - ON THE TOWN.
  • You can recommend/suggest a segment for us to film!
  • Help spread the word on social media.
story_txt:
What is INDY - ON THE TOWN?
INDY - ON THE TOWN is a half-hour docu-series program that aired its first season on WHMB TV-40 and features people around Indy who are:

Creating New Ideas
Discovering New Potential
Developing New Concepts
Designing the Future
And DARING TO DREAM BEYOND THE REALMS OF IMAGINATION!

We're ready to get rolling on a second season showcasing incredible people around the Circle City, and we're asking you to help make that happen!

Why This Campaign?
In an effort to help people around Indy get marketing exposure that they might not otherwise receive, we've launched this campaign to raise money so that we can continue into our next season and continue to feature amazing individuals around greater Indianapolis who are doing amazing things!
And... we want to be able to hire and pay film makers, audio technicians, sound operators, lighting technicians, and other personnel a decent fee for their talent and expertise. In addition, contributions to our campaign will help cover other production costs. 

We seek to raise $25,000 to fund season 2.
A TV Program like no other in Indy that brings exposure to people who might not otherwise get discovered.  
In our next season we have a great line up of people and ideas who deliver a powerful and positive message in a time of negativity.
Local, local, local!!! Doing high quality work and we want to focus on events and people doing great things. 
Whether you're interested in becoming a major sponsor/producer of a television show, or if you just want to see local programming continue to showcase your favorite city, we have a large variety of contributor levels to match your interest.
Our crowdfunding goal will not only help us continue to produce exciting educational programming, but also to hire local industry professionals. Even if we don't reach the full amount, every dollar we raise will go toward expenses and hiring costs!


The Impact
We love Indianapolis! We love the city itself, the landmarks, the venues, the sports, the conventions, and most importantly: the people. Most likely, if you've spent enough time here, you do too! Every member of our team has a background in some aspect of the television industry, and we wanted to use our experience to showcase the city that we are proud to call our home. From local celebrities embarking on new adventures to families helping strangers get through a pandemic, our mission is to tell the stories that make Indy special. In our first season we promoted local small business owners, helped fight the opioid epidemic, and gave people an additional platform to share their voice. IOTT has been a labor of love, but we want to grow our team so that we can continue to raise Indianapolis up by connecting entrepreneurs to their audiences, employing top-notch industry professionals, and providing real world experience to interns.
INDY - ON THE TOWN has already had a HUGE impact on the local community. 
In our first season, we produced 13 segments featuring art, culture and human interest stories including:
"The Addict's Wake" - about the opioid crisis in Indiana was featured and we helped them raise funds to complete their documentary.
"Black Sheep Collective" - a local, black-owned apparel shop that spreads their message of faith through art was featured in one of our episodes. 
            ... And so much more!!!
*We produced season one from blood sweat and tears and to continue we want to make an impact on the television industry in Indy by hiring top-notch professionals. 
Below is a photo taken on location while filming INDY - ON THE TOWN!
Here's another photo of Creator/Executive Producer/ Host ASHTON WOLF doing voice-over work in the studio! That's Co-host Aaron Henze in the background!
And finally... here's a photo high atop a roof top in downtown Indy where our production team filmed the final fly-away drone shot that you see at the end of every episode!

Trust
We've already produced one season, so this is not a start up but a continuation of something we've already achieved. 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't still help:

Help us get the word out and make some noise about INDY - ON THE TOWN.
You can recommend/suggest a segment for us to film!
Help spread the word on social media.

story:
So what is ‘Nefarium’?

Nefarium [nuh·feuh·ree·um] is a prospective 9-part web series, with each 10-minute part focusing on a cast of diverse characters and how their lives reflect the 9 ‘original’ deadly sins in a world not that different to our own. Each sin is the focus of its own part, with them being mostly self-contained, however, they live within the same story world, with each part hopefully making you think deeper about traits of humanity.

For our final year graduate project we are making 3 of the 9 parts (however we hope to be able to make the other 6 in due time);

  • Episode 3- Ira
    • Based around the sin of Wrath

Howie has spent his life at sea and has become accustomed to a solitary life, however now it seems to have taken a dark turn as he showcases his thoughts and feelings on his crewmates for his therapy video diary, showing his descent into a wrathful state.

  • Episode 7- Invidia 
    • Based around the sin of Envy

A pair of brothers work in the same field at a research base, however, one feels constantly overshadowed by their sibling and their achievements and is determined to have the limelight for once.

  • Episode 8- Avaritia 
    • Based around the sin of Avarice and Greed

A pair of university business students decide to kick-start their careers by taking advantage of the pandemic and setting up a questionable business.

The vast majority of this production is being done remotely, with the cast and crew coming together from both the UK and other places around the world via software like Zoom to create this short film series. This has drastically changed how we have to go about this production, relying on the integrity of our ideas, and the collaboration of our actors.

Nefarium is currently your standard student production however with your funding we are hoping to take this project to the next level and add all the little (and big) elements that make a production the highest quality. We hope for this project to showcase the accumulation of what we have learned over our filmmaking journeys at Bournemouth University and encapsulate why we’re so passionate about making drama, in the hopes to deliver the best content we will have made thus far.

What We Need and What You Get For Your Help

To give the greatest justice to our ideas and scripts, we need your help to raise £2,500 which will go towards production and post-production costs. We have been given nearly no support from our university money-wise for this project so your generosity will directly improve our production by allowing us to focus what money we raise towards areas like set-design and costumes, as well as other areas if we raise enough funds including post-production processes such as sound and music by letting us work with a composer to create a unique soundtrack for this series, allowing us to create a bespoke title sequence to polish the episodes off with, and especially if we raise all the funds we will be able to give a contribution back to our cast who are currently working on this project with us collaboratively and we’d love to be able to show our appreciation for their involvement. We are also hoping to raise funds to be able to submit the short films from this project to festivals.

As a way of saying thank you for your amazing support and donations, we will be giving out rewards and perks, with the quality of the reward varying upon the donation amount ranging from a massive thank you on our social media to an executive producer credit for your amazing contribution, however, be assured that there will be a reward to any donation given, and we are incredibly grateful for you even considering supporting our project!

We will also be sharing information on production over on our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/KastorProductions  where you can see behind the scenes pictures, posters, updates and more!

The Impact

Our project hopes to shed a little light on our shared humanity and how we all reflect sins in our everyday lives and how these can become extreme. We feel like each of our stories are realistic, and could happen to nearly everyone if given a push in the wrong direction. So how much is down to us as individuals and how much is in our human nature? 

By supporting our project you’ll also be supporting some indie student filmmakers trying to make their first steps towards professional production and giving us the chance to take a project we are very passionate about to the next level. We have worked over the last three years on our university course on smaller productions just waiting for the chance to show what we can do if given this opportunity and your support will make our project even greater.

Are there any risks & challenges?

Covid. Pandemic. Lockdowns. Those seem to be the main challenges for everyone these days but with our project, it is especially prevalent. We had to formulate and develop this series in a time of dire uncertainty of what our university would let us do, leading to us making this an entirely remote production. Our crew is spread out all over the UK, with one crew member even being stuck at home in Bulgaria, basically meaning that communication is everything, more so than usual, for this production. But we know this and are prepared to make a production this unconventional way, BBC’s Staged showed that it could be done so we know it is entirely possible. 

Remote filming also means that we as crew won’t be there to help create a set for the actors, instead only being able to communicate our vision to them and hoping they have access to a space suitable, but we’ve factored this into our casting process, and with your funds, we hope we can transform these actors spaces to become the fleshed out locations we’ve created.

Other Ways You Can Help Us

We completely understand that not everyone is able to donate to a project like this, particularly during this time of financial uncertainty, however, if you believe in us and our project we’d really appreciate you just spreading the word and helping us out that way.

You could help us out by:

  • Sharing this campaign with friends, family, colleagues, or anyone else you think might be interested.
  • Following our Facebook page and cheering us on during this project.
  • Spreading the word about our project and that we need financial help.

Ultimately we are incredibly appreciative that you took the time to look at our campaign [and even get all the way through this above information]. Whether you’re able to support our project with a donation, we absolutely can’t wait to share the stories of Nefarium with you in the coming months!

The Team Behind Nefarium!

Despite being a small crew, we’ve got all the roles covered, with everyone helping out outside their specialism to make this our best project yet:

Melissa Gotobed

Main role: Producer 

Hi I’m Melissa Gotobed and I’m a final year Television Production student at Bournemouth University where I have been specialising in producing for drama.

I love coming up with interesting stories from unique perspectives and experiences and hope to go into drama development once I graduate, and being the producer for Nefarium has allowed me to put this narrative building and storytelling into practice. I believe we’ve been able to come up with some unique stories and formats that work within the current climate that will also let us experiment with new ways of filmmaking. I've also been in charge of casting and production management and will be editing one of the three parts.

Carenza Mitchell

Main role: Director

My name is Carenza Mitchell, I am a final year Television Production student at Bournemouth University and I am the director of Nefarium. 

I love bringing unique and complex narratives to life which this production has given me the opportunity to do. This project has challenged me and allowed me to experiment when it comes to filming and directing. I want to be a director for scripted dramas in the future so I chose to work on Nefarium as I can develop my skills and confidence as a director whilst working on a production that I am enthusiastic about. I've also been involved in production management and am going to be the editor for one of the three parts.

Jenny Frater

Main role: Script Writer

My name is Jenny Frater and I specialise in scriptwriting for television. I love being creative, especially when it comes to writing stories and drawing.

Throughout production I’m the scriptwriter for two episodes of the Nefarium series: Avaritia and Invidia. I am also a script editor and assisted with the narrative building for the project as well as any tasks throughout the script department.

I aspire to be a scriptwriter for a television drama series in the future in the hopes that I can write something meaningful for others. By helping fund this project, it will increase our production value and hence bring my scripts and story to life. I will be able to use this project in my portfolio to show future employers and stand out from the other writers out there.

Andrew Elliott

Main role: Script Writer

My name is Andrew Elliott, I’m a 3rd year student studying Television production at Bournemouth university and I am one of the writers on this project.

This project was an exciting challenge for me as I was given creative licence to write a variety of stories and characters with different tones and ideals, I feel as if the scripts we wrote are very strong and will be a lot of fun to shoot as well! Anthology storytelling is something I’ve always loved because it allows the writer to take the audience on a unique journey through numerous different scenarios, which is something you can’t always achieve when writing a concurrent story.

Silvia Nedyalkova

Main Role: Director of Photography

My name is Silvia Nedyalkova and I am a final year TV Production student. I like using creativity to discover new sides of a visual idea. 

I love exploring new concepts and contributing to the final aesthetic of the production. I aspire to be a good team member and work closely with everyone in order to merge different viewpoints and ideas and bring to life the visuals. I believe I still have a long way to learn and I think this project and all challenges that come with it would help me grow in the right direction. I am also going to be the editor for one of the three parts.

Jordan Dawkins

Main Role: Sound Design

I’m Jordan Dawkins and my role is to work on the audio of our project and add a creative impact towards the sound in post-production and if possible on the production. I want to be able to transition my skills I’ve been learning towards a project and to use this opportunity to understand fully what I am capable of.

story:
My name is Michaela P. Shelton and I am the creator of a digital series called Reckless Behavior: The Series. The show tells the story of a post college black millennial and aspiring writer, who navigates through life attempting to find herself and avoid reckless behavior. It is loosely based on my life and its purpose is to create something millennials can relate to that also showcases the beauty and culture of the Bay Area. I am passionate about black storytelling, because I feel that it is important that our voices are heard and our stories are accurately told.

Although it is very uncomfortable for me to request help, I am aware that I must put my pride aside, because it takes a village. After digging myself into debt, working seven days a week and doing various freelance projects to gain extra income, I now realize that I can no longer solely depend on myself to fully fund my projects. 

Through my web series, I have given opportunities to aspiring actors, up and coming musical artists and promoted a number of black owned businesses. In addition, Reckless Behavior: The Series has been mentioned on popular Bay Area radio station 106.1 KMEL, it has been featured on many blogs and podcasts and it has been selected for viewing at the 2020 Pan African Film and Arts Festival, the largest and most prestigious black film festival in America.

If you want to support a young Black woman who is passionate about creating content for us and by us, please donate anything you can. I want to continue this filmmaking journey, but I need your help.

Here is a link to season 2 episodes:

https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLF3EQvVvh41S...

story:
THE STORY

SPACE HEROES is an original sci-fi series set in the year 2159. Faster Than Light travel has become reality and mankind is expanding beyond the solar system. 

CAPTAIN HAMILTON is being called into action by THE PRESIDENT to find out about a mysterious signal 5000 light years away. 

The world of SPACE HEROES is inspired by the more positive versions of the future and the shows that heavily influenced my childhood - especially Captain Future and Star Trek.

The vision for this project is to bring back the sense of wonder and adventure of real and fictional space travel and the lighthearted fun of old serials. 

The concept is to produce an entertaining series for Youtube with episodes of about 10 minutes length. 

 

THE CAST

 

Robert Picardo: The President

The man, the legend - and of course the doctor from STAR TREK: Voyager. 

__________________________________________

Robert Picardo guest starred on many popular tv-series like  “Stargate Atlantis” and "The Orville"

He has appeared in over two dozen films, among them “Hail Caesar!" "Gremlins 2" and "Total Recall" 

 

 

 

John Detty: Captain Hamilton     

The captain the universe needs.
And  maybe also deserves. __________________________________________

John Detty is a career actor of 20 years. He studied at Wright State University, Tshwane University of Technology in South Africa, and ultimately received his BFA in Acting from Ball State University. You may recognize him from Gossip Girl, 30 Rock, Braindead, Unbreakable Kimmy Schmitt, and Blue Bloods. He is a proud member of Actor’s Equity and Sag-Aftra.

 

 

 

Eden Shea Beck: Kaileigh Masterson                                           

Skilled sidekick and pilot. 

__________________________________________

Eden Shea Beck is an actress located in Los Angeles.  She graduated with a film degree from University of Southern California School of Cinematic Arts.  She has appeared in numerous commercials, music videos, film, and television.

 

 

 

Chris Dotson: Professor Grundig                                                  

 

Smartest man alive and inventor of the hyperdrive. Has no humor setting. 

__________________________________________

Chris Dotson is an actor, writer and accomplished cat owner. He has appeared in numerous TV shows over the years, all kinds of commercials, and has a bit of a cult following on YouTube for his David Lynch impression. 

 

 

William Dunz: Radio Host

William Dunz is an awesome stop-motion artist and voice actor. 

 

AND in the future episodes also:

Anthony De Longis 

Anthony has done a lot of Sci-Fi from 5 guest starring appearances on STAR TREK VOYAGER as Maje Culluh, to the original BATTLESTAR GALACTICA, BABYLON 5, OUTER LIMITS, HIGHLANDER the Series, MASTERS OF THE UNIVERSE, SWORD AND THE SORCERER and the cult classic ROAD HOUSE with Patrick Swayze. He's a weapons master, sword expert and taught Michelle Pfeiffer how to use the bullwhip in BATMAN RETURNS.

 

 

                                                                               

THE CREW

 

Christian Eberle is the Producer & Director of this series.

 

We are a group of creative people and VFX artists. Among them ALBERT MARTINEZ who made the amazing Star Trek fan-film  "Chasing the infinite Sky"

 

KATJA VARTIAINEN (co-producer) She's a Master of Fine Arts and creates Matte Paintings, Posters, Storyboards and Concept Art. 

 

German musician DANIEL HARLOFF will compose original music. 

 

HANS ULRICH BAUMSTARK is creating and modelling spaceships and props. 

 

DIRK SANDER is providing us with additional CGI and VFX. 

 

 

  

The Perks !

 

1st Perk,  2e=$2

We Thank You!

 

2nd Perk, 10e=$12

You'll get a Thank You email, and your name in the credits!

 

3rd Perk, 26e=$31

You'll get a Thank You email, and your name in the credits, and this awesome downloadable digital poster of the Space Lancer in 300dpi(=good quality) you can print in  A3=16.5 x 11.7 inches!

 

4th Perk, 47e=$55

You'll get a Thank You email, and your name in the credits, this awesome downloadable digital poster of the Space Lancer in 300dpi(=good quality) you can print in  A3=16.5 x 11.7 inches! AND the t-shirt!

 

5th Perk, 59e=$69

You'll get a Thank You email, the downloadable digital poster of the Space Lancer in 300dpi(=good quality) you can print in  A3=16.5 x 11.7 inches, your name in the credits, AND the mug( instead of the t-shirt), AND the preview link!

 

5th Perk, 116e=$136

You'll get a Thank You email and this awesome downloadable digital poster of the Space Lancer in 300dpi(=good quality) you can print in  A3=16.5 x 11.7 inches, your name in the credits, the mug,  the preview link, AND the t-shirt!

 

6th Perk, 265e=$311

You'll get a Thank You email and this awesome downloadable digital poster of the Space Lancer in 300dpi(=good quality) you can print in  A3=16.5 x 11.7 inches, the mug,  the preview link,  the t-shirt, AND

 

7th Perk , 515e=$605

You'll get a Thank You email and this awesome downloadable digital poster of the Space Lancer in 300dpi(=good quality) you can print in  A3=16.5 x 11.7 inches, the mug,  the preview link,  the t-shirt, AND  the Badge, AND Executive Producer credits!

 

8th Perk, 1000e=$1175

You'll get a Thank You email and this awesome downloadable digital poster of the Space Lancer in 300dpi(=good quality) you can print in  A3=16.5 x 11.7 inches, the mug,  the preview link,  the t-shirt, the badge, the Executive Producer credits,  AND

                                                                                         

 

But wait - there's more!

MUCH more!

 

Principal photography for the pilot is done.  Now, we want to tell the complete story! 

As you know, Sci-fi requires a lot of special- and visual effects. This is a SAG (Screen Actors' Guild) certified production.

 

With your help we will give you an awesome series pilot - and depending on the funding:

More budget = more episodes. And ideally: More episodes with great visual effects. 

One thing's for sure though: Good actors and stories first, VFX second, and quality track and sound.

The budget includes: salaries, healthcare, insurances, taxes, fees, and of course props and the technical gear. We scratched together resources to pay for principal photography, part of VFX. Stuff still have to be paid, Here's a budget breakdown:

Risks

There really are none.  As mentioned, the principal photography has been completed. The crew is committed. We have  completed already an Indiegogo campaign succesfully before.               WE DELIVER. And we are already in preparation for Episode 2!

 

 

Times are tough, we get it.

If you can't make a donation, you can contribute by spreading the word!
The Indiegogo link above is a perfect way to do it.

Or, If you don't have a credit card/the right debit card, you can make donations at beyond-limitations.com 

with Paypal.  You can also donate (and getting just a Thank You email)  without choosing a perk (a contribution) and you can donate anonymously.

 

Join the adventure!
story_txt:
THE STORY
SPACE HEROES is an original sci-fi series set in the year 2159. Faster Than Light travel has become reality and mankind is expanding beyond the solar system. 
CAPTAIN HAMILTON is being called into action by THE PRESIDENT to find out about a mysterious signal 5000 light years away. 

The world of SPACE HEROES is inspired by the more positive versions of the future and the shows that heavily influenced my childhood - especially Captain Future and Star Trek.
The vision for this project is to bring back the sense of wonder and adventure of real and fictional space travel and the lighthearted fun of old serials. 
The concept is to produce an entertaining series for Youtube with episodes of about 10 minutes length. 
 
THE CAST
 
Robert Picardo: The President

The man, the legend - and of course the doctor from STAR TREK: Voyager. 
__________________________________________
Robert Picardo guest starred on many popular tv-series like  “Stargate Atlantis” and "The Orville"
He has appeared in over two dozen films, among them “Hail Caesar!" "Gremlins 2" and "Total Recall" 
 
 
 
John Detty: Captain Hamilton     

The captain the universe needs.And  maybe also deserves. __________________________________________
John Detty is a career actor of 20 years. He studied at Wright State University, Tshwane University of Technology in South Africa, and ultimately received his BFA in Acting from Ball State University. You may recognize him from Gossip Girl, 30 Rock, Braindead, Unbreakable Kimmy Schmitt, and Blue Bloods. He is a proud member of Actor’s Equity and Sag-Aftra.
 
 
 

Eden Shea Beck: Kaileigh Masterson                                           


Skilled sidekick and pilot. 
__________________________________________
Eden Shea Beck is an actress located in Los Angeles.  She graduated with a film degree from University of Southern California School of Cinematic Arts.  She has appeared in numerous commercials, music videos, film, and television.
 
 
 

Chris Dotson: Professor Grundig                                                  


 
Smartest man alive and inventor of the hyperdrive. Has no humor setting. 
__________________________________________
Chris Dotson is an actor, writer and accomplished cat owner. He has appeared in numerous TV shows over the years, all kinds of commercials, and has a bit of a cult following on YouTube for his David Lynch impression. 
 
 
William Dunz: Radio Host
William Dunz is an awesome stop-motion artist and voice actor. 
 
AND in the future episodes also:
Anthony De Longis 

Anthony has done a lot of Sci-Fi from 5 guest starring appearances on STAR TREK VOYAGER as Maje Culluh, to the original BATTLESTAR GALACTICA, BABYLON 5, OUTER LIMITS, HIGHLANDER the Series, MASTERS OF THE UNIVERSE, SWORD AND THE SORCERER and the cult classic ROAD HOUSE with Patrick Swayze. He's a weapons master, sword expert and taught Michelle Pfeiffer how to use the bullwhip in BATMAN RETURNS.
 
 
                                                                               
THE CREW
 
Christian Eberle is the Producer & Director of this series.

 
We are a group of creative people and VFX artists. Among them ALBERT MARTINEZ who made the amazing Star Trek fan-film  "Chasing the infinite Sky"

 
KATJA VARTIAINEN (co-producer) She's a Master of Fine Arts and creates Matte Paintings, Posters, Storyboards and Concept Art. 

 
German musician DANIEL HARLOFF will compose original music. 
 
HANS ULRICH BAUMSTARK is creating and modelling spaceships and props. 

 
DIRK SANDER is providing us with additional CGI and VFX. 
 

 
  
The Perks !
 
1st Perk,  2e=$2
We Thank You!
 
2nd Perk, 10e=$12
You'll get a Thank You email, and your name in the credits!
 
3rd Perk, 26e=$31
You'll get a Thank You email, and your name in the credits, and this awesome downloadable digital poster of the Space Lancer in 300dpi(=good quality) you can print in  A3=16.5 x 11.7 inches!

You'll get a Thank You email, and your name in the credits, this awesome downloadable digital poster of the Space Lancer in 300dpi(=good quality) you can print in  A3=16.5 x 11.7 inches! AND the t-shirt!

story:
Hello and thank you for taking the time to read our campaign. My name is John Wolfe and I am the writer and producer of Wrongfully Convicted - a first of its kind UK male prison drama series. We were set for production in March this year but with the current Covid crisis we had to put it back until just two months ago. Covid has caused a massive impact on all of our lives and has made it harder for me to self-fund this series but needless to say I have strived on and managed to pay for everything needed to date to help launch the careers of everyone involved. We now however need more of a budget for better locations, props and travel costs among other things.

 

Series Summary

The series follows Vincent Prince, a quiet man from the north east on a night out with his friend - Garry. A series of violent events that were out of their control lead to Vincent being incarcerated for 5 years. We follow Vincent step by step in his life before the events of that evening, the court proceedings and whilst he serves his time in prison. We watch as he witnesses all the horrors of prison and crawls his way to being top dog.

I wrote the series to tell the story of what truly happens in prison. It is written from real inmate’s life stories both past to present and no fabricated life stories.

The production will be made to raise awareness and hopefully rehabilitate people from offending. We also aim to help launch the careers of the actors portraying each role and the crew that are carrying them through it all. As an actor, I understand the difficulty of getting that foot in the door, especially when you aren't too sure how it all works and I am passionate about helping these individuals pursue their passion like I did with mine.

The actors and crew in the production have all been hand-picked to showcase the talent the UK truly has, while creating a one of a kind unique show and some bigger names have come on board to offer their experience and help for the other actors.

We will be looking to take this to a major broadcaster once the pilot episode is made and start a much bigger production with more actors and crew.

What We Need

We expect the series to take 6-9 months to make. As you see from the images we have already started shooting, but to move to the next stage in making this series we need funds now. We seek £10,000 to cover all costs, including UK travel, editing costs, post production, sound and picture grading, etc.

£1,500 towards Camera crew

£1,500 towards Sound

£1,000 to other crew

£4,000 Court room and prison hire.

£1,000 travel expenses for cast

£1,000 Costume and prop hire

We have equipment to shoot the episode, and an enthusiastic network of supporters. We believe strongly in open access and we guarantee to make a free version available of the pilot episode.

Whatever position you hold in respect of crime and punishment, there are hidden stories that need to be told from all sides. This series will tell those stories.

What You Get

We have spent a long time discussing the perks for our campaign and we feel that what we chosen will be warmly welcomed. 

We have a range of different perks including social media shout outs, IMDB Thank You credits, signed security shirt, clapperboards, Executive Producer credits, on set visits and more. Every penny helps in order to make this dream a reality, whilst giving cast and crew valuable experience on set. If more money is raised than the target, these funds will go into making the production bigger and better, although the standard is already at a extremely high. 

The Impact

Wrongfully Convicted is a gripping drama of which will tells the story of what life is really like in UK prisons. We hope for this to not only have a story line of which is gripping and immerses the audience but is also educational - as sometimes visuals are the best ways to understand. 

We have an amazing cast and crew, who have already been working extremely hard to make this show a reality. They have all put their hearts and souls into this project, we hope to give them the opportunity to continue to grow with us and the show by making the pilot the best it can be. This not only gives everyone useful showreel footage, experience and knowledge but also the chance to build relationships within the industry. We believe in giving as many people the opportunity to hone their craft whilst having fun and enjoyment on a professional set. 

We have already won multiple laurels and awards from film festivals for the script of which we hope to win many more. We feel this not only shows the high standard of the script and it's writing but also our professionalism and dedication to Wrongfully Convicted. 

Everyone working on the project has a range of skills and understanding - some professionals, semi-professionals and some new talent in the industry - all of whom have and are working extremely well together, all with the same intent to make Wrongfully Convicted the best it can be. 

Risks & Challenges 

With any production there is a risk, but we feel that the more we film the more we learn. Throughout this process we have all, already learnt a lot and we continue to learn everyday. We use our different experiences both in life and in the industry in order to educate and train each other. Whilst this can be a challenge, it is also a wonderful opportunity to expand our knowledge and share it too. There are so many different challenges of which we have to overcome on any production, all of which we take as a learning opportunity. These challenges include:

Organisation - This is a very big and important challenge of which we focus on a lot. We are aware that organisation can make or break a production. It is extremely important for everyone to know where they have to be and when, what they need to be doing, what costume they need and so on. We believe that organisation is the way to success. 

Shoot Schedule - We have a large cast all shooting on different days and at different times. Having a shoot schedule and sticking to it, is such an important detail in order to keep us running smoothly. 

Safety on Set - This is another challenge of which has our focus. Without health and safety in place we would not be making the show. Ultimately, filming is not more important than someone's life. We would rather not film than risk someone. This is very relevant with Covid-19 where we take the rules and regulations very seriously, whilst keeping a watch of any and all updates. We feel at present this is one of our biggest hurdles but with everyone's amazing attitudes to keep each other safe, we are so far succeeding. We require PPE to be worn, social distancing to be kept in place, hand sanitizer is used as well as hand washing on a regular basis. We check everyone's temperatures and have a very open way of communication should anyone have any concerns or feel the need to discuss. If anyone shows any symptoms or feels unwell before or during their shoot times, they will be assessed by the Covid trained team members in order to keep everyone as safe and updated as possible. Not only is this important for Covid-19 reasons but for everyone's general health, safety and well being. 

Say Hello to the Cast 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will be able to contribute to our fundraiser, financially. We have a great following behind the project so far, through word of mouth. It is of great help and extremely appreciated if you can help us to continue to build our following by sharing our fundraiser far and wide. 

Thank you for taking the time to view and read all about our campaign for Wrongfully Convicted. If you would like to find out more, please head over to our Facebook page by using the link below: 

https://www.facebook.com/Wrongfully-Convicted-118158902921660

To find out more about our cast and crew, please head on over to our IMDb page by using the link below:

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt11361590/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1
