story:
Burn The Witch is an urban fantasy web series set in the modern day United States and centering around a Coven of nine Witches scattered across the country. Through their inherent soul connection and power of astral projection, these Witches are able to communicate, work together, and problem solve across great distances. The series of eleven episodes takes place over the span of two weeks' time and follows the Witches as they battle an unknown enemy who is systematically killing off the members of their Coven. 

The initial concept for Burn The Witch was conceived early in 2020. As the COVID-19 pandemic brought the world to a grinding halt, our production team joined the legions of artists around the world desperately searching for safe and engaging ways of continuing to make accessible and meaningful art.

We began with a series of requirements:

1.) We knew we wanted to make a web series filmed entirely in observation of the shelter in place and social distancing rules dictated by current global circumstances.

2.)We knew we wanted to work with artists from all across the United States.

3.) Finally, we knew that we did not want to rely on Zoom as the vehicle by which our actors connected throughout the story.

With all this in mind, one concept leapt out and took root in our hearts and minds: Magic. 

Using the conceit of astral projection, we are able to collaborate with actors all across the country and still rely on more conventional modes of storytelling.

We are fortunate enough to be collaborating with artists from seven different cities across three separate states. Through the use of meticulous story boarding, extensive planning, and FaceTime, our Director and Director of Photography are able to clearly and effectively direct our actors, regardless of their geographical location. This mode of filmmaking is uncharted territory, and while it presents its own unique challenges, we are more than ready to rise to the occasion! 

You can see a rudimentary example of this filmmaking technique  in our promo video! This video was filmed in our Malibu, Chicago, and Los Angeles Units, using only the filmmaking elements already available in the actor's personal collections. We had an incredible time creating this promo for you all, and cannot wait to begin filming with the proper equipment! This will all be made possible by your generous donations!

We are beyond excited to begin primary filming for Burn The Witch. We have assembled the best possible team to take on this groundbreaking project, and could not be more thrilled to be collaborating with this group of skilled, disciplined, and talented artists!

We thank you for your interest in Burn The Witch, and hope you find yourself able to donate today! Together, we can make this wild Witchy ride a reality! 

 

Our production team first came together while studying Theatre Arts at the Oregon Center for the Arts in Ashland, Oregon. We found that we shared not only cohesive artistic sensibilities, but a fervent passion for producing work based in the tenants of femme empowerment, intersectionality, and the vitality of the human spirit. Since forming our collective, we have produced a multitude of successful projects and are excited to turn our sights to a groundbreaking web series!

 

Martha Thatcher | Actor, Writer, and Director

Martha Thatcher (she/her) is an LA-based actor/creator. Martha is best known for her work on the stage and screen, having appeared on the Oregon Shakespeare Festival stage, as well as on ABC’s “The Middle” and in the upcoming splatstick comedy, “Murder For Dummies,” premiering at the 2020 Screamfest Horror Film Festival. Martha’s passion for character-based work has led her to pursue the production of content that uplifts the voices of those so often silenced by mainstream biases and sensibilities. In addition to her work as both actor and writer, Martha is a classically trained vocalist and a resident artist at the Montgomery Arts House for Music and Architecture in Malibu, CA. She holds a BFA in Performance from the Oregon Center for the Arts at Southern Oregon University, where she graduated Summa Cum Laude as a Susan Carter and Leon Mulling scholar.

 

Katie Herling | Actor, Producer

Katie Herling (she/her) is a Los Angeles based actor and educator. She is best know for her work on stage with nationally renowned directors such as Penny Metropulos, Jim Edmondson, and Scott Kaiser, as well as her work as a youth educator with The California Shakespeare Theater, Kingsmen Shakespeare Company, and  The Quinan Street Project. Katie is a classically trained performer with her BFA in Performance from The Oregon Center for the Arts at Southern Oregon University, and has dedicated her career to the promotion of queer stories through joyous storytelling, especially in classical and youth theater. 

 

Isabella Thatcher | Actor, Producer

Isabella Thatcher (she/her) is a Los Angeles based actor and singer best know for her work with the Malibu Friends of Music. Isabella has toured extensively throughout the continental United States, and was recently featured in the 2020 Malibu Coast Chamber Music Festival as a vocalist and spoken word performer. She is a recent graduate of the Oregon Center for the Arts at Southern Oregon University, having worked with nationally renowned artists such as U. Jonathan Toppo, David Kelly, and Scott Kaiser. Isabella is a cellist and playwright driven to tell exciting and diverse stories on stage and screen.

 

Hannah Fawcett | Actor, Producer

Hannah Fawcett (she/her) is currently based in Salem, OR. She is best known for her work as an actor at the Oregon Shakespeare Festival and as the Artistic Director of Struts & Frets Theatre Company. Hannah is an actor, singer, and teaching artist with a focus on intersectional Shakespeare and classical texts. She holds a BFA in Performance from the Oregon Center for the Arts at Southern Oregon University and is currently a Guest Artist at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. 

 

Acting Company | Burn The Witch

(Pictured left to right, top to bottom: Quinci Freeman-Lytle, Sarah Glasgow, Angela Hernandez, Martha Thatcher, Isabella Thatcher, Hannah Fawcett, Katie Herling, Sarah Brizek, Margaret Chambers, Brianca Knight, John Alan Hulbert, Krista Unverferth, Carlos-Zenen Trujillo, Claire Snyder, Kennedy Cartwright, Jodi Plaia, and Taya Dixon)

Due to the nature of filming Burn The Witch, we will be needing to provide costumes, props, filming equipment, and technologies to teams in Chicago, Los Angeles, Salem, Malibu, Ashland and more.  While we will be launching a secondary campaign to pay for the costs of Post Production, a portion of this fundraiser will be allocated to paying our After Effects Specialist, ensuring that the magic in Burn The Witch lives up to its name!

Please find our budgetary breakdown below. 

$10,000 total budget

$1,423.12 for costumes.

$5,806.59 for equipment.

$1,000 for marketing.

$1,000 for special effects.

$605.25 for props.

$165.04 for overhead.

 

Should you choose to donate to our campaign, possible perks include:

  • A social media shoutout acknowledging your contribution to Burn The Witch!
  • Access to behind-the-scenes footage and outtakes from the set!
  • A spell of your choosing, crafted by a practicing modern Witch!
  • A digital download of the original music composed for the series!
  • Your name featured on the set of Burn The Witch!
  • An original painting by one of the Burn The Witch characters, Ainsley Wildes!

 

In times of strife, people lean into each other and turn to stories for comfort. 

While, our story features a group of femmes battling insurmountable odds, the beating heart of our tale is the indomitable spirit of community. Our characters are facing huge life changes with grief and joy. They face struggles of identity, desire, and betrayal. And through it all, their bond is true as steel, unflinching in the face of calamity. 

Should you choose to donate to our campaign, you will be supporting 20 artists, a groundbreaking project, and a story worth sharing.

Why should you support Burn The Witch? 

  • We are an all-femme producing team with a passion for bringing femme-centered, intersectional voices to the forefront. 
  • Burn The Witch features a brand new twist on classic Witch lore, bringing together elements from traditional folk lore and fairytale with modern sensibilities and an expanded understanding of the magical world. 
  • This production features femme and queer characters in leading roles, giving complexity and agency to characters that might otherwise be overlooked in mainstream media. 
  • We have assembled a dream team for this project. From the actors to our production team and beyond, each of these artists are at the top of their game, and we could not be more thrilled to be working with each and every one of them! 
  • Burn The Witch will be filmed following all current social distancing and shelter in place guidelines. The health and safety of our actors and production team are of the utmost importance to us. 
  • Burn The Witch is eerie, Witchy, and femme-empowering. All the things one could want in the Halloween Season! Lucky for you, it is set to premier in October of 2021! 

 

We thank you for your interest in Burn The Witch, and hope you find yourself able to donate today! Together, we can make Burn The Witch a reality! 

We are sincerely aware that times are hard right now. If you find yourself wanting to support Burn The Witch, but unable to donate at this time, please share our campaign on your social media and help get the word out!

Get on your Facebook, your Insta, your Twitter, and let folks know about Burn The Witch!

Be sure to follow us on social media!

Instagram @burnthewitchseries

Twitter @burnthewitchtv

Tumblr - burnthewitchseries.tumblr.com

Youtube - Burn The Witch Series

 

Thank you so much for spending this time with us!

If you have any further questions, please direct them to our email, burnthewitchseries@gmail.com 

All our best,

Martha Thatcher, Hannah Fawcett, Katie Herling, and Isabella Thatcher

The Burn The Witch Team
story_txt:
Burn The Witch is an urban fantasy web series set in the modern day United States and centering around a Coven of nine Witches scattered across the country. Through their inherent soul connection and power of astral projection, these Witches are able to communicate, work together, and problem solve across great distances. The series of eleven episodes takes place over the span of two weeks' time and follows the Witches as they battle an unknown enemy who is systematically killing off the members of their Coven. 
The initial concept for Burn The Witch was conceived early in 2020. As the COVID-19 pandemic brought the world to a grinding halt, our production team joined the legions of artists around the world desperately searching for safe and engaging ways of continuing to make accessible and meaningful art.
We began with a series of requirements:
1.) We knew we wanted to make a web series filmed entirely in observation of the shelter in place and social distancing rules dictated by current global circumstances.
2.)We knew we wanted to work with artists from all across the United States.
3.) Finally, we knew that we did not want to rely on Zoom as the vehicle by which our actors connected throughout the story.
With all this in mind, one concept leapt out and took root in our hearts and minds: Magic. 
Using the conceit of astral projection, we are able to collaborate with actors all across the country and still rely on more conventional modes of storytelling.
We are fortunate enough to be collaborating with artists from seven different cities across three separate states. Through the use of meticulous story boarding, extensive planning, and FaceTime, our Director and Director of Photography are able to clearly and effectively direct our actors, regardless of their geographical location. This mode of filmmaking is uncharted territory, and while it presents its own unique challenges, we are more than ready to rise to the occasion! 
You can see a rudimentary example of this filmmaking technique  in our promo video! This video was filmed in our Malibu, Chicago, and Los Angeles Units, using only the filmmaking elements already available in the actor's personal collections. We had an incredible time creating this promo for you all, and cannot wait to begin filming with the proper equipment! This will all be made possible by your generous donations!
We are beyond excited to begin primary filming for Burn The Witch. We have assembled the best possible team to take on this groundbreaking project, and could not be more thrilled to be collaborating with this group of skilled, disciplined, and talented artists!
We thank you for your interest in Burn The Witch, and hope you find yourself able to donate today! Together, we can make this wild Witchy ride a reality! 
 

Our production team first came together while studying Theatre Arts at the Oregon Center for the Arts in Ashland, Oregon. We found that we shared not only cohesive artistic sensibilities, but a fervent passion for producing work based in the tenants of femme empowerment, intersectionality, and the vitality of the human spirit. Since forming our collective, we have produced a multitude of successful projects and are excited to turn our sights to a groundbreaking web series!
 


Martha Thatcher | Actor, Writer, and Director
Martha Thatcher (she/her) is an LA-based actor/creator. Martha is best known for her work on the stage and screen, having appeared on the Oregon Shakespeare Festival stage, as well as on ABC’s “The Middle” and in the upcoming splatstick comedy, “Murder For Dummies,” premiering at the 2020 Screamfest Horror Film Festival. Martha’s passion for character-based work has led her to pursue the production of content that uplifts the voices of those so often silenced by mainstream biases and sensibilities. In addition to her work as both actor and writer, Martha is a classically trained vocalist and a resident artist at the Montgomery Arts House for Music and Architecture in Malibu, CA. She holds a BFA in Performance from the Oregon Center for the Arts at Southern Oregon University, where she graduated Summa Cum Laude as a Susan Carter and Leon Mulling scholar.
 


Katie Herling | Actor, Producer
Katie Herling (she/her) is a Los Angeles based actor and educator. She is best know for her work on stage with nationally renowned directors such as Penny Metropulos, Jim Edmondson, and Scott Kaiser, as well as her work as a youth educator with The California Shakespeare Theater, Kingsmen Shakespeare Company, and  The Quinan Street Project. Katie is a classically trained performer with her BFA in Performance from The Oregon Center for the Arts at Southern Oregon University, and has dedicated her career to the promotion of queer stories through joyous storytelling, especially in classical and youth theater. 
 


Isabella Thatcher | Actor, Producer
Isabella Thatcher (she/her) is a Los Angeles based actor and singer best know for her work with the Malibu Friends of Music. Isabella has toured extensively throughout the continental United States, and was recently featured in the 2020 Malibu Coast Chamber Music Festival as a vocalist and spoken word performer. She is a recent graduate of the Oregon Center for the Arts at Southern Oregon University, having worked with nationally renowned artists such as U. Jonathan Toppo, David Kelly, and Scott Kaiser. Isabella is a cellist and playwright driven to tell exciting and diverse stories on stage and screen.
 


Hannah Fawcett | Actor, Producer
Hannah Fawcett (she/her) is currently based in Salem, OR. She is best known for her work as an actor at the Oregon Shakespeare Festival and as the Artistic Director of Struts & Frets Theatre Company. Hannah is an actor, singer, and teaching artist with a focus on intersectional Shakespeare and classical texts. She holds a BFA in Performance from the Oregon Center for the Arts at Southern Oregon University and is currently a Guest Artist at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. 
 
Acting Company | Burn The Witch

(Pictured left to right, top to bottom: Quinci Freeman-Lytle, Sarah Glasgow, Angela Hernandez, Martha Thatcher, Isabella Thatcher, Hannah Fawcett, Katie Herling, Sarah Brizek, Margaret Chambers, Brianca Knight, John Alan Hulbert, Krista Unverferth, Carlos-Zenen Trujillo, Claire Snyder, Kennedy Cartwright, Jodi Plaia, and Taya Dixon)

Due to the nature of filming Burn The Witch, we will be needing to provide costumes, props, filming equipment, and technologies to teams in Chicago, Los Angeles, Salem, Malibu, Ashland and more.  While we will be launching a secondary campaign to pay for the costs of Post Production, a portion of this fundraiser will be allocated to paying our After Effects Specialist, ensuring that the magic in Burn The Witch lives up to its name!
Please find our budgetary breakdown below. 
$10,000 total budget
$1,423.12 for costumes.
$5,806.59 for equipment.
$1,000 for marketing.
$1,000 for special effects.
$605.25 for props.
$165.04 for overhead.

 
Should you choose to donate to our campaign, possible perks include:

A social media shoutout acknowledging your contribution to Burn The Witch!
Access to behind-the-scenes footage and outtakes from the set!
A spell of your choosing, crafted by a practicing modern Witch!
A digital download of the original music composed for the series!
Your name featured on the set of Burn The Witch!
An original painting by one of the Burn The Witch characters, Ainsley Wildes!

 


In times of strife, people lean into each other and turn to stories for comfort. 
While, our story features a group of femmes battling insurmountable odds, the beating heart of our tale is the indomitable spirit of community. Our characters are facing huge life changes with grief and joy. They face struggles of identity, desire, and betrayal. And through it all, their bond is true as steel, unflinching in the face of calamity.

Burn The Witch features a brand new twist on classic Witch lore, bringing together elements from traditional folk lore and fairytale with modern sensibilities and an expanded understanding of the magical world. 
This production features femme and queer characters in leading roles, giving complexity and agency to characters that might otherwise be overlooked in mainstream media. 
We have assembled a dream team for this project. From the actors to our production team and beyond, each of these artists are at the top of their game, and we could not be more thrilled to be working with each and every one of them! 

Burn The Witch will be filmed following all current social distancing and shelter in place guidelines. The health and safety of our actors and production team are of the utmost importance to us. 

Burn The Witch is eerie, Witchy, and femme-empowering. All the things one could want in the Halloween Season! Lucky for you, it is set to premier in October of 2021! 

 
We thank you for your interest in Burn The Witch, and hope you find yourself able to donate today! Together, we can make Burn The Witch a reality! 


We are sincerely aware that times are hard right now. If you find yourself wanting to support Burn The Witch, but unable to donate at this time, please share our campaign on your social media and help get the word out!
Get on your Facebook, your Insta, your Twitter, and let folks know about Burn The Witch!
Be sure to follow us on social media!
Instagram @burnthewitchseries
Twitter @burnthewitchtv
Tumblr - burnthewitchseries.tumblr.com
Youtube - Burn The Witch Series
 
Thank you so much for spending this time with us!If you have any further questions, please direct them to our email, burnthewitchseries@gmail.com All our best,Martha Thatcher, Hannah Fawcett, Katie Herling, and Isabella ThatcherThe Burn The Witch Team

story:
WHO ARE WE?

L120 Productions is a group comprised of talented and passionate indie filmmakers, who are always eager to create and produce quality content. We’ve always had a burning desire to pursue a career in film/video production; this desire eventually allowed us all to meet one another in a post-secondary program.

 

COMPLACENCY

We managed to shoot, edit and release the pilot episode by creatively working around having limited equipment and no budget.

With your help, we can ensure that everyone involved with this project feels more than satisfied with their work and efforts. The biggest contribution being that these talented individuals can receive some contribution for taking time off from their jobs, and devoting their personal time to seeing the completion of this mini-series.  

Realistically, we may have set our budget goal too high. We've proven to ourselves that we're capable of shooting the series with no budget at all, but again, having some additional funds would help with the overall quality. 

Where is the money going?

  • $100 for each series cast member, per episode (starting from Episode 2) = $2300
  • $50 for each additional crew member, per episode (starting from Episode 2) = $750
  • $150 for food, per episode (starting from Episode 2) = $750
  • $120 for gas, per episode (starting from Episode 2) = $600
  • $400 for festival submission fees

Total = $4800 (realistic/ideal goal)

If our goal is reached, about 75% of the funding received will go to paying the cast and crew, 20% towards any additional equipment, supplies, or locations needed, and 5% towards food and gas.

If we do not reach our desired budget goal, we’ll use the funding we do receive to still pay everyone involved with Complacency, and re-budget for equipment and food costs.

Our last big project completed, was a thirty minute post-apocalyptic short film titled "SURREAL". shot over four days with a crew of four people, a cast of three, and no budget. As a group, we were more than satisfied with our finished film, and happy to watch its view count rise on YouTube.

 

CREW

Mark Riddle - Creator/Writer/Director/Executive Producer

Mark Riddle is a Canadian indie filmmaker, born and raised in Calgary, Alberta. The lead creative mind behind Complacency, as well as one of the series Executive Producers. Mark challenges himself in filmmaking by trying to craft stories, characters, and settings that are different from his previous work. While always having a clear vision of the story, this allows Mark to confidently to direct the cast and crew without getting lost in the chaos of production. His main goal is to ensure the finished film is something of quality, and that everyone involved is more than satisfied with their work.

  • Creator/Executive Producer - Episodes 1-6
  • Director - Episodes 1 and 2
  • Writer - Episodes 1, 2 and 4

 

Ximena Rios - Writer/Director/Executive Producer

Ximena Rios is a Mexican-Canadian indie filmmaker, from Acapulco, Mexico. She has a unique eye for capturing excellently framed shots that are not only cinematic, but also help with the overall progression of the characters and story. A very methodical and meticulous filmmaker, she will not settle for anything less than what she envisions. "Good Enough" are two words she never uses together.

  • Executive Producer - Episodes 1-6
  • Director - Episode 2 and 6
  • Writer - Episode 6

 

Devin Gibb - Writer/Director/Cinematographer

Devin Gibb is a Canadian indie filmmaker, from Leslieville, Alberta. His talent behind camera is shown throughout his work, as he pushes himself to craft the best possible shots and lighting to really sell the tone/mood for a scene. He will look at any problem, and figure out the best possible solution without sacrificing or having to compromise. This problem solving mindset carries over on to his talents as a director as well.

  • Cinematographer - Episodes 1-6
  • Writer/Director - Episode 3

 

Kimberly Giebler - Director/Producer/Camera Operator

Kimberly Giebler is a Canadian indie filmmaker, based in Calgary, Alberta. Having skills in writing, directing, producing, cinematography, editing, and colour, Kimberly is a very well rounded filmmaker. A perfectionist when it comes to her craft, and a natural problem solver, she stops at nothing to ensure she achieves her vision to 100%. Strong willed and determined, she never leaves a project thinking "what if?" or "if only".

  • Director/Producer - Episode 4
  • Camera Operator/Steadicam - Episode 1

 

Ty Javos - Actor/Writer/Director/Producer

Ty Javos is a Canadian indie filmmaker based in Calgary, Alberta. He has a strong "can-do" mindset which truly allows him to lead/direct the cast and crew with confidence. Having worked on multiple projects, both in front and behind camera, Ty knows how to complete a production as smooth and clean as possible while maintaining a clear vision of a well crafted story.

  • Producer - Episodes 1-6
  • Writer/Director - Episode 5
  • Actor - Episode 2 and 5

story:
Welcome to the Cops and Monsters: Uprising Production Funds Campaign! This campaign has been created so we can raise at least £1000 to allow us to start shooting the brand new episode of Cops and Monsters: Uprising!

If we can reach £4000 then we will be able to shoot episode 2, "Codename: Hybrid" which is written by BAFTA winning writer Laura Anne Anderson.

We hope we can not only raise the £4000 to shoot episode 2, but also get as close as possible to £25,000 so we can shoot all remaining 5 x 20 minute episodes.

Episode 1, "Remembrance", by Debbie Moon, has been funded and shot. We are currently editing our new episode but you can watch a special preview below:

 

"Cops and Monsters" is an on-going, award winning supernatural police thriller set in a near-future Scotland. When vampires, werewolves and zombies come out of hiding, the country breaks out into war and riots with both sides fighting for control. Eventually the First Minister and the heads of the vampire and werewolf societies meet and form a treaty that will allow humans and supernaturals to co-exist. As such a police team, the Paranormal Investigation Team Scotland, are put into place to police and protect both sides.

Series 2 sees Maya Hedges infiltrating the S.P.I.D.E.R.S, a militant police force now in charge of the supernatural community, and working with known werewolf assassin Alexis Smith, they will try to bring down Jonathan Clark, the Minister of Justice who is plotting to exterminate all supernatural life.

"There’s a full moon over Glasgow, and chaos is in the air.

A Monster roams a supernatural zone, mutilating and eating anyone it finds. Alexis is tormented by a vision of The Cult of Many Faces, and worries that her confinement is driving her to madness. Maya battles hostile SPIDERS colleagues and a bigoted new directive from sleazy Minister Clark in her mission to uphold the law. When an old acquaintance ambushes Maya outside SPIDERS HQ, desperately seeking her help, things go from bad to worse.

Werewolf therapist Jenny Connor is badly shaken – she was part of a programme aimed at helping supernaturals, and something has gone terribly wrong. A Monster has been unleashed – THE Monster.

Distrusting SPIDERS and with nobody else to turn to, Jenny enlists Maya and Alexis to help her find the Monster and put an end to the violence. The group travel to Zone 3, the Werewolf ghetto, to investigate.

Between the full moon, Maya’s split loyalties, The Cult’s hounding of Alexis, and a dark secret kept by Jenny, it’ll be a wonder if they make it out of Zone 3 alive."

Last year the first series of the show was distributed on Amazon Prime and we hope series 2 will be available there too.

The show has been screened at numerous festivals around the world and we have won a couple of awards, including Best Web Series at the Los Angeles Film Festival.

Your money will be spent on the following:

  • Hiring actors to star in each episode 
  • Hiring professional TV and film crew members to work on the show 
  • Book locations for each episode 
  • When required, travel and accommodation for guest stars 
  • Film and camera equipment  
  • Regular and special effects makeup 
  • Costumes for each episode 
  • Props to be made and bought 
  • Expenses for travelling to locations 
  • Catering for each shoot date 
  • Editing of each episode 
  • Visual effects for each episode 
  • Sound design Music compositions for each episode 
  • Subtitles for each episode 

If we reach our initial goal of £1000 then we can set up the InDemand setting which will allow us to keep this IndieGoGo campaign running and hopefully raise funds up to £25,000 so we can produce the remaining 5 x 20 minute scripts of series 2!

The rest of the series will be penned by James T Harding ("Cupid of the Clyde"), Simon Underwood ("Wolfblood"), Philip Lawrence (Big Finish's "Doctor Who") and Fraser Coull (Cops and Monsters showrunner).

Series 1 starred a mix of established and local actors from Scotland and the rest of the UK as well as stars such as Leona Kate Vaughan (Wolfblood/Stella), Simon Weir (Trainspotting 2), Sophie Aldred (Doctor Who), James Payton (Captain America), Rachel Teate (Wolfblood), Caitlin Blackwood (Doctor Who), Katrina Bryan (Nina and the Neurons) and James Mackenzie (Raven). We intend to bring back some of these guest stars alongside some brand new faces to the world of Cops and Monsters!

 

Series 1 is currently available on Amazon Prime but you can watch our pilot, one of our minisodes, "Trapped", below, and our new series 2 minisode, "Day One":

 
 

Series 1 varied in duration, with earlier episodes lasting between 7 and 15 minutes, with the remaining episodes around 24 minutes. Series 2 will be 6 x 20 minute episodes.

 

Scotland television is absent of anything like Cops and Monsters. The only sci-fi/supernatural show we have is Doctor Who, and that's made in Wales! We'd like to make our mark and join the ranks of Being Human, In the Flesh, The Fades, Primeval, Torchwood and beyond, and create an exciting, dangerous world of vampires, werewolves and zombies.

Having raised the funds to shoot 8 episodes for volume 1, our growing fanbase on Facebook and Twitter we know there is an appetite for a show like this, and so far we've had glowing reviews on Amazon Prime.

Not only does making a show like this allow you, the viewer, a chance to watch a brand new supernatural police thriller, but it allows us to make it for you. All of our actors, writers and crew who will be hired to work on the show will be a direct result of YOUR support.

We're also making it to prove that it can be done and that people will watch it. Hopefully catching the eye of producers, commissioners, and other important TV people out there, maybe leading to the show being re-booted with a proper television budget, or more work for the team who work so hard on the show.

We can't make this show without you, the fans, so if you can help us in anyway at all, it'll bring us closer to producing all of series 2.

 

In episode 2 we'll have our series regulars back - Ellen Patterson, Billy Kirkwood, Innes Anderson and Chris Bain. They'll be joined by our new cast members Stephen Purdon (River City) and Helen Cuinn.

Joining us for episode 2 will be Nina and the Neuron's star Katrina Bryan, who has already starred in 2 episodes of series 2, and River City actress Louise McMenemy will be joining us new regular character, werewolf Ava McIntyre! 

 
 

 We're offering a wide range of perks from Cops and Monsters in return for your support. These include:

  • A signed script from volume 2 
  • Volume 1 on DVD or blu-ray with special features
  • Plus episodes 1 and 2 of our brand new series 
  • A3 posters which include our original design by Stuart Manning or our "The Cult and Alexis" poster. 
  • Personalised PITS badges. Your name, your face, assigned to an area of the Paranormal Investigation Team Scotland 
  • An official Cops and Monsters keyring 
  • A digital copy of the Cops and Monsters Volume 1 Soundtrack with bonus tracks from Series 2  
  • IMDb associate, producer and executive producer credits for series 2. 
  • Cops and Monsters Series 1 Poster Mug

Prophecy Girl, who provide geek clothing for women, are our first official sponsors! We will be approaching other businesses around the world seeking sponsorship. They'll be credited at the end of an episode, with their banner and link to their website on our official sponsors page.

If you'd like to sponsor us, please email copsandmonsters@sillyweefilms.co.uk.

 
 
You can share the link to this campaign on your social media accounts, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, whatever you can think of! Tell your family, your friends, anybody who will listen, about our show.
 
Get them watching it on Amazon Prime and then get them here to see if they want any of our perks to make it happen.
 
 

Risks and challenges

If we don't hit our funding goal, we'll be unable to commission any of our new episodes.

We will of course look into further sources of funding, but this would be a brilliant start for us as it means we will have at least 2 new episodes of series 2, which can be used to bring in further funding and support for the rest of the series.

When an old acquaintance ambushes Maya outside SPIDERS HQ, desperately seeking her help, things go from bad to worse.Werewolf therapist Jenny Connor is badly shaken – she was part of a programme aimed at helping supernaturals, and something has gone terribly wrong. A Monster has been unleashed – THE Monster.Distrusting SPIDERS and with nobody else to turn to, Jenny enlists Maya and Alexis to help her find the Monster and put an end to the violence. The group travel to Zone 3, the Werewolf ghetto, to investigate.Between the full moon, Maya’s split loyalties, The Cult’s hounding of Alexis, and a dark secret kept by Jenny, it’ll be a wonder if they make it out of Zone 3 alive."Last year the first series of the show was distributed on Amazon Prime and we hope series 2 will be available there too.The show has been screened at numerous festivals around the world and we have won a couple of awards, including Best Web Series at the Los Angeles Film Festival.Your money will be spent on the following:
Hiring actors to star in each episode 
Hiring professional TV and film crew members to work on the show 
Book locations for each episode 
When required, travel and accommodation for guest stars 
Film and camera equipment  
Regular and special effects makeup 
Costumes for each episode 
Props to be made and bought 
Expenses for travelling to locations 
Catering for each shoot date 
Editing of each episode 
Visual effects for each episode 
Sound design Music compositions for each episode 
Subtitles for each episode 
If we reach our initial goal of £1000 then we can set up the InDemand setting which will allow us to keep this IndieGoGo campaign running and hopefully raise funds up to £25,000 so we can produce the remaining 5 x 20 minute scripts of series 2!The rest of the series will be penned by James T Harding ("Cupid of the Clyde"), Simon Underwood ("Wolfblood"), Philip Lawrence (Big Finish's "Doctor Who") and Fraser Coull (Cops and Monsters showrunner).Series 1 starred a mix of established and local actors from Scotland and the rest of the UK as well as stars such as Leona Kate Vaughan (Wolfblood/Stella), Simon Weir (Trainspotting 2), Sophie Aldred (Doctor Who), James Payton (Captain America), Rachel Teate (Wolfblood), Caitlin Blackwood (Doctor Who), Katrina Bryan (Nina and the Neurons) and James Mackenzie (Raven). We intend to bring back some of these guest stars alongside some brand new faces to the world of Cops and Monsters! Series 1 is currently available on Amazon Prime but you can watch our pilot, one of our minisodes, "Trapped", below, and our new series 2 minisode, "Day One": 

 
Series 1 varied in duration, with earlier episodes lasting between 7 and 15 minutes, with the remaining episodes around 24 minutes. Series 2 will be 6 x 20 minute episodes.
 


Scotland television is absent of anything like Cops and Monsters. The only sci-fi/supernatural show we have is Doctor Who, and that's made in Wales! We'd like to make our mark and join the ranks of Being Human, In the Flesh, The Fades, Primeval, Torchwood and beyond, and create an exciting, dangerous world of vampires, werewolves and zombies.
Having raised the funds to shoot 8 episodes for volume 1, our growing fanbase on Facebook and Twitter we know there is an appetite for a show like this, and so far we've had glowing reviews on Amazon Prime.
Not only does making a show like this allow you, the viewer, a chance to watch a brand new supernatural police thriller, but it allows us to make it for you. All of our actors, writers and crew who will be hired to work on the show will be a direct result of YOUR support.
We're also making it to prove that it can be done and that people will watch it. Hopefully catching the eye of producers, commissioners, and other important TV people out there, maybe leading to the show being re-booted with a proper television budget, or more work for the team who work so hard on the show.
We can't make this show without you, the fans, so if you can help us in anyway at all, it'll bring us closer to producing all of series 2.

 

In episode 2 we'll have our series regulars back - Ellen Patterson, Billy Kirkwood, Innes Anderson and Chris Bain. They'll be joined by our new cast members Stephen Purdon (River City) and Helen Cuinn.

Joining us for episode 2 will be Nina and the Neuron's star Katrina Bryan, who has already starred in 2 episodes of series 2, and River City actress Louise McMenemy will be joining us new regular character, werewolf Ava McIntyre!   
 We're offering a wide range of perks from Cops and Monsters in return for your support. These include:

A signed script from volume 2 
Volume 1 on DVD or blu-ray with special features
Plus episodes 1 and 2 of our brand new series 
A3 posters which include our original design by Stuart Manning or our "The Cult and Alexis" poster. 
Personalised PITS badges. Your name, your face, assigned to an area of the Paranormal Investigation Team Scotland 
An official Cops and Monsters keyring 
A digital copy of the Cops and Monsters Volume 1 Soundtrack with bonus tracks from Series 2  
IMDb associate, producer and executive producer credits for series 2. 
Cops and Monsters Series 1 Poster Mug


Prophecy Girl, who provide geek clothing for women, are our first official sponsors! We will be approaching other businesses around the world seeking sponsorship. They'll be credited at the end of an episode, with their banner and link to their website on our official sponsors page.
If you'd like to sponsor us, please email copsandmonsters@sillyweefilms.co.uk.

 

 
You can share the link to this campaign on your social media accounts, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, whatever you can think of! Tell your family, your friends, anybody who will listen, about our show.
 
Get them watching it on Amazon Prime and then get them here to see if they want any of our perks to make it happen.
 

 

Risks and challenges
If we don't hit our funding goal, we'll be unable to commission any of our new episodes.
We will of course look into further sources of funding, but this would be a brilliant start for us as it means we will have at least 2 new episodes of series 2, which can be used to bring in further funding and support for the rest of the series.

story:
Project Summary

It's difficult to write an original script for a TV show.  Everything's been done!  Vampires... Zombies... Teen angst... Super heroes, etc. etc. etc.  If you had asked me 6 months ago..."Dean, let's do a TV show about your life and what you do", I wouldn't have believed it.  But a few months ago, I was telling my high school buddy, screenwriter David Partridge, about a particularly strange TV project I was working on and he thought it would make a great story.  One thing led to another, and soon it was "Why not do a whole series for TV"!  And voila!!

I'm Dean R Baker, owner of Post FX Digital Studios.  This campaign is for a fun show, told by some amazing actors and a very talented crew in Central Florida. 

Central Florida doesn't get a whole lot of play in entertainment (unless you are Disney or The Golf Channel).  We have terrific production schools pumping out talented crew and incredibly talented actors (that actually can act).  Together we have all pitched in our time and energy to create what I see as something unique and original.  The story is about my struggle and those around me... We want to be noticed!

Pilot Synopsis

I am DB A Comedy Series Pilot (Season 1, Episode 1) Synopsis -
 DB is a struggling filmmaker and production studio owner in Central Florida, he’s constantly challenged by the demanding world of TV commercials, music videos, TV shows and almost anything to do what it takes to stay afloat.  He leads a small group of wannabe filmmakers, and actors all seeking the same Hollywood dream of becoming famous and doing the work for that noteworthy IMDB credit.  Every time success is within grasp of this group, it slips away or implodes before their eyes.  Crazy situations put to our crew by demanding clients fuel the constant day-to-day fires and outrageous situations within this production group.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We're not looking for camera gear...we got that... but money you donate to this campaign will go to the care and feeding of the cast and crew.  It will be spent on location permits, wardrobe, props and makeup.  If there's any left...film festival submissions and beyond that... all those donating their time should be compensated. 

I've been in this crazy business for enough years to know that when you say you're going to do something... you better do it!  

The Impact

My goal is to pitch the series to a Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, HBO, Showtime, etc.  To show the world that Central Florida needs to be recognized as a talented resource for entertainment TV and it would give my life story a bit of happy ending (not that its ending anytime soon).

Risks & Challenges

The only risk is the time that my cast and crew spends on this project.  The challenge is to produce it without cutting too many corners and to keep all the volunteers engaged and committed.  This is why we need your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Tell everyone to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Share it on Facebook!
  • If you have any connections with distribution...contact me personally.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
[Versão em português mais abaixo]

Dear Family, Friends, and Potential Viewers,

XO! (pronounced "SHō" and meaning “awesome” or “cool”in Portuguese ) is a television/web series based in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. It is a docudrama (type of reality show) that follows me, CEO and Executive Producer of David Laster Productions, as I build an entertainment production company using local crews and talent. Come follow the creation of my company as we produce our first project, a dance-centric, live performance spectacular that is sure to be an entertainment experience you won’t want to miss. You’ll get a first-hand view of the process of hiring production crew and designers, auditioning talent, planning shows, and rehearsing, all in a run-up to the season’s big final performance.

Professional lives and personal lives will be exposed, as a group of dancers and their choreographer, Carlton Wilborn (one of Madonna’s most famous dancers) work hard to create a entertainment experience of unparalleled proportions. Come along to find out if Carlton, the dancers, and I can overcome the many obstacles of daily life in Rio de Janeiro, both mental and physical, to create an unforgettable final performance that will catapult the company to greater heights!

Here’s where your funding will go!

 

 

So please join me for this journey of learning, growing, fun and let's make it big together. With your help, we will be able to finance most of our production costs, but mostly, you'll get a fantastic show to savor and enjoy.

If you can't help monetarily, you can still help by spreading the word. Please share this page with ALL of your friends and family, and anyone that may be interested in this project.

You can follow us on:

Facebook

Instagram

David Laster Productions

Casa Cool Beans

Thank you so much for your help!

---

xoxo

David Laster

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

About the Principles

 

David Laster - CEO & Co-Founder

David was born and raised in the suburbs of Chicago, Illinois, but quickly decided he did not like the cold!  Fast forward a bunch of years and today you will find David juggling, running a newly formed entertainment production company and owning the TripAdvisor #1 rated Bed & Breakfast in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil (note: not cold!), Casa Cool Beans. At an early age, he was drawn to technology and film production; both of which have been a part of his professional journey.  Yes, he was one of “those kids” who purchased one of the first Apple computers and has been an enthusiast ever since.  A bachelor’s degree from Columbia College Chicago was the launching pad to teach technology (still cold).  After several more gigs, he found his passion was not for teaching and quickly shifted his focus to media production, obtaining a master’s degree in film/video production at American University in Washington DC (not too cold). So, don’t call him a nerd; he has evolved to be more of a geek!!!  Taking the leap with his partner, Lance Horsley, in 2010 to move to Rio de Janeiro to open Casa Cool Beans, he had finally found a temperate climate where he could thrive (warm).  Now he is proudly building his production house from scratch and soon he will be blessing the world with his vision of live performances! (hot!)

Lance Horsley - President & Co-Founder

Lance Horsley is one of those people who always aims high. He expects more out of life because he knows anything is possible if you’re willing to work hard to achieve it. It’s an optimistic philosophy he discovered over the course of a grueling, 10-day wilderness survival trek in southern Utah. After surviving being stuck in the middle of nowhere with only a knife, a piece of flint, and a single piece of fruit per day, he realized that he could do anything he set his mind to. What began as a journey of self-discovery where he found within himself a tireless drive to succeed and a genuine sense of perseverance, turned out to be a personal epiphany that changed his life forever.

What truly sets Lance apart is his unwavering commitment to excellence. Lance excelled in the hospitality industry for 20 years before making a name for himself in real estate by opening his real estate company in 2003. From San Francisco to New York, The Four Seasons Hotel to the Waldorf Astoria, Lance was the ultimate concierge, consistently recognized for always going out of his way to provide guests with the ultimate personal service and attention. It was within the unique atmosphere of success cultivated by The Four Seasons Hotel that Lance’s drive for perfection really began to take flight.  Lance now juggles his Washington, DC real estate company, where he is consistently rated in the top 1% of all Realtors in the USA, and owning and operating his dream Bed & Breakfast, Casa Cool Beans; rated #1 Bed & Breakfast in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil on TripAdvisor since its opening 8 years ago!

Carlton Wilborn - Creative Director & Choreographer

Choreographer

Mr. Wilborn has directed Music Videos and shows for major corporate entertainment events, with Cisco Systems and EDS. His dynamic choreography has brought excitement to many music video artists, most notably Janet Jackson and Madonna. His choreography was also celebrated in the Loose Interpretation commercial campaign for Levi Straus, as well as, in the motion picture Yellow. His one-of-a-kind “Dance” Master Classes have been appreciated throughout North America.

Dancer

Wilborn began his professional career as a principal dancer with the world renowned Hubbard Street Dance Company in Chicago. Combining street savvy and urban sensibilities with an inherent elegance and commitment to integrity, he naturally commands the stage. As a dancer he is a force to be reckoned with; and as a choreographer, director, and dance instructor, he guides the pursuits of fellow artists with the same level of excellence and creativity he brings to his own craft.

After working as a soloist for five consecutive years in Ruth Page’s Nutcracker, and as a resident guest artist for nine months with Ballet Met, Carlton followed his internal compass to Hollywood. He rapidly became recognized as one of the city’s premiere dancers, landing the position of Madonna’s pillar of strength for the Blond Ambition and The Girlie Show tours.

Throughout his career, he has worked with many distinguished artists and entertainment legends such as Herb Alpert, Natalie Cole, Janet Jackson and Michael Jackson; choreographer Twyla Tharp; legendary photographer Herb Ritts; Tony Award-winning director George C. Wolfe, and powerhouse producer Joel Silver, among many others.

Life Coach

Over the past decade Mr. Wilborn has studied many different modalities of spiritual practices to support him in serving others; His work as a life coach allows him to do private coaching, various group workshops and corporate events. His work as a motivational speaker; promoting courage, healing and freedom, has enabled him to connect with nearly a dozen sober-homes and non-for-profit organizations throughout California.

The website www.livingfrontandcenter.com is the go-to place, for all of his empowering services and merchandise.

[VERSÃO EM PORTUGUÊS ABAIXO]

Caros amigos e futuros espectadores,

XO! (pronunciado "show" e que significa "incrível" ou "legal" em português) é uma série de TV e web filmada no Rio de Janeiro. Trata-se de uma série documental que acompanha a mim, diretor e produtor executivo da David Laster Produções, enquanto construo uma produtora de entretenimento usando equipes e talentos locais.

Venha acompanhar a criação da minha empresa à medida que produzimos nosso primeiro projeto: uma espetacular apresentação de dança que certamente será uma experiência de entretenimento que você não perde por esperar.

Você terá uma visão em primeira mão de todo o processo envolvido na contratação de uma equipe de produção e design, audição de talentos, planejamento de shows, ensaios e coreografias, tudo em um ritmo crescente que vai culminar no grande espetáculo da temporada: com a ajuda de nomes como o festejado estilista Hermes Inocêncio e o coreógrafo Carlton Wilborn – conhecido por seu trabalho com Madonna –, nove dançarinos irão mostrar se conseguiram superar os muitos obstáculos – mentais e físicos – da vida diária carioca, para atingir seus sonhos.

Para onde vai seu financiamento:

 

Junte-se a mim nesta jornada de aprendizado, crescimento e entretenimento. Com o seu apoio, vamos conseguir financiar a maior parte de nossos custos de produção, mas no fim das contas é você quem ganha um fantástico show para saborear e se divertir.

Por outro lado, se você não pode ajudar financeiramente, por favor compartilhe esta página com TODOS os seus amigos e familiares, ou qualquer um que possa estar interessado neste projeto.

E siga-nos em nossas redes sociais:

Facebook

Instagram

David Laster Productions

Casa Cool Beans

Muitíssimo obrigado por sua ajuda!

Grande abraço,
David Laster
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Nossos princípios

 

David Laster - CEO & Co-fundador

David nasceu e cresceu nos subúrbios de Chicago, Illinois, mas rapidamente decidiu que clima frio não era a sua praia! Avance alguns anos e hoje ele pode ser visto dando um duro danado em sua nova produtora de entretenimento, além de ser proprietário do Bed & Breakfast mais bem avaliado do Trip Advisor, o Casa Cool Beans, no Rio de Janeiro (dica: nada frio!). Quando mais jovem, David foi seduzido pelo canto da sereia do cinema e da tecnologia, áreas que fizeram parte de sua jornada profissional. Sim, ele era um daqueles “nerds” que comprou um dos primeiros computadores da Apple e desde então é um de seus maiores entusiastas. Um diploma de bacharel do Columbia College Chicago foi o ponto de partida para que ele ensinasse tecnologia (ainda frio), mas depois de algumas idas e vindas, ele descobriu que sua paixão não era o ensino e rapidamente mudou seu foco para a produção de mídia, obtendo um mestrado em cinema na American University em Washington DC (não muito frio). Portanto, não o chame de nerd – ele está mais para um geek! Em 2010, junto com seu parceiro Lance Horsley, ele se mudou para o Rio de Janeiro para abrir a Casa Cool Beans, onde finalmente encontrou um clima propício para desabrochar sua criatividade (morno). Tanto que atualmente ele está construindo sua produtora a partir do zero e logo vai presentear o mundo com seu olhar visionário para os mais variados espetáculos (quente!).

Lance Horsley - Presidente & Co-Fundador

Lance Horsley é uma daquelas figuras que sempre sonha alto. Ele espera mais da vida porque sabe que tudo é possível se você estiver disposto a trabalhar duro para alcançar seus objetivos. Trata-se de uma filosofia otimista com a qual ele se deparou tempos atrás: numa exaustiva jornada de sobrevivência de 10 dias, em pleno deserto do sul de Utah, ele teve de sobreviver no meio do nada com apenas uma faca, um pedaço de sílex e uma única fruta por dia. Foi então que ele percebeu que era capaz de fazer qualquer coisa, que não havia limites para sua força de vontade. Assim, o que começou como uma jornada de autodescoberta, onde ele encontrou dentro de si um impulso incansável para ter sucesso e um verdadeiro senso de perseverança, acabou se revelando uma epifania que mudou sua vida para sempre.

O que realmente diferencia Lance é o seu compromisso inabalável com a excelência. Ele logo se destacou no setor hoteleiro por mais de vinte anos, antes de fazer seu nome no setor imobiliário ao fundar sua corretora de imóveis em 2003. De São Francisco a Nova York, do Four Seasons ao Waldorf Astoria, Lance foi considerado melhor concierge, reconhecido por sempre fazer dos mais improváveis malabarismos para oferecer aos clientes o melhor serviço. Foi então nessa atmosfera única e bem-sucedida do Four Seasons Hotel que o desejo de perfeição de Lance realmente começou a decolar. Ele agora dirige sua imobiliária em Washington DC, onde é consistentemente avaliado como o melhor no concorrido mercado de corretores de imóveis nos EUA, além de também ser proprietário do Bed & Breakfast Casa Cool Beans, a menina de seus olhos e não por acaso número 1 no Trip Advisor desde sua inauguração, oito anos atrás!


Carlton Wilborn - Diretor Criativo & Coreógrafo

Coreógrafo
Carlton já dirigiu videoclipes e shows para grandes eventos de entretenimento corporativo, em empresas como a Cisco Systems e a EDS. Sua coreografia dinâmica trouxe emoção para muitos artistas e performances, mais notavelmente Janet Jackson e Madonna (de quem ele foi um dos principais dançarinos e cuja trajetória pode ser vista no documentário "Strike a Pose"). Sua coreografia também foi celebrada na campanha comercial Loose Interpretation para a marca Levi's, bem como no filme "Yellow". Suas master classes “Dance” foram apreciadas em toda a América do Norte.

Dançarino
Carlton começou sua carreira profissional como dançarino principal da renomada companhia Hubbard Street Dance, em Chicago. Combinando sensibilidade urbana com uma elegância natural e um compromisso com a integridade, ele naturalmente comanda o palco. Como dançarino, ele é uma força da natureza; e como coreógrafo, diretor e instrutor de dança, ele orienta seus colegas artistas com o mesmo nível de excelência e criatividade típicos de seu próprio ofício.

Depois de atuar como solista por cinco anos consecutivos no Quebra-Nozes de Ruth Page, e como artista residente por nove meses no Ballet Met, Carlton seguiu sua bússola interna rumo a Hollywood. Ele rapidamente se tornou reconhecido como um dos principais dançarinos da cidade, conquistando uma posição sem igual ao lado de Madonna, nas turnês Blond Ambition e The Girlie Show.

Ao longo de sua carreira, Carlton ainda trabalhou com muitos artistas ilustres e lendas do entretenimento, como Herb Alpert, Natalie Cole, Janet Jackson, Michael Jackson, Twyla Tharp, o lendário fotógrafo Herb Ritts, o diretor ganhador do Tony Awards, George C. Wolfe, e o grande produtor Joel Silver, além de muitos outros.

Coach
Na última década, Carlton estudou diferentes modalidades de práticas espirituais para auxiliá-lo. Seu trabalho como coach permite que ele faça coaching privado, várias oficinas de grupo e eventos corporativos. Além disso, seu trabalho como palestrante motivacional, estimulando a coragem e cura através da liberdade, lhe permitiu se associar a quase uma dúzia de clínicas de reabilitação e ONG’s por toda a Califórnia.

O site www.livingfrontandcenter.com é o local ideal para conferir todo o seu trabalho com motivação e espiritualidade.

Pre-Production Photos / Fotos da pré-produção

What began as a journey of self-discovery where he found within himself a tireless drive to succeed and a genuine sense of perseverance, turned out to be a personal epiphany that changed his life forever.What truly sets Lance apart is his unwavering commitment to excellence. Lance excelled in the hospitality industry for 20 years before making a name for himself in real estate by opening his real estate company in 2003. From San Francisco to New York, The Four Seasons Hotel to the Waldorf Astoria, Lance was the ultimate concierge, consistently recognized for always going out of his way to provide guests with the ultimate personal service and attention. It was within the unique atmosphere of success cultivated by The Four Seasons Hotel that Lance’s drive for perfection really began to take flight.  Lance now juggles his Washington, DC real estate company, where he is consistently rated in the top 1% of all Realtors in the USA, and owning and operating his dream Bed & Breakfast, Casa Cool Beans; rated #1 Bed & Breakfast in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil on TripAdvisor since its opening 8 years ago!Carlton Wilborn - Creative Director & ChoreographerChoreographerMr. Wilborn has directed Music Videos and shows for major corporate entertainment events, with Cisco Systems and EDS. His dynamic choreography has brought excitement to many music video artists, most notably Janet Jackson and Madonna. His choreography was also celebrated in the Loose Interpretation commercial campaign for Levi Straus, as well as, in the motion picture Yellow. His one-of-a-kind “Dance” Master Classes have been appreciated throughout North America.DancerWilborn began his professional career as a principal dancer with the world renowned Hubbard Street Dance Company in Chicago. Combining street savvy and urban sensibilities with an inherent elegance and commitment to integrity, he naturally commands the stage. As a dancer he is a force to be reckoned with; and as a choreographer, director, and dance instructor, he guides the pursuits of fellow artists with the same level of excellence and creativity he brings to his own craft.After working as a soloist for five consecutive years in Ruth Page’s Nutcracker, and as a resident guest artist for nine months with Ballet Met, Carlton followed his internal compass to Hollywood. He rapidly became recognized as one of the city’s premiere dancers, landing the position of Madonna’s pillar of strength for the Blond Ambition and The Girlie Show tours.Throughout his career, he has worked with many distinguished artists and entertainment legends such as Herb Alpert, Natalie Cole, Janet Jackson and Michael Jackson; choreographer Twyla Tharp; legendary photographer Herb Ritts; Tony Award-winning director George C. Wolfe, and powerhouse producer Joel Silver, among many others.Life CoachOver the past decade Mr. Wilborn has studied many different modalities of spiritual practices to support him in serving others; His work as a life coach allows him to do private coaching, various group workshops and corporate events. His work as a motivational speaker; promoting courage, healing and freedom, has enabled him to connect with nearly a dozen sober-homes and non-for-profit organizations throughout California.The website www.livingfrontandcenter.com is the go-to place, for all of his empowering services and merchandise.[VERSÃO EM PORTUGUÊS ABAIXO]Caros amigos e futuros espectadores,XO! (pronunciado "show" e que significa "incrível" ou "legal" em português) é uma série de TV e web filmada no Rio de Janeiro. Trata-se de uma série documental que acompanha a mim, diretor e produtor executivo da David Laster Produções, enquanto construo uma produtora de entretenimento usando equipes e talentos locais.Venha acompanhar a criação da minha empresa à medida que produzimos nosso primeiro projeto: uma espetacular apresentação de dança que certamente será uma experiência de entretenimento que você não perde por esperar.Você terá uma visão em primeira mão de todo o processo envolvido na contratação de uma equipe de produção e design, audição de talentos, planejamento de shows, ensaios e coreografias, tudo em um ritmo crescente que vai culminar no grande espetáculo da temporada: com a ajuda de nomes como o festejado estilista Hermes Inocêncio e o coreógrafo Carlton Wilborn – conhecido por seu trabalho com Madonna –, nove dançarinos irão mostrar se conseguiram superar os muitos obstáculos – mentais e físicos – da vida diária carioca, para atingir seus sonhos.Para onde vai seu financiamento: Junte-se a mim nesta jornada de aprendizado, crescimento e entretenimento. Com o seu apoio, vamos conseguir financiar a maior parte de nossos custos de produção, mas no fim das contas é você quem ganha um fantástico show para saborear e se divertir.Por outro lado, se você não pode ajudar financeiramente, por favor compartilhe esta página com TODOS os seus amigos e familiares, ou qualquer um que possa estar interessado neste projeto.E siga-nos em nossas redes sociais:FacebookInstagramDavid Laster ProductionsCasa Cool BeansMuitíssimo obrigado por sua ajuda!Grande abraço,David Laster       Nossos princípios David Laster - CEO & Co-fundadorDavid nasceu e cresceu nos subúrbios de Chicago, Illinois, mas rapidamente decidiu que clima frio não era a sua praia! Avance alguns anos e hoje ele pode ser visto dando um duro danado em sua nova produtora de entretenimento, além de ser proprietário do Bed & Breakfast mais bem avaliado do Trip Advisor, o Casa Cool Beans, no Rio de Janeiro (dica: nada frio!). Quando mais jovem, David foi seduzido pelo canto da sereia do cinema e da tecnologia, áreas que fizeram parte de sua jornada profissional. Sim, ele era um daqueles “nerds” que comprou um dos primeiros computadores da Apple e desde então é um de seus maiores entusiastas. Um diploma de bacharel do Columbia College Chicago foi o ponto de partida para que ele ensinasse tecnologia (ainda frio), mas depois de algumas idas e vindas, ele descobriu que sua paixão não era o ensino e rapidamente mudou seu foco para a produção de mídia, obtendo um mestrado em cinema na American University em Washington DC (não muito frio). Portanto, não o chame de nerd – ele está mais para um geek! Em 2010, junto com seu parceiro Lance Horsley, ele se mudou para o Rio de Janeiro para abrir a Casa Cool Beans, onde finalmente encontrou um clima propício para desabrochar sua criatividade (morno). Tanto que atualmente ele está construindo sua produtora a partir do zero e logo vai presentear o mundo com seu olhar visionário para os mais variados espetáculos (quente!).Lance Horsley - Presidente & Co-FundadorLance Horsley é uma daquelas figuras que sempre sonha alto. Ele espera mais da vida porque sabe que tudo é possível se você estiver disposto a trabalhar duro para alcançar seus objetivos. Trata-se de uma filosofia otimista com a qual ele se deparou tempos atrás: numa exaustiva jornada de sobrevivência de 10 dias, em pleno deserto do sul de Utah, ele teve de sobreviver no meio do nada com apenas uma faca, um pedaço de sílex e uma única fruta por dia. Foi então que ele percebeu que era capaz de fazer qualquer coisa, que não havia limites para sua força de vontade. Assim, o que começou como uma jornada de autodescoberta, onde ele encontrou dentro de si um impulso incansável para ter sucesso e um verdadeiro senso de perseverança, acabou se revelando uma epifania que mudou sua vida para sempre.O que realmente diferencia Lance é o seu compromisso inabalável com a excelência. Ele logo se destacou no setor hoteleiro por mais de vinte anos, antes de fazer seu nome no setor imobiliário ao fundar sua corretora de imóveis em 2003. De São Francisco a Nova York, do Four Seasons ao Waldorf Astoria, Lance foi considerado melhor concierge, reconhecido por sempre fazer dos mais improváveis malabarismos para oferecer aos clientes o melhor serviço. Foi então nessa atmosfera única e bem-sucedida do Four Seasons Hotel que o desejo de perfeição de Lance realmente começou a decolar. Ele agora dirige sua imobiliária em Washington DC, onde é consistentemente avaliado como o melhor no concorrido mercado de corretores de imóveis nos EUA, além de também ser proprietário do Bed & Breakfast Casa Cool Beans, a menina de seus olhos e não por acaso número 1 no Trip Advisor desde sua inauguração, oito anos atrás!Carlton Wilborn - Diretor Criativo & CoreógrafoCoreógrafoCarlton já dirigiu videoclipes e shows para grandes eventos de entretenimento corporativo, em empresas como a Cisco Systems e a EDS. Sua coreografia dinâmica trouxe emoção para muitos artistas e performances, mais notavelmente Janet Jackson e Madonna (de quem ele foi um dos principais dançarinos e cuja trajetória pode ser vista no documentário "Strike a Pose"). Sua coreografia também foi celebrada na campanha comercial Loose Interpretation para a marca Levi's, bem como no filme "Yellow". Suas master classes “Dance” foram apreciadas em toda a América do Norte.DançarinoCarlton começou sua carreira profissional como dançarino principal da renomada companhia Hubbard Street Dance, em Chicago. Combinando sensibilidade urbana com uma elegância natural e um compromisso com a integridade, ele naturalmente comanda o palco. Como dançarino, ele é uma força da natureza; e como coreógrafo, diretor e instrutor de dança, ele orienta seus colegas artistas com o mesmo nível de excelência e criatividade típicos de seu próprio ofício.Depois de atuar como solista por cinco anos consecutivos no Quebra-Nozes de Ruth Page, e como artista residente por nove meses no Ballet Met, Carlton seguiu sua bússola interna rumo a Hollywood. Ele rapidamente se tornou reconhecido como um dos principais dançarinos da cidade, conquistando uma posição sem igual ao lado de Madonna, nas turnês Blond Ambition e The Girlie Show.Ao longo de sua carreira, Carlton ainda trabalhou com muitos artistas ilustres e lendas do entretenimento, como Herb Alpert, Natalie Cole, Janet Jackson, Michael Jackson, Twyla Tharp, o lendário fotógrafo Herb Ritts, o diretor ganhador do Tony Awards, George C. Wolfe, e o grande produtor Joel Silver, além de muitos outros.CoachNa última década, Carlton estudou diferentes modalidades de práticas espirituais para auxiliá-lo. Seu trabalho como coach permite que ele faça coaching privado, várias oficinas de grupo e eventos corporativos. Além disso, seu trabalho como palestrante motivacional, estimulando a coragem e cura através da liberdade, lhe permitiu se associar a quase uma dúzia de clínicas de reabilitação e ONG’s por toda a Califórnia.O site www.livingfrontandcenter.com é o local ideal para conferir todo o seu trabalho com motivação e espiritualidade.Pre-Production Photos / Fotos da pré-produção

story:
Awakening: The Series Teaser 

 

Greetings! My name is Sarah Goodwin and I'm the creator of Awakening: The Series. This series began as a project for my web series class (originally titled 'Haunted') in 2016 while I was attending NYCDA. I wanted to continue the story and really give this story the best chance at being told. I've worked extremely hard with a fantastic team behind me to finally have the pilot episode wrapped at the end of July of 2018. Currently the pilot is in post and I am making plans to continue with the rest of the first season.

I've always had a passion for film and within the last seven years I have taken many steps forward to improve my skills and bring my ideas to life. Even though I know the in and outs of filmmaking and I completed my first short film "Broken Home" in 2016 I am still a student working towards my film certificate. Since I had to work on my series alone during my web series class I learned how to do everything in front and behind the camera to complete four episodes which was the required assignment. I am currently the producer, writer, director and lead in the series along with many other hats that need to be filled when the time calls for it.

Any contribution made to my series goes towards:  

Crew

Cast

Locations

Crafty

Wardrobe

Props

Makeup

Special FX

Equipment and Equipment Rental

Transportation

Post Production

Editing

Sound

Sound Post

Marketing

Any contribution made is greatly appreciated. A share about the campaign is deeply appreciated as well. I am constantly working on this series to improve it and I hope as episodes are released you enjoy the story and the journey.
